loans.name: Sylivester

texts.en:
Sylivester is a 27-year-old motorcycle operator at Voi, Kenya. He is a father of one child and has been in this business for the last two years. He is doing well.

This is his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business after paying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to purchase an additional motorcycle and the anticipated profit he will invest in his second business, real estate, He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle and hopes this will enable him to get more profits.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is an entrepreneur residing in Badian, Cebu. She is 27 years old with three children, ages 4, 8 and 9. Her business consists of selling rice, sugar, oil, beans, soda, and other snack foods. The business is the source of her daily income. Pamela needs to make further investments in her store, but she is struggling with funds.

This time, she is requesting a loan to buy additional items or merchandise to sell like toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap. With this Pamela will be able to augment her stock to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales. Pamela hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 25 year old motorcycle transporter at Voi Kenya. He is a single man who supports his parents and has been in this business for the last four years doing well.

This is his second borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business, he will use the loan to service his motorcycle and the anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own several motorcycles in future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be happy. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Alfrick

texts.en:
Alfrick is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel costs. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to have five more motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is married and has one child. She works at the municipality and also in order to make extra money she makes yoghurts and sellls them. She buys milk on the way home from work, makes yoghurt in small pots and deliver them on the way to work in the mornings. Ususally her customers are her friends at work and their friends. In the summertime her customers are people who came for summer to their summer houses. With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy pots.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Bahar Hanın evli, bir çocuk annesi. Belediyede çalışıyor ve aynı zaman da ek gelir elde edebilmek için beş yıldır yoğurt mayalayıp satıyor. İş çıkışı evine giderken aldığı sütü akşamları kaynatıp güveçler de mayalıyor ertesi gün işe giderken siparişlerini teslim ediyor. Genel de müşterileri iş arkadaşları ve onların çevreleri. Yaz aylarında da yazlıkçı müşterileri oluyor. Aldığı ikinci kredisi ile güveç kap alacak.

loans.use: to buy pots for her home made yoghurt.

loans.name: Scolah

texts.en:
Scolah is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, fruits, and cereals. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of some goods.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
The above client his a repeat borrower. He is married with 3 children and his main business is transportation and has done it for the last 10 years to and from the city center aross Kampala.

He is applying for a loan of 2,500,000/= to buy another vehicle to increase his incomes.
He is a hard working and honest man whose dream is to own more taxis to increase his incomes.
Charles poses with the UGAFODE credit staff in the photograph(left to right)

loans.use: to buy a motor vehicle.

loans.name: Erick Alberto

texts.es:
Erick, de 33 años de edad, estudio bachillerato Industrial, está acompañado y su pareja se encarga de cuidar a los tres hijos que tienen juntos.

Erick, desde hace varios años se ha dedicado ha trabajar instalando cielos falsos y tabla roca; este trabajo lo aprendió porque tenía necesidad de trabajar para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y tuvo que aprenderlo, ahora tiene dos personas que le ayudan a hacer los trabajos que les asigna.

Erick, necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas como escalera, martillos, entre otros, de esa forma podrá hacer mejor su trabajo y tendrá más contratos.

Erick, sueña con comprar los materiales para instalaciones y también desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Erick is 33 years old, and received a diploma from an Industrial high school. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the three children they have together.

He has worked for a few years installing drop ceilings and drywall. He learned this trade because he needed to work to provide daily for his family and he had to learn it. He now has two people who help him do the jobs they are assigned to.

He needs the loan in order to buy tools such as a ladder, hammers, and others. In this way he will be able to improve his work and get more jobs. He dreams of buying materials for installations and also wishes to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a ladder, hammers, and others.

loans.name: Vipaji Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her late 30's, is a divorcee with five children, and three of them are in school, while others are grown up. She has been running two projects, selling clothes door-to-door and selling bricks, for two years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase the clothes stock and to make bricks to sell. She dreams of expanding her business. Sophia will share this loan with her loan group, VIPAJI, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the clothes stock and to make bricks to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. Experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Janet access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector.

With your loan, Janet’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 56-year-old, woman from Badian, a municipality in Cebu. She has been raising hogs for 30 years, not only piglets to grow, but also a sow that produces piglets. Loreta is excited because she can anticipate a better income with her sow.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplements for her sow. This way, she can expect that her sow will grow healthy and produce healthy piglets in the coming months. She hopes that eventually her business will be more sustainable and will increase her profits. Loreta's previous loans were successfully repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a 44-year-old woman and a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest child is 11 years old. Her only wish in the future is to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to send all her children to school. Nelia and her family lives in a town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 21 years, since they started their married life. Thus, they work hard together to provide the needs of their children, especially to give them good education. In order to increase their earnings, they also operated a chainsaw that gives them extra income. Lastly, Nelia is asking for a bigger amount of loans to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing weights and fishing knot (serve as the baseline of the fishing net) that will help them enhance their catch.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights and fishing knot.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenny is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jenny has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a farming woman and a fighter, pushing ahead at age 26. She is a very hard-working and self-driven farmer who is based in Kiminini, a remote village in Kitale. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives.Ruth also has a side business (grocery selling)

Ruth is happily married and blessed with two children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling milk and crop farming.

She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Kitale area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business.

Ruth is a member of Weseta self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Bornes is 49 years old and is a married mother of six children. She conducts dairy and crop farming on her one acre piece of land. To earn a better income, she engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the eight years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

As Bornes can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Your loan will help Bornes clients to focus on production, rather than sales. Bornes family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved incomes and elevated livelihood.

Bornes has hopes of being able to progress as a farmer and hopes to have a more stable income. Her positive attitude and the desires to get ahead demonstrate in this individual a great willingness to improve herself, and she hopes for a favorable response to her request. Be inspired and loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kubwinya Group

texts.en:
The sudden silence in the house is an indication that there is a power cut. This is frustrating for Hildah for many reasons. She hopes that the power will be back in the evening so that she can provide the much needed lighting for her broiler chickens. For broiler chickens to reach a good weight, they need to constantly feed even during the night. So during winter months the lights not only help in their feeding but provide necessary heating. The power cuts affect her seriously especially during the slaughtering time when her chickens have grown and are ready for consumption. She can no longer store dressed chickens for long periods in her freezer as she might lose them to the long hours of load shedding. Hildah has a very good poultry business and also keeps rabbits for sale.

Hildah started the poultry business in the year 2000. She used to keep free range chickens and guinea fowls in her fowl runs as a source of meat for her family. Family and friends encouraged her to keep poultry as a business as she seemed to have a good hand at poultry rearing. She decided to transform her large garage which was not used as a fowl run. She still kept free range chickens and guinea fowls but in her old fowl runs as it is not advisable to mix them with broiler chickens as broilers are very sensitive to many things. She sought advice from agricultural officers and workers from respected poultry on how to rear broilers. They helped her with proper feeding and medicine schedules to help her. Hildah normally keeps 300 chickens at a time in batches of hundreds in different stages.

Hildah is a happily married mother to one school going son who is doing his secondary education. She is a member of Kubwinya group which consists of four ladies who have a shared business history and who have been involved in joint income generating projects before. The group attended all training sessions at Thrive actively participating and sharing their knowledge with members of other groups. The group was given a combined first loan of $1900.

Hildah is planning to use her loan to add more batches to her chickens and have 5 batches at different stages of growth. She also wants to buy more doe rabbits so they help her in growing her rabbit numbers. Rabbit meat is a healthy delicacy that is wanted by traditional restaurants and also loved by the health conscious. In future Hildah would love to purchase a plot where she can have large numbers of chickens and rabbits and other types of edible birds like quail and turkeys so that she can provide healthy meat for all tastes.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens she breeds.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
The above client has been with UGAFODE Nakasero Branch since 2014. Her business, she sales ladies clothing and she has done the business for 6 years. She is married and has 3 children and only 2 attend school.

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000/= to restock her business for bigger market and also increased sales and profit. She appreciates the Kiva support and partnership.
Pictured is Rema with the UGAFODE credit officer at her business.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 28 years old married woman. She lives with her husband and 3 years old child in Senaki district. Nana is unemployed. The family lives in poverty. Each member of the family gets small pension from government as they are refugees. This is not enough to cover everyday costs and Nana decided to start a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3200 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of used clothes and will begin trading business.
Nana hopes that the business will be profitable and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.
She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading used clothes in order to generate income.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, who is in her mid 30's, is married with three kids who are still in school. She has been running her daily activities by depending on several businesses, running a bar, a wholesale shop, and a beauty salon, for three years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.

This will be Miriam's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock and has managed to repay all her loans successfully. She was so happy with the loans and appreciates lenders’ for the support of their group. She used the profits to buy a plot of land, to pay her workers, loan repayments, and to pay school fees for her three kids and covered her household expenses.

Miriam will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products, and the best selling drinks in her bar and to increase on the wholesale shop stock. She dreams of owning a warehouse for selling beer to retail customers. Miriam will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products, and the best selling drinks in her bar, and also to increase on the wholesale shop stock.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Rani to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 46 years old, married woman doing a business with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.  She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessitates of life. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man with 45 years living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. His business is buying and selling produce mainly maize and beans. He ventured into business in order to meet the family needs and improve his income. His business vision is to expand his business to greater heights and build a house despite the challenge of changes in prices. James is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
The above picture presents Ann, a mother of two who has been practicing agriculture for the last 10 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers and she is viewed as a mentor in her village. She lives together with her children in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which is known for banana plantations for export.

Her primary income sources are eggs and milk. Generating an income through selling harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of labour is a major challenge for Ann. She also keeps a dairy cow. Before joining Juhudi, Ann could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Mwinathia. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learnt about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva and their mission of transforming people’s life.

Ann is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Ann will buy quality farm implements such as fertilizers, seeds and pesticides that will boast her crop production.
Through this loan she will be able to boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children. Ann knows that with the help of Juhudi Kilimo, and the Kiva staff and lenders, her dreams will be realized.Lend to her to keep her big smile.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizers,seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo, who is 24 years old, is a young man who lives in Tetritskaro district. He has a mother and a father. His father works as a cattleman and earns 500 GEL monthly. Sergo was unable to find a stable job, as he has only a secondary education and there is high unemployment in the region. So, he has started to work as a private worker in railway construction and generates his own income.

Sergo wants to join the family business as an additional source of income for the family's well-being. He has sought credit from local financial institutions. The startup program is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. It enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2,100 GEL to purchase two milk cows. After the cows are purchased the family will start producing and selling dairy products: cheese and yogurt. They will also use the milk products to feed their family.

Sergo and his family will be very thankful for the financial support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows to start dairy farming.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma sells quinoa and potatoes. Irma decided to get divorced, and now she will be taking care of her three children alone. Irma needs a loan to buy more quinoa to resell. Irma will appreciate it if you can help her again. Irma's husband is not living with her any more.

loans.use: to buy quinoa.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida is a farmer from Untesti village, Ungheni region. She is 37 years old and has four daughters: the eldest of them is a student, the second is a pupil, and the youngest daughters go to kindergarten. Zinaida's husband is a constructor.

Zinaida has raised animals more than six years. She has horses, cows, sheep, goats, and hens. The whole family helps on the farm. Zinaida sells agricultural goods every week: milk, cheese, and cream. It’s a good addition to the family's income.

The stables are made of sticks, and Zinaida wants to build stone stables because the winters are cold in Moldova. Zinaida will use this loan to build stone stables for sheep and goats.

loans.use: to build stone stables for animals.

loans.name: Haneefan

texts.en:
Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 8 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged our Haneefan to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation. Haneefan is 52 years old. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Evir

texts.en:
Evir lives with his family. He is a married man and a father of four kids, with two of them are going to school. Evir sells milk; he learned about this business when he was a kid.

He is also a mason, but he would like to give all of his attention to the dairy business, so he needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He hopes you can help him. Evir is assisted by his wife, and the couple have a lot of hope in the future.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Ever

texts.en: Ever works as a clerk at a bank.  He works hard and he is a person with discipline so he has no trouble at work.  Ever is living with his family and he would like to help his parents. Ever needs a loan to buy furniture for his family. His parents bought used furniture many years ago. Ever had to throw away that furniture because there was no way to fix it. Ever loves and helps his parents a lot. He hopes you can trust him.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his family

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 19 year old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her mother who represents the main income source in the family to be able to enhance their way of living. As for her, she is only focusing on her study. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her university study fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva to continue her education, her only target.

loans.use: to pay her university study fees

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Félix de 51 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno propio, tiene su esposa y tiene tres hijos que depende de ellos los cuales se encuentran estudiando uno en el nivel primario, otro en el nivel secundario y el mayor en la universidad, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Muyupampa. Su principal actividad del señor Felix es la producción de maní ya que cuenta con capacitación en la fundación Intercultural NOR SUR. Es por eso que requiere el financiamiento que será destinado para la compra de semilla y agroquímicos y construcción de alambrado, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad por lo tanto podrá generar nuevos ingresos ya que en la zona se tiene un buen rendimiento de esta actividad y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir con sus hijos.
texts.en: Félix, 51 years old, lives and works currently at home and on his own land. He has his wife and three children who depend on them, they are students, one at the primary level, another at the secondary level, and the oldest at the university. They live in the department of Chuquisaca, in the municipality of Muyupampa. Felix's primary work is producing peanuts since he has training with the intercultural foundation NOR SUR. For this, he needs the loan that will be used to purchase seeds and agrochemicals and to build wire mesh, with the purchase of this he will begin his work and will be able to generate new income since in this zone this work is well-developed, and to improve the living conditions in his home and daily living with his children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agrochemicals and to build wire mesh to improve his peanut production and generate, in this way, better income for his family.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores de edad, ella no tiene parientes en el extranjero, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras desde hace más de 30 años, lo atiende con ayuda de una empleada, trabaja de 5:30 am. a 6:00 pm., el puesto de ventas tiene muy buena ubicación, aprendió el oficio por la necesidad de generar mayores ingresos para el sustento familiar.
Invertirá en variedad de frutas y verduras frescas, tendrá recursos para resurtir su negocio cada vez que sea necesario, además comprara insumos agrícolas para cultivar maíz, considera que así atenderá mejor a sus clientes y tendrá mejores circunstancias económicas.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio funcionando y generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two adult children. She doesn't have relatives abroad, she has worked selling fruits and vegetables for over 30 years. She serves customers with the help of an employee and works from 5:30 am to 6:00 pm. The sales stand is in a very good location, and she learned the trade by necessity to generate more income to support her family.

She will invest in a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, she will have resources to restock her business each time it is necessary. In addition she will purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn, she thinks that in this way she will serve her customers better and will have better economic circumstances.

Her dreams are to keep her business running and generate more earnings.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, she will have resources to restock her business whenever it is necessary.

loans.name: Concepcion De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Concepción, es una mujer de cuarenta y siete años emprendedora y luchadora, que se dedica a la fabricación de ropa y zapatos artesanalmente. Su fábrica está ubicada en su casa y cada prenda de vestir que sale de allí lleva en ella su esfuerzo y dedicacion.
En este momento Concepción solicita un credito para comprar más materia prima tales como tela, hilo, cuero entre otros, aprovechando que se acerca la temporada navideña, de la cual espera obtener muy buenas ganancias para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Concepción is a forty-six year old woman, enterprising and determined, who works making clothing and shoes by hand. Her shop is located in her house and each article of clothing that comes out of it carries in it her efforts and dedication.

At this time, Concepción asks for a loan to purchase raw materials such as fabric, thread, leather, and more, taking advantage of the Christmas season that approaches, from which she hopes to get very good earnings to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as fabric, thread, leather, and more.

loans.name: Çiğdem

texts.en:
Çiğdem is single. She runs a cafe of her own by the sea. In the summertime her customers are people coming to their summer houses and on winter time she has regular customers. With her first loan she bought table cloths. She is now using her fifth loan. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy roofing material for her cafe. She wants to renew itself all the time, so she wants to cover her cafe in order to prevent from heat in summers and from cold in winters.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Çiğdem hanım bekar. Dört yıldır sahil de kendine ait cafe işletiyor. Yazın gezmeye gelen tatilcilerle kalabalıklaşan cafesi kışın devamlı müşterilerine hizmet veriyor. İlk mikro kredisi ile masa örtüleri diktiren Çiğdem Hanım bizden beşinci kredisini kullandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile cafe sine toplu malzeme alacak. Sürekli kendini yenilemek, cafesinin üstünü kapayıp yazın sıcakdan kışın soğukdan korunacak şekilde tadilat yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to cover the roof of her cafe.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luis es casado y tiene dos hijas, él es pastor de una iglesia y los pobladores lo quieren mucho, en ese sector no hay luz eléctrica y actualmente utilizan una planta de combustible para generar luz, pero el señor Luis desea cambiarla por un sistema solar ya que la planta consume mucho combustible y tienen que estar acarreando el combustible y cuando tienen culto o lecturas no pueden hacer bien las actividades ya que la planta hace demasiado ruido y los miembros de la iglesia no escuchan tienen que estar gritando, por tal razón don Luis está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistemas solar el cual será instalado en la iglesia. Comenta el señor Luis que con la compra de este sistema solar no habrá ruido y no se estará comprando combustible y les servirá también a sus hijas ya que están estudiando y podrán hacer las tareas por las noches, además el podrá planear y leer la Biblia con su esposa. Don Luis estaría agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar que vendrá a ser de gran beneficio para la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis is married and has two daughters. He is the pastor of a church and the town people love him very much. In that part of town there isn't any electric lighting and they currently use a generator for light. Mr. Luis wants to change to a solar power system because the generator consumes a lot of fuel and they have to move the fuel. When they have worship or lessons they can't do their activities well because the generator makes too much noise. The members can't hear and he has to yell, so Don Luis is requesting a loan to buy a solar powered system to install in the church.  

Mr. Luis says that the solar power won't make noise and they won't have to buy fuel. It will also help his daughters who are in school and will be able to do homework at night. He will also be able to plan and read the Bible with his wife.  Don Luis is grateful for the opportunity to get this loan to buy a solar power system that will be a great benefit to the community.

loans.use: to install a 200 watt solar power system with 6 lights and 2 batteries.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Some years back she was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then through loans from Kashf Foundation she has initiated her business of hand embroidery. Shabana is 38 years old, married woman; shown in the photo with her husband. She has 2 children. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Shabana closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a repeat client with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd, applying for a loan of UGX 4,000,000. She is a married lady with children.

She is also a businesswoman who owns a small hardware retail shop, which she runs along with her husband. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000. However, she is faced with the challanges of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

Her future expectations are to open branches in different surbubs in Kyegera and Nsangi town council.

loans.use: to purchase glass, cement, and tiles for re-sale to clients.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are butcheries. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate animal feeds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds and more goats. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and more goats.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her husband and two children, who both go to school. She sells milk and has a contract with a milk plant. Her husband is an experienced mason.

Elizabeth needs a loan to buy a milking cow for her business. it is important for her to deliver the milk on time; otherwise, the milk plant will cancel the contract. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow for her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and beauty products. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, beauty products items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, beauty products items

loans.name: Jaime Osmeri

texts.es:
Jaime, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono y fertilizantes para continuar cultivando granos básicos, considera que con el respaldo económico que le da la institución ha podido salir adelante hasta la fecha.
Para Jaime y su familia el estilo de vida que hoy tienen es con menos necesidades, pues el financiamiento anterior le permitió tener una cosecha más abundante y mejores ventas, manifiesta no tener problemas económicos o de salud.
texts.en:
Jaime seeks a new loan to buy manure and fertilizers to continue growing basic grains. He reasons that with the economic backing the institution gives him he has been able to move forward until today.

Jaime and his family have less need in their current lifestyle, since the prior loan allowed him to have a more abundant harvest and better sales. He professes to have no economic or health problems.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to continue growing staple grains.

loans.name: Light Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Fatu is a member of Light Solidarity Group (see group picture; Fatu stands second from the right). She sells slippers. Fatu has been selling slippers for the past 30 years. She uses the proceeds from her business to pay for her child’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Fatu and the other group members of Light Solidarity Group are requesting their first loan. Fatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Fatu will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase three more bales of slippers for her business.

Fatu is 36 years old, married, and has one child, age 15 years old. Fatu hopes that her business will continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her child well.

Fatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more three bales of slippers for her business.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta tercer grado, no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos en los que vivían sus padres, está acompañada y junto con su pareja tiene 2 hijos, de 24 y 22 años de edad, los cuales ya están acompañados y su esposo trabaja como empleado.

María, se dedica a trabajar en la platanera desde hace varios años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus amigos y decidió hacerlo porque necesitaba ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, para llegar a su trabajo camina 1 kilómetro y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para elabaorar lácteos.

María, sueña con comprar un vehículo para trasladarse hacia su trabajo y también instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda porque no tiene.
texts.en:
María, 42 years old, is a homemaker. She went to school up to the third grade, and did not continue her education due to her parents' lack of economic resources. She is partnered and with her partner has 2 children, ages 24 and 22, who are partnered already and her husband works as an employee.

María has worked growing bananas for some years. She learned this work from her friends and decided to do it because she needed to help her partner with the household expenses. To get to her work she walks 1 kilometer and her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm.

María needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow to make dairy products.

María dreams of purchasing a vehicle to get to her work and also of installing electricity in her house because they don't have it.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yessica Suleyma

texts.es:
Yessica, de 20 años de edad, está estudiando bachillerato los fines de semana, está soltera y vive con sus padres y dos hermanos más.

Yessica, se dedica a la crianza de pollo y de cerdos desde hace poco tiempo, porque este trabajo lo realizaba su madre y de ella aprendió, pero aparte de eso también percibe ingresos de la venta de productos por catalogo.

Yessica, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado para pollos y cerdos.

El sueño de Yessica, es mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos y tener la oportunidad de seguir estudiando para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yessica, 20 years old, is going to secondary school on the weekends. She is single and lives with her parents and two other siblings.

Yessica has worked raising chickens and pigs for a little while, because her mother did this work and she learned it. But, aside from this, she also gets income from selling products from catalogs.

Yessica needs the loan to purchase concentrated feed for chickens and pigs.

Yessica's dream is to improve her business and get more income and to have the opportunity to continue her schooling to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio is married he has his own house and he sells milk and he needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Julio is married and his wife helps him with the business.  Julio is healthy and he wants to work harder, so that is why he needs your help, because he would like to have a bigger farm in the future

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Na We Gree Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Adamsay is a Four-three years old business woman. She is a member of Na We Gree solidarity group, which has three members. (see group picture, Adamsay in the middle).

Six years ago Adamsay established her used clothing business to support her child in her schooling. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food for her child. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 7pm.
“Na We Gree” group needs a total loan of 4,000,000SLL. Adamsay is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL which she will use to buy one bale of use clothing for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Adamsay is married with one child aged thirteen and a school going child.
In the feature, Adamsay plan to save more money to provide for her child’s university education. She believes educating her child to university level will better the lives of her family.

Adamsay and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen es dueña de un comedor, ella es viuda y vive con sus hijos, los cuales ya son adultos y no dependen de ella y no recibe ayuda económica de otros parientes, en su establecimiento ofrece desayunos y almuerzos, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde.
Piensa invertir el capital en la compra de frijoles, arroz, aceite, maíz, verduras, carnes, etc., le será de utilidad para ofrecer un menú más atractivo a sus clientes, espera que los resultados sean de beneficio para incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.
Su visión es tener una cartera de clientes más grande y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Carmen is the owner of an eatery. She is a widow and lives with her children, who are now adults and no longer depend on her. She receives no economic support from other relatives. In her establishment she offers breakfasts and lunches. She serves her customers from six in the morning until two in the afternoon.

She plans to invest the capital in the purchase of beans, rice, oil, corn, vegetables, meats, etc., which will be useful in offering a more attractive menu to her customers. She hopes that the results will be beneficial in increasing her sales and income. Her vision is to have a larger customer base and to repay her debt.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, corn, vegetables, meats, etc., which will be useful in offering a more attractive menu to her customers.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, vive con su familia formada por su esposo de 70 años de edad, su hija de 49 años de edad y dos nietos de 21 y 16 años de edad, ella aporta en los gastos de su hogar, su negocio consiste en elaborar antojitos como pasteles, yuca, enchiladas y otros para vender, elabora su venta por las tardes en su casa.
Comprará materia prima como yuca, papas, aceite, arroz, etc., contara con todo lo necesario para preparar la venta, considera que le ayudara a trabajar por una larga temporada y a tener un negocio más competitivo.
Sus sueños son apoyar a sus nietos para que puedan estudiar y crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta lives with her family, which is comprised of her 70 year old husband, her 49 year old daughter, and her 21 year old and 16 year old grandchildren. She contributes to the household expenses. Her business is making snacks like pies, yucca, enchiladas, and other items to sell. She makes the food she sells in the afternoons at her house.

She will buy raw material like yucca, potatoes, cooking oil, and rice, etc. She will have everything that is needed to prepare for the sales. She feels that this will help her to work for a long time, and it will help her to have a more competitive business.

Her dreams are to support her grandchildren so that they are able to go to school and to grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like yucca, potatoes, cooking oil, and rice, etc. in order to have everything needed to prepare for sales.

loans.name: Rosalba Elena

texts.es:
Rosalba, de 43 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y junto a su esposo tiene 3 hijos de 24, 20 y 18 años de edad, de los cuales 2 trabajan y 1 estudia pero los 3 viven con ella y su esposo trabaja como empleado en un restaurante.

Rosalba, trabaja como empleada domestica en una vivienda cerca de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 12:00 del mediodía y por la tarde cuida sus animales, decidio dedicarse a desempeñar este trabajo porque tenía necesidad de generar ingresos para ayudar en los gastos del hogar.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar una novilla, con la que espera en un futuro obtener leche y así poder vender quesos, para tener un poco más de ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Rosalba, sueña con comprar más ganado para obtener una mayor producción de leche y elaborar lácteos para vneder y no seguir trabajando como empleada doméstica.
texts.en:
Rosalba is 43 years old, a housewife, and completed 9th grade. She is married and with her spouse has three children ages 24, 20 and 18; two work and one is in school, but all three live with her. Her husband works as an employee in a restaurant. Rosalba works as a domestic employee in a house near her home, and she works from 8 AM until noon. In the afternoon she takes care of her animals. She decided to pursue this work because she needed to generate income to support her household.

The loan she seeks will be used to buy a calf, from which she hopes to obtain milk in the future and be able to sell cheese in order to have more income and give her family a better quality of life.

Rosalba dreams of buying more cattle in order to obtain a greater production of milk and make cheese products to sell and not continue working as a domestic employee.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima lives alone. She works at the city hall of El Alto but she would like to use her free time to put up a food stand and to sell hamburgers. She has obtained approval from city hall so she hopes you can help her. Maxima needs a loan to buy a stand and the meat to start her food business. Maxima learned how to cook when she was a little child. She is bored with being a seamstress in her free time and is convinced that the food stand will give her more money.

loans.use: to buy a stand and the meat to start her food business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 55 years old and is a taxi driver. He needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. Daniel works a lot a she drives the vehicle many hours a day.

He hopes you can help him. Daniel pays a rent and he takes care of his son and his parents. Without the vehicle Daniel is lost, that is why he needs the loan

loans.use: to pay the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Sr.de Torrechayoc De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR.DE TORRECHAYOC  DE YANAHUARA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SR.DE TORRECHAYOC DE YANAHUARA” communal bank. This bank is located in Urubamba district in Cusco department.

The member, Cleofe is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic household necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She has had her business for 5 years already, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream by this means, and promises to make her installment payments on time.


The other members have businesses selling candy, clothing, groceries and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Observation Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a Four-five years old business woman. She is a member of Observation solidarity group. Observation solidarity group has two members. (see group picture, Fatmata is on the left).
Ten years ago Fatmata established her rubber bowls and dishes business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 7pm.

“Observation” group needs a total loan of 4,000,000SLL. Fatmata is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy dozens of rubber bowls and dishes for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Fatmata is married with two children age fifteen and eight years old and both are school going children.
In the feature, Fatmata plan to save more money to provide for her child’s university education. She believes educating her child to university level will better the lives of her family.
Fatmata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of rubber bowls and dishes for her business.

loans.name: Hector Jose

texts.es:
Héctor es un joven de 25 años recién graduado de la carrera de tecnología médica, con un gran deseo de emprender su negocio y de esta forma ayudar en su comunidad.
Este es el segundo credito que Héctor solicita, el cual necesita lo para comprar instrumentos de bioanálisis y de esta forma empezar su propio laboratorio, con el cual, desea ayudar a su comunidad generando empleos, sin embargo no piensa quedarse a nivel comunitario, ya que a futuro, planea tener sucursales de su laboratorio y de esta forma ayudar a más gente.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 25 year old young man, who recently graduated from a medical technology program. He has a big desire to launch his business and thereby help in his community.

This is the second loan that Héctor seeks. He needs it to buy bioanalysis instruments, in order to start his own laboratory, with which he hopes to help his community by generating jobs. Nevertheless, he doesn't plan on staying at the community level. In the future he plans to have branches of his laboratory, in order to help more people.

loans.use: to buy bioanalysis instruments.

loans.name: Pink Group

texts.en:
Hawnatu, 33 years old, is married and has one school-going child. She belongs to "Pink", a solidarity group of four women who have come together to complement each other in achieving their individual dreams. “Pink” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Hawnatu will receive 2,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase two bags of rice, sugar, Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), onions, etc. for her business.

Hawnatu established her mixed market business eight years ago to ensure her family would get enough money for their basic needs. She uses the profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and to support her child’s education. Hawnatu is a hardworking woman; she operates her business from 9 AM to 6 PM Monday through Saturday every week. In the future, Hawnatu plans to support her child to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman.

Hawnatu thanks you for supporting the group. She appears on the far left in the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of rice, sugar, Maggi, onions, etc.

loans.name: National Group

texts.en:
Mabinty is a member of National. She is married with four children age twelve, ten, eight and three months baby. Three of them are school going children. (see group picture, Mabinty is in the middle).
Seven years ago Mabinty established her cooking ingredients business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning materials and provide food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6 days per week from 10am to 6pm.

She plan to use the loan to buy 1 bag of rice, 2 bags onion and 3 bags of sugar for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open savings account which will be used in paying her children school fees.
Mabinty and her group members need a loan totaling 7,500,000 SLL of which Mabinty is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL.
She plan to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life.
Mabinty and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of rice, 2 bags onion and 3 bags of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, de 44 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta primer grado, no continuo estudiando porque no tenían recursos suficientes para estudiar, está acompañada y junto a su pareja tienen 3 hijos de 30, 23 y 16 años de edad, 2 de sus hijos trabajan y su hija aún se encuentra estudiando.

Rosa, vive con su esposo y su hija la cual depende de ella, su esposo trabaja cortando caña, ella se dedica a cortar caña en un ingenio desde hace varios años, este trabajo lo realiza para poder ayudar a su familia económicamente.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar una vaca, porque en el futuro la venderá para obtener buenas ganancias.

El sueño de Rosa, es comprar más ganado para tener más ganancias, para darle a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar y que sea profesional para poder tener un trabajo mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old, a housewife, and completed first grade. She didn't continue in school because her family didn't have enough money for school. She and her husband have three children ages 30, 23, and 18; 2 of their children work, and one daughter is still studying in school. Rosa lives with her husband and daughter, who depend upon her. Her husband works cutting sugar cane. She also cuts sugar cane and has for several years, work she does to be able to support her family economically.

The loan she seeks will be used to buy a cow, because in the future she will sell it in order to obtain good income. Rosa dreams of buying more cattle in order to have more income in order to give her daughter the opportunity to stay in school and be a professional in order to have a better job.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, de 29 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta tercer grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos en que vivían, está acompañada y junto a su esposo tienen 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 3 años de edad y solo 2 están estudiando por lo tanto los 3 dependen de ella, su esposo trabaja en una platanera.

Magadalena, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a cuidar de sus hijos y a la crianza de gallinas y pollos de engorde, así logra tener ingresos para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar.

Magdalena, necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos de engorde, para cuidarlos y engordarlos y obtener más ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

El sueño de Magdalena, es ayudarles económicamente a sus hijos para que estudien y sean universitarios y así en un futuro tengan mejores posibilidades de un buen trabajo y ampliar su vivienda para que su familia viva más cómoda.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 29, is a housewife. She went to school through the third grade. She did not continue her education due to the lack of financial resources at the time. She is in a relationship. She and her husband have three children, ages 14, 8, and 3. Only two of them go to school. However, the three are dependent upon her. Her husband works for a banana producer.

Magdalena devotes herself to the household chores, to caring for her children, and to raising hens and chickens to fatten. This way she manages to have earnings to help her husband with the household expenses.

Magdalena needs the loan to buy pigs to care for and fatten. This way she will get more income in order to give her children a better quality of life.

Magdalena's dream is to help her children financially so that they can go to school and become university graduates. This way they will have better possibilities in the future and a good job. She also dreams of expanding her house so that her family will live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy pigs to care for and fatten.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is single and he lives with his parents. Diego is an itinerant seller and he goes to many fairs where he sells DVD players. Diego has been in this business for 5 years.

He needs a loan to pay to travel to Oruro to acquire DVD players. Diego is getting ready for the Christmas season so he hopes you can help him with his business.

loans.use: to pay a travel to Oruro to acquire DVD players

loans.name: Mitylene

texts.en:
Mitylene is 53 years old and married, with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, etc., to sell.

Mitylene has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 37 years old and all four children are attend in school.

Mary Jean has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to resell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa is 46 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma.Theresa has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma.Theresa requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma.Theresa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma.Theresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc., for her food production business.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, fish, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending business.

Ruth dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ericka Lucrecia

texts.es: Erika es una joven de veintisiete años, madre de dos hijos y dueña de una pulpería, la cual es una importante fuente de ingresos para su familia. Anteriormente Erika fue beneficiada con un crédito, con el cual logró surtir de diversos productos su pulpería, los cuales le dejaron una amplia ganancia; este nuevo crédito que Erika solicita es para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, mediante la compra de más artículos, tales como: gaseosas, jugos, pan entre otras cosas, con los cuales espera tener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Erika is a 27 year old young woman. She is the other of two children and the owner of a corner store, which is an important source of income for her family. Previously Erika received a loan, with which she was able to stock her store with various products, from which she derived good earnings.

This new loan that Erika seeks is to continue investing in her business through the purchase of more things like sodas, juices and bread, among other things, with which she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more things such as sodas, juices, and bread, among other things

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 69 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio debido a la pobreza en que se vivía, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad, por lo tanto trabajan para ellos mismos.

Juana, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar de sus animales.

Juana, solicita el crédito para comprar unas novilla de engorde y dentro de un periodo venderlas para obtener mejores ingresos, para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Juana, es ampliar su ganadería.
texts.en:
Juana, 69 years old, is a housewife. She did not attend school because her family was too impoverished to send her. She is a widow with four adult children, so they support themselves.

Juana looks after her home and takes care of her animals.

Juana is applying for a loan to buy some heifers to fatten, and then sell them to make a profit and improve her quality of life.

Juana's dream is to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to fatten

loans.name: Bright Future Group

texts.en:
Emmanuella is 33 years old. She is from Moree in the Abura Asebu Kwamankese District of the Central Region of Ghana. Emmanuella is the leader and representative of Bright Future Group. She is married with 2 children aged 12 and 14 years old. Emmanuella's husband is a commercial driver who has been very supportive. She lives with her family. Both of her children are currently attending school. She sells provisions, cosmetics and poultry products to individuals in her locality.

Emmanuella visited a nearby community where she met with her friend and other women residents using Elsa Stove for cooking. She then developed the interest of adding to her line of business the distribution of Elsa Stove. Emmanuella has done the necessary market survey in her locality and with very positive results. The stoves use virgin pellets (palm Kernel shells) which are available as waste materials within the communities she operates. There is high demand of Elsa Stoves since they improve indoor air quality and health of the users. Additionally, it is cost saving as the fuel cost is zero within the communities who have virgin pellets as waste material from their oil processing.

Emmanuella and her group member need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the growing demand they face through their market assessment. Funding their loan will also mean reducing deforestation and put an end to cutting down of trees for firewood and charcoal by the communities of the stove users. Emmanuella and her group member thank their micro lenders for their generosity and help to preserve the forest within their business communities.

loans.use: to buy more Elsa clean cook stove to distribute.

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray I Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY I”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Joysi ella es soltera y tiene 30 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “WAYNA TAUCARAY I” communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Joysi is a member. She is single and 30 years old. She has a grocery business. She sells basic staple items such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8 AM until 10 PM. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going well. She dreams of expanding the business to a full grocery store. Joysi seeks a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The member inserted into the group photo had her photo taken after the meeting because she asked for permission due to work. The other members of the group have the following businesses: restaurant, selling clothing, selling groceries, and selling animals.

Joysi is thankful to those who support this dream through the loan and promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Roselou

texts.en: Roselou has been running for her retail store for many years.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Vilmonfont

texts.en:
Vilmonfont is a 34-year-old single man. He is trying hard to provide for their needs including food, health, clothing, and education.

He is in the agriculture business, growing and selling coconut. Through this, he earns a good amount of income to support the household expenditures. In order to grow his sales in the near future, he has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for coconut replanting costs.

He expects this to boost his earnings and profits. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay for coconut replanting costs

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ducks to raise and buy feeds. She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Marciana dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ducks to raise and buy feeds

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 41 years old, married, and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers.

Mila has been farming sugarcane for five years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Marta, de 42 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta segundo grado, no continuo estudiando porque no tenían recursos suficientes para estudiar, está casada y junto con su pareja tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 1 años de edad, 1 de sus hijos estudia, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que depende de ella y su esposo trabaja cortando caña.

Marta, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también lava y plancha ropa ajena, desde hace varios años trabajo que decidió hacer para poder ayudar a su familia económicamente.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar una vaca, para cuidarla y engordarla para venderla y obtener ganancias para ella y su familia.

El sueño de Marta, es poder construir su casa de ladrillo, porque en la que vive actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
Martha, 42, is a homemaker. She studied up to second grade but didn't continue because they didn't have enough money for her education. She's married and she and her husband have two children, ages 12 and 1; one of her children attends school. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are dependent on her. Her husband works cutting sugar cane.

Martha spends her time taking care of her household. She also has washed and ironed clothing for people for several years; she decided on that job so she could help her family financially.

The loan she's requesting is to buy a cow to take care of, fatten, and sell to earn income for herself and her family.

Martha's dream is to be able to build a brick house, because her current home is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy a cow to take care of, fatten, and sell

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos, como actividad económica tiene la venta de calzado, la mercadería la ubica en su vehículo para exhibirla, de esta manera atrae a sus clientes, no representa dificultades para trabajar.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar sandalias, zapatos formales y deportivos, para ambos sexos, diversificará su mercadería para atender a otro tipo de cliente y así obtener buenas ganancias.
Los objetivos que tiene Jorge son tener su negocio debidamente surtido, mejorar las condiciones de vida y económicas.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in a house he owns, with his wife and children. To make a living he sells footwear. He keeps his merchandise in his car to display it. In this manner he attracts customers. He has no difficulties in working.

He is seeking financing to buy sandals, formal shoes and sneakers, for both sexes. This will diversify his merchandise to serve another type of customer and thus obtain good income. The goals Jorge has are to have a well stocked business, and improve his living and economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy sandals, formal shoes, and sneakers, for both sexes.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic's husband is a farmer and she helps him in working their own farm to make a living. Her previous loans from GDMPC were successfully repaid with her generated revenue.

Assuring a better source of income for the family, she took a new loan again to purchase fertilizer such as manure for her banana farm. Manure helps to restore farm nutrients that bring better farm produce.

She is hoping to gain more income from her farm to save a portion for their future education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a widow with 6 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, bread, flour,sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, flour, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, washing soap, flour, sugar.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a fertile area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, soda, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a large business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar,flour and other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a Kiva borrower with 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 26 years of age, is a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Chuka. It is a remote town, with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married, and together with her husband has one child. Her primary sources of income are dairy goat milk,dairy cow milk, poultry. Ann is a strong woman with tough skin, and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling.

The Chuka area has conditions that favor dairy goat farming. Ann has always wanted to take care of another dairy goat, but a lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy goat. The dairy goat she intends to buy is not just an ordinary goat, but a breed that produces between 1 and 2 litres of milk a day. With this goat Ann's farm will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for goat milk in the Chuka area is high, but the supply is low.

Her increased income will allow Ann to provide a secure future for her soon to go school-going child, by paying her tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy goats,

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 70 years old and married, with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josefa has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Nenita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old and married, with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Emma has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 57 years old and married, with five children, all currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.
