Ninfa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, vinegar, sanitary pads, etc.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 63 years old, married, and has seven children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Florentina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florentina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eva Lissette

texts.es:
Eva, convive con su esposo y una hija de 5 años de edad, para tener mejores condiciones de vida hace 3 años inicio a vender frutas y verduras, utilizo capital propio, su jornada de trabajo es de  ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
El crédito le dará los recursos para comprar mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas, tendrá un inventario más competente para cubrir las demandas de las personas que llegan a comprar a su negocio, espera aumentar sus ventas.
Su visión es tener un negocio más grande y rentable.
texts.en:
Eva lives with her husband and daughter of 5 years old. In order to have better living conditions, she used her own capital to start selling fruits and vegetables 3 years ago. Her work day is 8am to 5pm.

The loan will provide resources to buy more vegetables and fruits. She will have more adequate inventory to meet the customer demands. She expects to increase sales.

Her vision is to have larger and more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits in order to have more adequate inventory to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Leah. She is forty nine years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015.
Leah is a mixed farmer who grows maize, potatoes and vegetable and rears sheep. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she was doing maize and potatoes farming only, However, after undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, Leah diversified to a combination to dairy farming.

She is borrowing from Hand in Hand in order to buy fertilizer and seeds that will increase her farm produce that will help her farm income. She hopes this extra income will enable cater for her family’s needs such as food, shelter and school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to increase farm yields and pay for family's expenses e.g. food, shelter and school fees.

loans.name: Ayda Leticia

texts.es: Ayda tiene 41 años, es muy ahorrativa y responsable de estado civil casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene tres hijos Dayana de 15 años, Cristian de 10 años y Jessica de 7 años que están estudiando en una institución de la localidad, a los que les ha enseñado ahorrar su dinero para invertir en negocios Ayda hace 13 años atrás se dedica a la compra de ganado lechero. Ella necesita el dinero para poder comprar una vaca para ir aumentando así sus ganancias con el fin de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ayda is 41 years old. She is very thrifty and responsible. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have three children, Dayana who is 15 years old, Cristian is 10 years old, and Jessica is 7 years old. They are all studying at a local school and she has taught them all to save their money to invest in businesses.

Thirteen years ago, Ayda starting purchasing dairy cows. She needs money to purchase a cow to increase her income so she can help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 7 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la va almacenando en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego comercializarla, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas para poder tener un buen cultivo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman who has her face blurred is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has been growing corn for seven years. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the silos shown in the photograph to later sell.

This young woman lives in a house she owns with her relatives. She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, and insecticides to have a good harvest and have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and insecticides.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Los Unicos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS UNICOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma ella es soltera y tiene 45 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Irma belong to the community bank “LOS UNICOS (THE ONLY)”. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana which is part of the province of La Convencion and department of Cusco.

Irma is single and 45 years old. She owns a grocery store. She sells staples like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She wants to succeed through this business. She is entrepreneurial and hardworking. Her dream is to expand the grocery store. Irma requests a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The other members are in the business of selling animals, clothes, and food, and a grocery store business.

Irma is grateful to those who take part in her dream through the loan and agrees to make the payment on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en:
Eline is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition and changes in tea prices.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables, fruits. Her business goal is to be a distributor of food stuffs within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, fruits.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: The above client is new to UGAFODE Nakasero Branch.  She is single with 2 children and both are school going age. She is a poultry farmer who has applied for a loan of 1,000,000/= to buy chicken and chicken feeds and drugs to boost her poultry. She is hard working and looks toward a prolonged partnership.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
A sus 53 años Gregorio se siente con mucha energía y deseo de seguir trabajando, seguir cultivando la tierra, que con mucho esfuerzo ha cultivado a lo largo de 26 años. El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda para Gregorio, ya que pudo construir su huerta y sembrar maíz y frijoles.
El nuevo préstamo que Gregorio está solicitando,  lo requiere para comprar abono, urea y varios insumos para iniciar nuevamente la siembra de maíz y frijoles, con la que espera tener buena cosecha, que le permita dejar granos para autoconsumo y dinero suficiente para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
At 53 year old, Gregorio feels energetic and wishes to continue farming. He put in a lot of effort in farming for 26 years. The previous loan was helpful for Gregory because he was able to build his garden and plant corn and beans.

Gregorio requests a new loan to buy fertilizer, urea and various inputs to start planting corn and beans again. He hopes to have good harvest. This will leave some grain for consumption and generate enough money to pay for the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and various inputs to start planting corn and beans again

loans.name: Noe Antonio

texts.es:
Noé es un agricultor, que vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, la familia depende totalmente de los ingresos que él genera, no cuentan apoyo de sus familiares, él siembra maíz para alimentar a su familia y vender otra parte para tener ingresos, además brinda el servicio de transporte, tiene una experiencia de 15 años y su negocio está funcionando desde hace 10 años, en los trabajos agrícolas eventualmente contrata dos o más personas para que le apoyen en sus actividades, su ventaja es que trabaja en terrenos familiares, por su experiencia no representa dificultades.
Invertirá  en semilla de maíz y abono, asimismo pagara la preparación de una manzana de terreno para sembrar en esta temporada, le permitirá seguir trabajando en lo que tanto le gusta, sus riesgos son los cambios del clima.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio estable y darles a sus hijos educación para que se superen académicamente.
texts.en: Noé is a farmer who lives in his own home with his wife and two children ages 15 and 17. The family depends totally on the income he generates. They don't have other family support. He grows corn to feed his family and sells part to obtain income. In addition he provides transportation services. He has 15 years of experience and his business has been going for 10 years. He will eventually contract 2-3 more people in his farming work to support his activities. The positive part of his work is his family's land and his experience alleviates difficulties.  He will buy corn seed and manure, and pay for the preparation for a plot of land to plan this season. This will enable him to continue working as he enjoys it so much. The risk to his business is the weather. He dreams of having a stable business and providing an education to his children so that they can be academically successful.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and manure, and pay for the preparation for a plot of land to plan this season.

loans.name: Angela Yessenia

texts.es:
Ángela, de 41 años de edad, está acompañada, no tiene hijos, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, porque su familia era de muy escasos recursos y no le podían ayudar a continuar estudiando.

Ángela, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de tamales; desde muy joven su madre le enseño a prepararlos y actualmente tiene su propio negocio, ella siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad y tiene una clientela muy selecta y exigente, ella camina cerca de 6 kilometros diarios para llegar al lugar donde vende los tamales y sus labores inician a las 5:00 de la mañana y termina las 4:00 de la tarde. 

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar leña, condimentos, maíz, hojas, entre otros.- De esa manera espera mejorar considerablemente los ingresos de su negocio y de esa forma poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

Ángela, sueña con construir su casa mucho más amplia, porque donde actualmente vive es muy pequeño, ademas sueña con tener un negocio estable donde pueda tener empleadas que comercialicen su tamales.
texts.en:
Ángela, 41, is in a common-law relationship and has no children. She only studied up to sixth grade because her family had few resources and couldn't help her continue with her education.

Ángela has 30 years of experience making tamales. Her mother taught her to make them at a very young age and currently she has her own business. She has always earned a living in this line of work and she has a very demanding and select clientele. She walks about six kilometers a day to get to where she sells the tamales. She starts working at 5 a.m. and finishes at 4 p.m.

She needs a loan to buy firewood, condiments, corn, leaves, and other supplies. She hopes to considerably improve her business income this way and give her family better living conditions.

Ángela dreams of building a much bigger house because where she lives now is very small. She also dreams of having a stable business and having employees to sell her tamales.

loans.use: to buy firewood, condiments, corn, leaves, and other products

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.en: Escolastica is 53 years old. She is married and has five children; three adults and two school aged children. Escolastica helps her husband in running their rice farm to earn a living. They have been doing this for five years. They need an amount to buy fertilizer, a rice farm sprayer and pesticides as well in order to enhance the growth of their plants and have a bountiful harvest. Escolastica aims to have a good harvest for her children. Definitely, she will use their profit from their farm for her children’s education and to provide for the basic needs of their family because this business is their main source of income. In the future, she wants her children to finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a rice farm sprayer and pesticides.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emelita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending, such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

Emelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending, such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Vivilyn

texts.en:
Vivilyn is a married woman, 57 years old, with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vivilyn has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Vivilyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José se dedica a comercializar, calzado, ropa y joyería de enchape, vive con su madre de 61 años de edad, su padre de 65 años de edad y su hermano de 26 años de edad, tiene su negocio desde hace un año, trabaja todos los días.
Con el financiamiento fortalecerá su negocio, invertirá en mercadería como prendas de vestir y zapatos con modelos más recientes, así como también joyería de plata, bronce entre otro tipo de material, podrá satisfacer en un corto tiempo las demandas de sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande para tener los recursos necesarios con los que pueda apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
José sells shoes, clothing, and costume jewelry. He lives with his 61-year-old mother, 65-year-old father and 26 -year-old brother. He has had his business for a year and works every day.

With the loan he will strengthen his business, invest in merchandise such as articles of clothing and newer style shoes, as well as silver, bronze and other types of jewelry, and be able to meet in the short term the demands of his customers.

His dream is to have a larger business so that he can have the resources he needs to support his parents.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing articles and newer style shoes, as well as silver, bronze and other types of jewelry.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves, biscuits, soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tea leaves, biscuits, soap, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves, biscuits, soap, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 47 years old, married with four children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rita has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell.

Rita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Eva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de cuarenta y nueve años de edad, muy trabajadora y dedicada, luego de que el último de sus tres hijos dejara la casa, decidió emprender un negocio para generar un ingreso extra, así nació su negocio de venta de comida. Gracias a la confianza que le ha depositado MiCrédito y Kiva, ella ha logrado crecer como comerciante, por lo que se encuentra profundamente agradecida. 
En estos momentos, su comideria está teniendo nuevos clientes, por lo tanto necesita que Ana invierta más, por eso ha solicitado un financiamiento de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que le permita comprar más carne de res, cerdo, pollo, verduras, arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros insumos que ocupa día a día.  En un futuro desea poder mejorar la infraestructura de su local, para que este se vuelva más atractivo.
texts.en:
Ana is a dedicated and very hard-working 49 year old woman. After the last of her three children left the house she decided to start a business to generate an extra income. Thanks to the confidence that MiCrédito and Kiva had in her, she has managed to grow as a businessperson. She is profoundly grateful for this.

At this time her eatery is seeing new clients and therefore Ana needs to invest more. So she has requested financing from Kiva together with MiCrédito. It will allow her to buy more beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, rice, beans and oil amongst other ingredients that she uses day by day. In the future she would like to improve the infrastructure of her stall, so that it is more attractive.

loans.use: to buy more beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, rice, beans and oil amongst other ingredients.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind heart of lending her funds several times in the past which really helped sustain and grow her store. It has  encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and is forever grateful for your help. 

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 40000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which sustained her family's basic needs and in sending her children to school. 

She prays for God to prosper her store to be able to save for her children's College Education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alicia is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Alicia has a selling firewood business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Racelia

texts.en:
Racelia is 35 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, soap, coffee, etc.

Racelia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional item to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, soap, coffee, etc

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Regina started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Gaata, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this mother of three children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. Regina believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.
Regina patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad que aún se encuentra estudiando, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y son los únicos que dependen de ella.   

Francisca, se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas, ella aprendió este negocio por medio de una amiga, aparte de la venta de pupusas también vende licuados y es la otra fuente de ingresos que ella posee, la venta de pupusas la tiene en su propia casa y su hija le ayuda en el negocio y comienzan a vender a las 6:00 a.m. con sus ventas.

Francisca, necesita el préstamo para comprar harina de arroz, maíz, tomate, quesillo, chicharrón y frijoles. Con la ampliación de su negocio, espera obtener mejores ganancias para ayudar a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Francisca, sueña con tener un local de venta amplio y seguro, además espera poco a poco ampliar su negocio para poder sacar adelante a su hija y que sea toda una profesional.
texts.en:
Francisca, 46 years old, studied up to 9th grade. She lives with a partner and has a daughter of 10 years old who goes to school. Her partner works in agriculture. They are the only people that depend on her. 

Francisca makes pupusas (maize dumplings) for a living. She learned this business through a friend. She also sells smoothies apart from pupusas, which is another source of income. She sells  from her own house, and her daughter helps with the business. Together they start sales at 6am.

Francisca needs the loan to buy rice flour, tomato, cheese, pork cracklings and beans. With the increase in her business, she hopes to obtain better earnings to help her family and to improve their life conditions. 

Francisca dreams to have a place for her business that is spacious and secure. She also hopes to gradually increase her business, in order to get ahead with her daughter so that she can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, maize, tomatoes, cheese, pork cracklings, and beans

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 29-year-old married mother with a beautiful family. They all live in a town called Nandihills. Nandihills doesn’t offer the best opportunities, but this honest woman has learned to deal with that. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea-growing regions, lending it the nickname “Tea area.” For the past 10 years, Milka has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. Milka passionately loves poultry farming.

The biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village, and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo. Milka is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Milka will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business. Help Milka make her dreams come true; this loan can change her life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en: Annabel is 55 years old married woman and a mother of 5 children.She own and manage her cafeteria selling grills foods to earn for a living. This will allow her to keep her business open in order to continue serving more variety to satisfy her customers' tastes and needs. For over 8 years, she  has been earning well, and was able to pay her previous loan.She wants to expand her business and engage to other business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to buy raw ingredients for the preparation of variety of foods to sell. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the preparation of food to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 26 years old, married with one child.

Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Joan has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Joan aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a youthful 48-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Grace is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them with a better future.

Grace was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kitale is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Grace, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business.

Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Julita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Julita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, etc.s for her food vending business.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Nenie

texts.en:
Nenie is 58 years old and single.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenie is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nenie has been in this business for 17 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Antonette is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Antonette has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia works hard to support her family. Portia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Portia requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Portia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Portia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 45 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell bread, eggs, coffee, soap, chips, etc.

Emy has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Emy would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell bread, eggs, coffee, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
María, vive en casa familiar con su hijo de 10 años de edad, el cual estudia, su negocio es vender antojitos como: pastelitos, enchiladas, tostadas de plátanos, etc., lo tiene desde hace 3 años, utilizo capital propio para fundarlo, su horario de trabajo es de dos a seis de la tarde.
Comprará  aceite, maíz, plátano, harina, yuca, entre otros materiales básicos para preparar la venta de antojitos, tendrá mayor capacidad de producción con la que espera que las ventas sean mejores.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y competente en la zona.
texts.en:
María lives in a family house with her 10-year-old son who goes to school. Her business is selling snacks such as beef patties, enchiladas, tostadas of plantains, etc.  She has had this business for three years and used her own capital to found it. Her work schedule is from 2 to 6 in the afternoon. 

With the loan, she will buy oil, maize, plantains, flour, and yuca, among other basic ingredients for preparing and selling snacks. With these ingredients, she will have greater production capacity which she hopes will bring better sales.  Her dream is to have a bigger and more competitive business in the local area.

loans.use: to buy oil, maize, plantains, flour, and yuca, among other basic ingredients for preparing and selling snacks

loans.name: Dario Javier

texts.es: Darío, de 24 años de edad, está casado tiene dos hijos Camila de 4 años asiste a una escuela gratuita del lugar y Znider de 2 años que permanece junto a sus padres. El comenzó con dos computadoras a brindar servicios informáticos hace cuatro años atrás,  este negocio es su fuente de subsistencia, hoy necesita el dinero para poder comprar dos computadores generando mayores ingresos para poder alimentar, pagar el lugar donde viven y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Darío, 24 years old, is married and has two children. Camila, 4 years old, goes to a free school in the area, and Znider, 2 years old, stays with the parents. 

Dario started to offer internet services with two computers four years ago. This business is the source of his subsistence.

He now needs money to buy two more computers for his business, in order to generate more income for buying food, paying rent, and educating his children.

loans.use: buy computers and other accessories for his business

loans.name: Sreyang

texts.en:
Sreyang is a 19-year-old Accounting freshman at university in a city. She is from Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Her father earns main income from Tuk Tuk taxi service and her mother is rice farmer, she depends on farming as revenue which make it hard to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year.

Sreyang would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help her graduate successfully. In the future, after graduation, she wants a proper job in a company to help her parents. When she has enough money, she also wants to have an own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year for her BA degree in Accounting

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old, married with three children, two of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, egg, soap, soft drinks,etc.

Gina has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, spices, egg, soap, soft drinks,etc

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall for her fruit vending business.

Narcisa has been in this business for 10 years. Narcisa earns more income from general store.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Sagrada Familia. Group

texts.es: EMPERATRIZ de 56 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “sagrada familia” la cual lo conforman 07 socias con deseos de  trabajar honradamente y progresar. Ella hace más de 2 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es de poder tener su local propio y así ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de chupetines caramelos y galletas. La Alcancía “sagrada familia” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo y se comprometen a seguir trabajando. Emperatriz es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo  color azul y chaleco guinda.
texts.en:
EMPERATRIZ, 56 years old, lives with a partner and has three sons. She belongs to the "Sagrada Familia" group,  which consists of seven partners who wish to work honestly and to progress.

For more than two years, Emperatriz has been selling sweets as a travelling saleswoman for a living. Thanks to her constant dedication, she has been able to get ahead with her family. Her biggest wish is to have her own place for sales and this way increase her business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy lollipop, candies, and cookies. 

The members of the "Sagrada Familia" group thank the Kiva lenders for the support, and promises that they will continue working. Emperatriz is the first person on the left in the photo, dressed in a blue shirt and a cherry colored vest.

loans.use: to buy lollipops, candies, and cookies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La Joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro del municipio en un zona muy transitada y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, su hijo y su hermano, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face is blurred because she lives in a high risk area, is 28 years old and has been selling women's clothing for five years. 

Her business is located in the municipal center, a very busy area, and thus has many customers. With the earnings that she obtains she manages to get ahead with her living costs. She lives in her own house with her mother, her son, and her brother.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes at wholesale, in order to continue with her business and in this way be able to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at wholesale

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
Antolin, de 66 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes  principios, se ha dedicado a los trabajos agrícolas, está casado y tiene 4 hijos que actualmente están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad; Antolin, es caracterizado en su comunidad como una persona muy responsable y alto grado de servicio hacia los demás, esto la ha llevado a salir adelante y a ganarse el respeto de las personas de su comunidad. 

Antolin, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde que era un niño, en esta actividad productiva ha desarrollado mucho conocimiento y experiencia, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y de su abuelo.- Actualmente, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, siembra de tomates, chiles, pepinos y frijoles.

Antolin, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para los trabajos hortícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Los sueños de Antolin, son tener un sistema de riego para todo su terreno, el cual le facilite la plantación de cultivos todo el año.
texts.en:
Antolin, age 66, is a person with excellent principles. He works in agriculture, is married, and has four children who currently attend his community’s school. Antolin is known in his community as a very responsible person with a high degree of service towards others. This has allowed him to get ahead and earn the respect of people in his community.

Antolin has worked in agriculture and cattle raising since he was a boy. He has developed his knowledge and experience of this productive work a great deal, thanks to the teachings of his father and his grandfather. Currently, he works growing vegetables, tomatoes, chile, cucumbers, and beans.

Antolin needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for his horticultural work and fertilizer for his corn crop. In this way, he will be able to have a better harvest and to improve his economic income.

Antolin’s dreams are to have an irrigation system for all of his land, which will facilitate the planting of crops all year long.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his horticultural work and fertilizer for his corn crops.

loans.name: Puentecito De Illichua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUENTECITO DE ILLICHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia ella es soltera y tiene 47 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the “Puentecito de Illichua” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, which belongs to the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco.

The featured borrower is Julia. She is single, 47 years old, and has one son. The borrower works in a cattle raising business. She fattens up the cattle and makes them grow, and then sells them in various fairs. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Through this work, the borrower wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her cattle selling business. She is requesting the loan to buy a cow.

The other borrowers work in animal sales, cattle raising, grocery store businesses, and food sales.

Julia thanks those who are taking part in her dream through these means, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.en:
Marbelita works hard to support her family. Marbelita is married and has a fruit sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Marbelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell.

Marbelita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Tortilleras Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las tortilleras está conformado por un microempresario emprendedor y tres mujeres laboriosas, quienes trabajan día a día para sacar adelante sus negocios. El grupo es coordinado por doña Brenda, soltera y madre de dos niños de nueve y un año quienes son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de hielo desde hace cuatro años y solicita por sexto ciclo el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de un frízer, una de sus metas es expandir la venta de hielo al por mayor, con el crédito anterior logro la compra de una refrigeradora. La segunda socia es Allison  quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, el tercer socio es Absdrual, quien se dedica a la veta de accesorios para mascotas y Corina, se dedica a la venta de helados.
texts.en:
The Tortilleras solidarity group is comprised of one enterprising microbusinessman and three hard-working women who work day after day so their businesses will progress. The group is coordinated by Brenda, who is single and the mother of two children, ages 9 and 1 year old. They are her biggest motivation.

She sells ice for a living, and is applying for her sixth loan cycle with this institution because she wants to invest in the purchase of a freezer. One of her goals is to expand the wholesale sales of ice. With the previous loan, she managed to buy a refrigerator.

The second member is Allison, who sells clothing for a living, the third member is Absdrual, who sells pet accesssories for a living and Corina, who sells ice cream and frozen treats.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50-year-old married woman with 6 children to provide for.

She has been making Nipa for many years. She sells it to local community members.

She has to support the needs of her family's daily expenditures and she also has to send her children to school. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy materials needed for making Nipa which is used for her business.

Editha's plan for the future is to save more money for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making Nipa

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old, married, and has two children.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 9 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and has five children. Sarah is married and has five children who are in school.

Sarah is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sarah has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 5 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, chips, bread, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as food vending.

Merly dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 45 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zeny has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines. Zeny requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of eggs to offer for sale.

Zeny has been in this business for three years. In the future, Zeny would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of eggs to offer for sale.

loans.name: Gella

texts.en:
Gella is 56 years old and has five children. Gella is married and has one child still in school.

Gella is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gella requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Gella has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 10 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Gella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana ha mejorado su negocio de venta de antojitos con la inversión de créditos que la institución le otorga, actualmente tiene más clientes satisfechos y apoya más a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Tomando en cuenta que para seguir trabajando debe tener un inventario bien surtido, hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar de inmediato aceite, yuca, papas, aderezos, embutidos, etc., así preparara la venta antojitos y hot dogs, espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Ana has improved her snack sales business with the investment of loans which the lending institution has granted her. Currently, she has more satisfied clients and supports her husband more with family expenses.

Taking into account the fact that, in order to continue working, she must have a well-supplied inventory, she is requesting a new loan to immediately buy oil, cassava, potatoes, condiments, cold cuts, etc., to prepare and sales snacks and hot dogs. She hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: to immediately buy oil, cassava, potatoes, condiments, cold cuts, etc., to prepare and sell snacks and hot dogs.

loans.name: Miguel Diodoro

texts.es:
Miguel, se dedica atender su negocio que es una panadería y dar el servicio de molino nixtamal, comparte su casa con su esposa y dos hijos, cuanta con más de 20 de años de experiencia en el negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos que llegan a moler maíz.
Comprará harina al mayoreo para aumentar la producción de pan, así lograra que su negocio sea más rentable, espera atender a nuevos clientes.
Su anhelo es tener las fuerzas necesarias para continuar trabajando y sacar a delante a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel shares a home with his wife and two children and tends to his business for a living. His business is both a bakery and a corn milling service. He has more than 20 years of experience in the business. His customers are his neighbors, who come in to grind their corn.

He will buy flour wholesale to increase his production of bread, and that way he will make his business more profitable. He hopes to wait on new customers.

His desire is to have the the strength needed to continue working and to help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale to increase his production of bread.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and married with six children. Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, snack foods, candies, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, candies, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, etc.

Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, snack foods, candies, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenny is 46 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jenny has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of personal care products like beauty soap, perfume, body lotion, deodorant, etc.

Jenny has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of personal care products like beauty soap, perfume, body lotion, deodorant and other personal care products.

loans.name: Wabelita

texts.en:
Wabelita is 62 years old and married with two children.

Wabelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, detergent, sugar, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. to sell.

Wabelita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Wabelita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, coffee, detergent, sugar, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rodillo

texts.en:
Rodillo has been planting and harvesting bananas for many years. With the generated revenue, he has been able to provide for his family's needs and support his children in school. His aim is to increase his income because of the high price of commodities nowadays. So he decided to borrow a new loan to pay for labor on his banana farm so that he can produce and deliver more good quality bananas to the market to generate more income. 

Rodillo's plan for the future is to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor on his banana farm.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 30 years old and married with two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, spices, milk, shampoo, noodles, etc.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from e-loading and pig fattening.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, spices, milk, shampoo, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 40-year-old, single mother of her three children. Nelia raises a small number of pigs to expand their daily needs. She really earns more than she expected. She was able to support the needs of her children and is able to send them in school. She wants to gain more access in some other business activities.

She joined and gained access; recently, she took a new loan to buy additional piglets to raise in order to produce plenty of meats in the market. Nelia's plan for the future is to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married with three children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

Nenita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Aliia

texts.en:
Aliia is a freshman in the Business Administration program at AUCA. It is clear, that good education is the key to success in the future. Every person should be competitive in order to find a good job, what will fulfill her/his needs. Aliia chose AUCA believing that it matches the modern education standards, and receiving two diplomas (Kyrgyz and American ones) will make her competitive all over the world. That’s why her parents even facing financial difficulties, agreed to send her to AUCA.
Aliia got acquainted with AUCA thanks to its TIFE project that totally changed her outlook. She began to try to use her time effectively, learnt how to write realizable business model, at the end decided to enter the BA Program at AUCA. She is excited by incredible training with leading entrepreneurs of Kyrgyzstan. Moreover, they were like a symbol of prosperity and success that has achieved by the people like she is. She understood the need of quality education and entering AUCA planning to be involved in TIFE project further and be the next Coordinator of it.
Aliia points out that her parents support her dream and attitude toward education and will find solutions to cover her tuition fee at AUCA. They strongly count on Kiva loan, which enable them to decrease the tuition fee now and pay it back after Aliia’s graduation. As Aliia says, of course they are meeting obstacles and problems connected with funding now, but she believes that AUCA will make a push in her professional development and open the new world in front of her.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her higher education in BA Program

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell rice.

Virginia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 43 years old, married with four children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelia has a general store business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned good, school supplies and other personal care products.

Nelia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned good, school supplies and other personal care products.

loans.name: Medrine

texts.en: This is Medrine's fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to pay school fee for her children in primary and secondary school. Her business has since grown, she expanded her grocery stall to accommodate more stock of vegetables, onions, potatoes and fruits. This is because of more clients she has received.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, vegetables, onions and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a Kiva borrower with 1 child. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jonalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Catalina is 52 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Catalina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and widowed. Sarah works very hard to provide for them.

Sarah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, milk, juice, coffee, candies, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, milk, juice, coffee, candies, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, milk, juice, coffee, candies, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Carla May

texts.en:
Carla May works hard to support her family. Carla May is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Carla May requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Carla May has been in this business for 30 years now.

Carla May would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
Berlina is 61 years old and married with three children. Berlina works very hard to provide for them.

Berlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Berlina has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Berlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is an enterprising 45-year-old farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. She is the hardworking, energetic mother of three children. For the past five years she has been a farmer, gaining a lot of practical experience in doing so. Through her farming income she has always assured her family of a decent meal and other basic needs.

Jane is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy seeds and move into horticultural farming. Kitale has good weather patterns and conditions that support farming activities. It has good roads and a good transportation network. With these favorable conditions she is sure that she will be able to increase her business and reap the maximum in profits.
Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Jane feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. She is very disciplined with her finances and hopes that through her accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline, 37 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Nasiondo, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and has six children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and is them mother of 5 kids. Veronica is a cook and works at a restaurant but she would like a loan to buy clothes to sell. Veronica is alone her husband left her long time ago and she has to take care of her kids by herself.

Veronica has a lot of hope in the clothing business she is ready to visit many places to sell the merchandise

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina raises hogs for the past 20 years, and she is happily married and has seven children.  Three of her children are still attending school. 
In addition to hog raising, she also owns a rice paddies and grows rice.

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers for the farm and pig feed. It could boost her income and continue to handle it properly. Thus, support her family and provide better living condition.

In the future, Saturnina  is hoping that someday, she will be able to continue finance the schooling of her children .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farm and pig feed

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a hardworking mother who pushes her abilities in retailing consumable goods and others for human consumption. She is a businesswoman and a mother of 4 adult age children. She is also a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC and had enjoyed the perks of membership. Recently, she avails a loan to restock her store with consumable goods, condiments, confectioneries and drinking soda

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods, condiments, confectioneries and drinking soda.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary and her family live and work on a rustic farm in the fertile Nandi hills area of Kenya which is situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She mainly grows vegetables for food and income. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home and through the years she has had no difficulty in meeting her customers’ needs. 

Mary wants to buy agricultural inputs such as herbicides and pesticides, but she has no money or access to credit services. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no commercial services. Luckily for her, Juhudi partnered with Kiva to bring financial inclusion to farmers like herself. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 

With your loan, Mary will be able to access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and her family's income.
To carry out her plans she needs the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the wonderful lenders of Kiva, she knows that with them, her dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 29-year-old smallholder farmer from Nkubu in the central region of Kenya. Caroline owns a small parcel of land. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This loving mother keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables and has 10 years of experience in farming.

Caroline is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Caroline. Through a group of 14 members called Kiangoju, Caroline has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Caroline because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marivic has a fish and seafoods vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and seafoods to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and seafoods to sell

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Apolonia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Apolonia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc for her food vending business.

Apolonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Yubu

texts.en: Yubu is a single male aged 27 living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been operating a diary shop that sells milk for one year. He also does farming in order to get extra income to support his dependents. Due to seasonal changes,prices are fluctuating day by day thus affecting his business.However he still dreams of buying land and build a house for his family. Yubu intends to use the loan to buy milk for selling.

loans.use: to buy milk for sell.

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 42 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

Bevelyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and has two children. Mary is married and has one child still in school.

Mary is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 32 years old and has one child. Cherry is married and has one child who is in school.

Cherry is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cherry has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cherry would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 29 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, noodles, etc.

Elenita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 37 years old and has two children. Mae is married and has two children are currently in school.

Mae is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mae requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Mae has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Bevena

texts.en:
Bevena is 45 years old, married with four children.

Bevena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bevena has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Bevena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura desde que era un niño y todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su padre, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.
  
José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, tiene mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre; actualmente se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, de esta forma puede satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos mediante la venta del 50% de su cosecha.

José, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra donde cultivará sus granos básicos.

Los sueños de José, son tener una casa maya para proteger sus culticos de las plagas y para trabajar también en época de verano y que le facilite la plantación de cultivos hortícolas.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old. He has been working in farming since he was a child, and everything he knows about the trade he learned from his father. Jose is married and has two children who are studying at the local school.

Jose has been making a living in farming since he was a child. He has a lot of knowledge and experience thanks to teachings from his father. Jose currently makes a living growing basic grains, such as corn and beans. This work allows him to pay for necessities for his family, and to support his children by selling half of his harvest.

Jose needs this loan to buy farming supplies and to pay rent on the land where he will grow his basic grains.

Jose's dreams are to have a better hut to protect his crops from disease, and to work during the summer in order to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay rent on the land where he will grow his basic grains.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, es madre de cuatro hijos, todos están en etapa escolar, ella solo estudio hasta noveno grado porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no podían seguir ayudandole para que estudiara, está casada y su esposo es empleado en la alcaldía. 

Rosa, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de dulces típicos, a ella le enseñaron a hacer dulces cuando se caso con el padre de sus hijos, porque la familia de su esposo tienen por tradición la elaboración de dulces y los comercializan por todo el país y también venden en las fiestas patronales de todo el país.
