Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, dulce de panela, leña y frutas de diferentes tipos, con ello espera mejorar considerablemente los ingresos de su negocio y poder darle a su esposo e hijos mejores  condiciones de vida. 

Rosa, sueña con terminar de construir su casa, la cual desde hace mucho tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo está construyendo.- Además, desea poder darle a sus hijos todo el apoyo que requieran para que alcanzen un nivel de estudio superior.
texts.en:
Rosa is mother to four children, all of whom are of school age. Rosa herself has only a ninth-grade education as her parents were poor and they could not continue to help her with her education. Rosa is married; her husband works for the local town hall.

For 20 years Rosa has made a living making typical sweets. She was taught how to do this when she married the father of her children. Her husband's family have as a tradition making sweets and selling them around the country. They also sell them across the country during national festivals.

Rosa needs this loan in order to buy sugar, panela, firewood and different types of fruits. With this loan she hopes to improve considerably her business' income, and to give her husband and children better living conditions.

Rosa dreams of finishing building her house which she has been working hard to build for a long time. Rosa also wants to give her children all of the support they need so that they may go on to further education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, panela, firewood and different types of fruits.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a vegetable vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Rosemarie dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 48 years old and married with one child. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like cereals, shampoo, hair and fabric conditioners, canned goods, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as cereals, shampoo, hair and fabric conditioners, canned goods, juice, soft-drinks, etc. 

Marlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cereals, shampoo, hair and fabric conditioners, canned goods, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old and married with nine children, four children are still in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Edna has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leony is 49 years old and all of her children are in school.

Leony has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Leony requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall.

Leony has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leony would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Diana Rose

texts.en:
Diana Rose is 30 years old and has three children. Diana Rose is married and two of her children are still in school.

Diana Rose is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Diana Rose requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Diana Rose has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Diana Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for three years. Lilibeth earns more income from raising pigs.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 52 years old and married with three children.

Marylou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Marylou has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 25 years old and married with three children, all of whom are presently in school. Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Ellen has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Navin

texts.en: Navin, 21, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. He is from the Kandal Province of Cambodia. Currently, he is studying at university to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in accounting. His family are farmers and they totally depend on farming for their revenue, which makes it hard to pay for his tuition fees. To pay for his tuition fees, he is applying for a loan of USD 2,800. When he finishes his bachelor's degree, he hopes to have a good job in a financial institution with a reasonable salary. He also wants to build a new house for his family and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor's or master's degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Gorrion Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Gorrión  está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras coordinado por Ana de 34 años de edad, soltera y madre de tres hijos, ella emprendió su negocio hace cinco años  el cual es la venta de ropa y zapatos, solicita por tercer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de pantalones, camisas, uno de sus logros con el crédito anterior fue la compra de utensilios de cocina porque su nueva meta es poner una comedor. La segunda socia doña Rosario de 57 años quien se dedica a la venta de golosinas en una de las principales paradas de buses y la tercer socia es doña Juana de 56 años, propietaria de una pulpería
texts.en:
The solidarity group Gorrión is composed of three women entrepreneurs and coordinated by Ana, 34, who is single and the mother of three children. She started her business five years ago and sells clothing and shoes. She is requesting her third loan through the institution to buy pants and shirts.

One of the goals she met with a previous loan was to buy kitchen utensils for a diner she was planning to open.

The second member is Rosario, 57, who sells sweets at one of the main bus stops. The third member is Juana, 56, who owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing, shirts, shorts, capris, perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, etc. in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 62 years old, married and has four children.

Nancy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nancy has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Loreza

texts.en:
Loreza is 40 years old and married with four children.

Loreza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Loreza has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Loreza aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José, utilizo el financiamiento anterior para reactivar la tienda, el resultado ha sido positivo, cuenta con clientes satisfechos y sus ingresos han mejorado, con ellos cumple con sus obligaciones.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, arroz, boquitas, dulces, bebidas, etc., tendrá mercadería en mayor cantidad para atender las demandas que de  sus clientes, también será de ayuda para darle mantenimiento al molino nixtamal, tiene fe que las ventas se mantengan.
texts.en:
Jose used his previous loan to restart his store and the result has been positive. He has satisfied customers and an improved income so he can meet his obligations.

He needs a new loan to buy oil, rice, snacks, sweets, beverages, etc. in order to have more stock to meet customer demand. It is also to help to provide maintenance for his nixtamal mill. He hopes his sales volume will continue.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, snacks, sweets, beverages, etc. in order to have more stock to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Los Urpichas De Huancaro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS URPICHAS DE HUANCARO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanet ella es conviviente y tiene 27 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,blusas y chompas, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank "LOS URPICHAS DE HUANCARO" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Yanet, 27, is one of the members. She and her common-law husband have three children. She works selling clothing: pants, blouses and sweaters. As a hard-working woman she is able to get ahead through her business. The loan she is requesting is to buy jackets, blouses and pants.

The other members are involved in cereal sales; clothing sales; a grocery store and a restaurant business.

The member is grateful to those taking part in her dream through this loan and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy jackets, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
Ma. Nelly is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Nelly is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Ma. Nelly has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Nelly requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, salt, spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Ma. Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Nelly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, salt, spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es: José, de 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene tres hijos Dayana de 16, Cristopher de 14, Anderson de 13 años  estudian en unidades educativas gratuitas ,  viven en un lugar muy apartado no tiene algunos servicios básicos, es humilde,  muy trabajador desde las cuatro de la mañana se levanta a dejar sacando la leche y alimentado a su vaca, luego va a buscar trabajo al jornal, necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca aumentar su producción seguir alimentando y educando a sus hijos él quiere que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades, a futuro desea adquirir  un terreno propio.
texts.en:
Jose, 43, lives with his common-law partner and his three children: Dayana, 16, Cristopher, 14 and Anderson, 13, who study at the free education center. They live in a very remote area and do not have basic utilities.

Jose is a humble, hard-working man who starts his day at 4:00 a.m. to milk and feed his cow. Then he goes off to seek work as a day laborer. He needs the money to buy a cow to increase production. He also must continue feeding and educating his children so they will have better opportunities. In the future he wants to buy his own land.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio, de 37 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

Anastacio, tiene 20 años de experiencia en realizar actividades agrícolas y en la crianza de cerdos, todo eso lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes dedicaron toda su vida a realizar estas actividades y hoy en día es puesto en práctica por Anastacio.- Pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar semilla mejorada e insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de hortalizas, porque debe aplicarlos en el momento indicado para tener una mejor cosecha.

Los sueños de Anastacio, son apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, cancelar el crédito y mejorar las instalaciones donde cuida y cría los cerdos.
texts.en:
Anastacio, 37, lives with his partner and he has two children who attend the community school.

For 20 years Anastacio has worked in agriculture, also raising pigs, which he learned from his parents who dedicated their lives to this activity. Now it is Anastacio who does this work. He also grows vegetables.

He needs the loan to buy improved seeds and farm supplies for his vegetable crops so he can apply them at the right time for a better harvest.

Anastacio's goal is to support his children in their education; to pay back the loan; and to improve the facilities where he cares for and raises the pigs.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds and farm supplies for his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Dédé est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 26 ans, Dédé vend des articles de mercerie et des pagnes dans son atelier de couture à domicile. Dédé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt, pour commander des pièces de pagnes première dame. Avec la marge  bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Dédé va pouvoir promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de son enfant et subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
The mother of one child, Dédé is a married woman who lives in Tokoin. She is 26 years old and sells haberdashery items and pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African cloth) from her sewing workshop located in her home.

Dédé gets her supplies twice a month at the market and is requesting this loan so that she can order some "première dame" ("first lady") pagnes. The profit margin she makes after some good sales will enable Dédé to ensure that her child gets a good education and to meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of "première dame" pagnes.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Enyonam est une femme âgée de 33 ans résidant à Tokoin. Enyonam est une coiffeuse qui expose des tissages, mèches et pagnes dans son salon de coiffure pour la revente et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Enyonam nécessite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de mèches et des pièces de pagnes en vue de mieux revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de relancer son activité et subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Single and without children, Enyonam is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. Enyonam is a hairdresser who displays weaves, hair extensions and pagnes (highly decorative and colourful West African cloth) for resale in her hair salon, and gets her supplies 3 times a month at the market.

Enyonam needs this loan so that she can order dozens of hair extensions and some pieces of pagnes and boost her sales, in order to earn more profits, relaunch her business and meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen sets of hair extensions and 10 pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la confección de polleras.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘ciudadela ferroviaria’ zona ubicada sobre una ladera que recorre varias zonas donde se cort camino por vías alternas entre ciudades.
Nelly es morena de baja estatura y físico delgado. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos mayores, todos trabajan y viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de polleras, estas prendas son utilizadas por mujeres de vestir tradicional, “inicie mi negocio confeccionando ropas para niños con el tiempo cambie a polleras…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja en su casa y cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar una máquina de coser industrial. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de polleras, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nelly solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar los diseños de polleras.
texts.en:
Nelly, who is 31, single, and without children, runs a skirt-making business. She is an independent and hard-working entrepreneur. Her business is in the "Railway Citadel" district on a hillside that covers several areas with different lines between cities.

Nelly is dark in complexion, petite and slim. She runs her business from her parents' house with her older siblings. They all work and live in their own brick-built house, which is equipped with all the basic amenities.

She makes traditional women's skirts in her business. She started her business making children's clothes, but over time she changed to making skirts. The advantages of her business are that she works from home and that she has regular clients. The drawback is the lack of money to buy an industrial sewing machine. This is her first loan application in three years of undertaking this work.

Therefore, Nelly is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine. In this way, she can improve the design of her skirts.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the designs of her skirts.

loans.name: Eliozane

texts.fr: Eliozane, 56 ans, vit en union libre. Mère de 3 enfants, elle se débrouille bec et ongles pour offrir une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille. N’ayant pas fait d’études elle-même, elle souhaite que tous ses enfants aillent à l’université. Elle vend des produits alimentaires au marché communal de la ville. Elle souhaite diversifier son stocks de marchandises pour démultiplier son chiffre d’affaires. A cours de capital pour acquérir plus de produits, elle demande un microcrédit qui lui permet d’ajouter de nouveaux produits à son stock. Elle veut vendre des légumes et d’autres produits comestibles dont son stand ne dispose pas actuellement.
texts.en:
Eliozane is 56 years old and is in a civil union. The mother of 3 children, she fights tooth and nail to be able to offer her family better living conditions. Having not been to school, she would like to see all her children go to university.

She sells food products at the communal market in town. She would like to diversify her merchandise in order to increase her turnover. Lacking the funds she needs to get more merchandise, she is requesting a microloan which will enable her to add new products to her inventory. She would like to sell vegetables and other edible goods currently not on offer at her stall.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Seng Hout

texts.en: Seng Hout is a 23-year-old, single lady who resides in the Siem Reap province. She is working for a small company and helps her parents with rice farming. Seng Hout is able to earn about 260 USD per month to support her living. Due to not having enough capital to support her studies, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for her tuition fees and to buy some study materials. She hopes to be able to complete her Bachelor's degree in Banking and Finance so as to get a better position with a high salary.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees and buy some study materials to complete her bachelor degree in Banking and Finance

location.town: Siem Reap province, Svay Ler district

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 30 years old and single.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 63 years old, married and has four children.

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has an internet café business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing and printing services. Marilyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional computer unit for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer unit for her business

loans.name: Adjo Fidèle

texts.fr: Agée de 35, Adjo est une femme mariée vivant à Tonkin et sans enfant. Adjo est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Adjo demande ce crédit pour commander des grands et petits sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien revendre puis d’épargner et mieux relancer son activité qui lui génère son revenu quotidien.
texts.en: Adjo, who is 35 years old, is a married woman who lives in Tonkin; she does not have any children. She sells charcoal and gets her supplies once a month at the market and resells them in front of her house. In order to get more supplies, Adjo is requesting this loan so she can order large and small sacks of charcoal, sell them well and then save some money and boost her business which generates a daily income for her.

loans.use: to buy 15 large sacks and ten small sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 51 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Rhoda has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 49 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liza has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Liza requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Liza has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est âgée de 64 ans et est une femme mariée. Akossiwa vit avec ses six enfants à charge à Tonkin. Akossiwa est une restauratrice de bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire et désire ce crédit pour commander le sac de maïs et des bols de sucre en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire et pouvoir ainsi aider son mari à  promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives with her six dependant children in Tonkin. Akissiwa makes bouillié (a type of gruel) made from corn and sells it to her customers who are happy with her business. She gets her supplies of necessary products twice a month from the market and would like this loan to order a sack of corn and bowls of sugar, so that she can sell well and make a good profit margin. She will then be able to help her husband to forward her children's education and cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn and 20 bowls of sugar.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, bread, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling vegetables.

Teresita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling of firewood business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Francisca has been in this business for 15 years. Francisca earns more income from raising pigs.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Maricel has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, snack food, and other personal care products. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buy and sell vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 45 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are still in school. 

Adela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Adela requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Adela has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Adela would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman, 49 years old, with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 49 ans, Adjo est une veuve femme qui vit à Tokoin avec trois enfants à charge. Adjo est une revendeuse de chèvres qui s’approvisionne et revend quatre fois par mois au marché. Adjo sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de chèvres en vue d’avoir en permanence un stock disponible puis de bien revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir prendre en charge les frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo is a 49-year-old widow who lives in Tokoin with her three dependant children. She retails goats which she buys and sells four times a month at the market. Adjo is requesting this loan to buy goats so that she can have a permanent stock available and then sell them well and earn sufficient profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy eight goats.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María vende ropa y perfumería para tener ingresos, se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de dos años y lo aprendió con ayuda de su hermana, ella es una mujer que también cuida de su familia, vive con su esposo y una hija de 10 años de edad, manifiesta no tener ayuda económica de sus parientes.
Invertirá en pantalones, blusas, vestidos, camisas, etc., presentara un inventario renovado a sus clientes para atenderlos mejor, de esta manera aumentara las ventas e ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Su objetivo es administrar bien su crédito para resarcirlo en el menor tiempo posible.
texts.en:
María sells clothing and perfume to have income, she has worked at this business for more than two years and she learned it with the help of her sister. She is a woman who also cares for her family, she lives with her husband and a 10-year-old daughter, she says that she doesn't have economic help from her relatives.

She will invest in pants, blouses, dresses, shirts, etc., she will present a refreshed inventory to her customers to serve them better, in this way she will increase her sales and income to improve her family's quality of life.

Her goal is to manage her loan well to pay it off in the least amount of time possible.

loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, dresses, shirts, etc., she will present a refreshed inventory to her customers to serve them better.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo est une veuve femme âgée de 52 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mère de quatre enfants, Améyo est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Améyo désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sacs de riz, de sucre et de cartons de tomates en vue de bien revendre et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Améyo is a 53-year-old widow who lives in Baguida. She is mother to four children and sells groceries which she stocks up on four times a month at the market and resells in her shop at home. Améyo would like this loan to fund her purchase of sacks of rice and sugar, as well as cartons of tomatoes, so she can resell them well and make more income to be able to contribute more to the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice, three sacks of sugar and two cartons of tomatoes.

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr: Alima est une veuve femme de 49 ans habitant à Baguida. Mère de trois enfants, Alima est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Alima sollicite ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock puis gagner des bénéfices afin de soutenir sa famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Alima is a 49-year-old widow who lives in Baguida. She is mother to three children and sells "pagnes" (brightly-colored pieces of fabric) which she stocks up on twice a month at the market and resells in front of her house. In order to be able to order "pagnes", Alima is requesting this loan so she can build up her stock and make more money. She will then be able to support her family and enable her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy ten pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “EMANUEL” conformada por 05 socias con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es rosalina una de las socias de 25 años de edad casada con 2 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de huevos. Desde hace más de 2 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder tener su local propio y ampliar su negocio ya que lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Solicito el crédito para la compra de huevos. El grupo “Emanuel” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Rosalina es la primera del lado izquierdo lleva en sus brazos a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en: This is the Emanuel group, made up of 5 members with desire to improve their quality of life. This is Rosalina, one of the borrowers, age 25 years old, married, with 2 dependent children. She works selling eggs. For over 2 years, she has had this business. Her greatest desire is to be able to have her own sales space and expand her business since she does it as a street vendor. She asked for the loan to purchase eggs. The Emanuel group is grateful to the people of Kiva who made this loan possible, since it allows them to continue improving. Rosalina is the first on the left and has her 2 children in her arms.

loans.use: to purchase eggs.

loans.name: Bencafort Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Bencafort está integrando por 3 mujeres quienes día a día, trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelantes a sus familias, sintiéndose orgullosas de poder tener sus propios negocios y obtener ingresos económicos para prosperar en la vida. El grupo lo coordina doña Lea de  46 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y prendas de acero de manera ambulante desde hace doce años y solicita por cuarta vez el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de camisas, licras, pantalones, chores, cadenas y aretes. Uno de sus logros con los créditos anteriores fue ofertar más productos. La segunda socia es la joven Jennifer de 22 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, la tercer socia es Afrania de 26 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y acero.
texts.en: The solidarity group Bencafort is made up of 3 women who, day by day, work hard to get their families ahead, feeling proud to be able to have their own businesses and get income to prosper in life. The group is coordinated by Lea, 46 years old, she has worked selling used clothing and steel items as a street vendor for twelve years and asks for the fourth time for a loan from the institution to purchase shirts, leggings, pants, shorts, necklaces, and earrings. One of her achievements with the previous loans was to offer more products. The second borrower is the young woman Jennifer, 22 years old, who works selling clothing and shoes, and the third borrower is Afrania, age 26, who works selling used clothing and steel items.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, leggings, pants, shorts, necklaces and earrings.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo, and other personal care products

Helen has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo, and other personal care products

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Generosa dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Jenna

texts.en:
Jenna is 34 years old and married with two children. Jenna works very hard to provide for her family.

Jenna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Jenna has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future Jenna would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo, and other personal care products

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 38 years old and both of her children are attending school.

Gemma has a general store business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Medardo

texts.es:
José vive en casa propia con su esposa, dos hijos y un nieto, tiene dos hijos que son independientes y le apoyan económicamente para que en su hogar tengan una buena alimentación, él trabaja en el campo cultivando maíz, maicillo y ajonjolí, además practica la crianza de ganado, el oficio lo desarrolla aproximadamente desde hace 25 años, lo aprendió cuando trabajaba junto a su padre.
Para darle el mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos está solicitando un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que combatirá las plagas que puedan afectar sus cosechas, espera tener mayor producción, generar nuevas ganancias y pagar con puntualidad su deuda.
Sus planes son tener cosechas abundantes, almacenar una parte para alimentar a su familia  y comercializar el resto.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his wife, two children, and a grandchild. He has two children who are independent and they support him economically so that in his house they eat well. He works in the fields growing corn, sorghum, and sesame, in addition he raises animals. He has worked in this trade for approximately 25 years, he learned it when he worked with his father. .

To provide adequate maintenance to his crops, he is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies with which he will fight the pests that can affect his crops, he expects to have better production, generate new earnings and pay off his debt punctually.

His plans are to have abundant harvests, store a part to feed his family and sell the rest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies with which he will fight the pests that can affect his crops.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida es una mujer muy honrada y trabajadora, de treinta y un años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, que dependen en su totalidad de ella  y de su negocio. Por eso, esta joven mujer, día a día  da lo mejor para que su pulpería prospere. Ya ha trabajo con financiamientos de MiCrédito junto a Kiva, el primero que recibió,  lo invirtió en su negocio y el otro en la construcción de un servicio higiénico en su casa. 
Confiando fielmente en ambas organizaciones, ella ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita abastecer su pulpería y comprar granos básicos, comida enlatada, detergentes, frituras, refrescos descartables, entre muchos otros productos que sus clientes están en constante demanda. En un futuro planea mejorar la infraestructura de local para convertirlo en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Cándida is a very honest and hard-working woman, thirty-one years old, she is the mother of three children who depend totally on her and her business. For this, this young woman, day by day, gives her best so that her store prospers. She has already worked with loans from MiCrédito with Kiva. The first that she got, she invested in her business and the other one in building a bathroom in her house.

Trusting loyally in both organizations, she has come back to Kiva with MiCrédito so that she can be granted a loan which will allow her to stock her store and purchase basic grains, canned food, detergents, fried foods, disposable soft drinks, and many other products that her customers are constantly demanding. In the future, she plans to improve the infrastructure of the space to convert it into a distributor.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, canned foods, detergents, fried foods, disposable soft drinks, and many more products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 39, is married with five children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Grace has a general store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items, such as spices, sardines, sugar, diapers and personal care products. She has been in this business for five years.

Grace has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through Negros for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aimée

texts.fr:
Aimée est une femme simple et travailleuse. Elle est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle exerce avec son mari une activité de vente de friperie et des sacs de seconde main. Elle tient le point de vente fixe, quant à son mari, il effectue une vente ambulante en répondant aux besoins de ses clients concernant les marchandises. Le couple sait très bien s'entraider mutuellement pour le bien-être de la famille. Le mari se porte garant dans le contrat de prêt. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis long temps car c'est une activité déjà pratiquée par ses parents. Elle l’hérité d'eux-même.
Elle voudrait que ses enfants réussissent dans leurs études et qu'ils auront de bonne carrière par la suite.
texts.en:
Aimée is a simple and hard-working woman. She is the mother of 4 children who all attend school. She and her husband have a business selling second-hand clothing and bags. She sells their goods from a fixed location and her husband sells on the street and responds to the buying needs of his customers. The couple are very good at supporting each other for the good of their family. The husband is acting as guarantor for the loan.

Aimée started in this line of work a long time ago as her parents had the same business and she inherited it from them. She would like her children to succeed at school and go onto have good careers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing, sheets, and women's handbags.

loans.name: Jessabel

texts.en:
Jessabel owns an eatery and at the same time she sells grocery items, home-made milk candy and peanut butter to have additional income. She has been in her business for seven years and yet she still wants continuous improvement.

To make her goal possible, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000. She will invest the loan in buying meat, vegetables, rice grains, sugar, snack foods and some kitchen utensils for her eatery business. She hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan amount. In this way, she could sustain her family needs and let her child finish her studies someday.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, rice grains, sugar, snack foods and some kitchen utensils for her eatery business.

loans.name: Miriam Yanet

texts.es:
Miriam, de 43 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a administra su propio negocio de venta de materiales plástico como tazas, platos, vasos, guacales, y todo lo que sea de metal o de plástico.- Ella creció con sus padres quien se dedicaban a la venta de granos básicos y otros productos de la canasta básica; ella está casa y tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

Miriam, tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de artículos plásticos y de granos básicos; pero también ha participado en un taller de corte y confección, de esta manera también se dedica a la costura.

Miriam, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar granos básicos, porque en esta época los puede adquirir a un precio económico, para luego ser comercializados a un mejor precio, también invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos de plástico para vender. 

Los sueños de Miriam, son mejorar su casa, ampliar su negocio y también poder apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos porque sueñan con ser profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Miriam is 43 years old. She is a housewife but also manages her own business selling plastic products, such as cups, plates, mugs, bowls and other items that are often made with plastic or metal.

Miriam was brought up by her parents, who made a living selling basic grains and other staple products. Miriam is married and has three children, who attend the local school.

Miriam has 20 years' experience selling plastic goods and basic grains. However, she has also attended a dressmaking workshop. She therefore also works as a seamstress.

Miriam needs this loan in order to buy basic grains and plastic goods to sell. She needs this loan now as she can buy the grains at a low price and sell them at a better price. Miriam will also invest part of this loan in new plastic products to sell.

Miriam's dreams are to make improvements to her house and to expand her business. She also wants to support her children's education as they dream of learning a profession.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and plastic goods to sell.

loans.name: Nirina

texts.fr: Nirina est une mère de cinq enfants de 5 à 14 ans. Ils sont tous scolarisés dans une école catholique. Elle est mariée et son mari est tireur de charette dont le revenu est très faible et aléatoire. Pour aider son mari à soutenir et entretenir la famille, elle dirige un stand d'alimentation de "kafe sy mofo" depuis l'an 2000. Le point de vente se trouve dans un bon emplacement, et on peut dire que ça marche, il y a des clients potentiels. Son objectif est de développer et améliorer l'activité afin de pouvoir augmenter le revenu pour qu'elle puisse continuer financer les études de ses enfants et acquérir des biens (rizière, zébus, etc..). Elle a 38 ans actuellement.
texts.en:
Nirina is the mother of 5 children aged between 5 and 14 years old. They are all going to a Catholic school. She is married and her husband works as a push-cart operator, a low-paying job with an unreliable income. In order to help her husband support and maintain the family, Nirina has been running a food stall, "kafe sy mofo", since 2000. Her stall is in a good location and her business is doing alright, she has potential customers.

Her goal is to develop and improve her business in order to increase her revenue so that she can continue to finance her children's education and acquire some assets (a rice field, zebus - a type of domesticated cattle). She is 38 years old.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, concentrated milk, whole milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 43 years old and married. She has two children.

Analie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Analie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Analie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, 53, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eva has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Eva requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat, fish, pork, chicken, spices and other ingredients and materials for her food production business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, pork, chicken, spices and other ingredients and materials for her food-production business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell at her stall.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bonifacia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Bonifacia has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from operating a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel, 27, is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school.

Michel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Michel has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Michel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Michel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Wendy Rebeca

texts.es: Wendy es una mujer laboriosa de 30 años de edad, casada y madre de dos niños de once y siete años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y nueva desde hace dos años, con ayuda de su mama quien la apoya atendiendo a los clientes, una de sus metas es surtir con variedad de mercadería su tienda, por lo que solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento de los socios de kiva para la compra de camisas, vestidos, chores,  pantalones, sabanas, fundas
texts.en:
Wendy is 30 years old and hard-working. She is married, and a mother to two children, ages eleven and seven years old.

Wendy has been making a living selling used and new clothing for two years. She does this with the help of her mother, who helps to serve customers.

One of Wendy's goals is to stock up her shop with a variety of merchandise. She is therefore applying for her first loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy shirts, dresses, shorts, trousers, bed sheets and pillowcases.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, shorts, trousers, bed sheets and pillowcases.

loans.name: Nuevo Amancer De Huarancca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANCER DE HUARANCCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Colquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


	
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Huarancca".

This bank is situated in the Colquepata district, part of the Paucartambo Province and the department of Cusco.

Victoria is a member of this bank. She is 53, married and has five children. She has a business selling cereals; she sells corn, wheat and quinoa, and works from 8am to 5pm. She has done this for 5 years already, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a store from which to sell the cereals. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The other members sell animals, cereals, groceries and work in agriculture.

Segundina is thankful to those who are part of her dream in this way, and promises to fulfill the payments in time with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful that she has sustained operations of her store through the help of Kiva and its supporters and thus helped in their daily living expense. She has continued to be positive and diligent in her business even if some customers do not fulfill their obligations.

She is again humbly asking for a 16,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail.

Her store means a lot to her since, for the past two years, it has been her source of income that sustained her family's basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help.

Elizabeth's simple dream is to find a place of her own for her store and for her youngest child to finish schooling. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Françoise a 37 ans. Elle est mère de trois enfants de 1 à 9 ans et deux sont scolarisés dans une école chrétienne privée. Elle est mariée et son mari est menuisier. Elle dirige un magasin général depuis 2006 juste après ses études universitaires. Le prêt va être utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de roulement. L'objectif est de développer le commerce afin de pouvoir améliore le revenu pour qu'elle puisse par conséquent améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Actuellement , la famille habite dans une maison appartenant à ses beaux-parents et elle projette de construire la sienne.
texts.en:
Françoise is 37 years old. She is the mother of 3 children aged between 1 and 9, two of whom go to a private Christian school. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. She has been running a general store since 2006, after completing her studies at university.

The loan will be used to reinforce her working capital, with the objective of developing her business in order to increase her revenue, so that she can improve her family's standard of living. She and her family currently live in a house belonging to her in-laws, and she plans to build her own.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, groundnuts, table oils, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old, married and has one child. Rosalinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rosalinda has been for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio Marcos se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva café ,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcos is still working in agriculture. He has land where he grows coffee; a business with which he wishes to provide for his family. His dream is to expand his farming business. Marcos is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

He is happy with the loan, and promises to meet the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ana Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana, de 25 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que mejoró gracias a financiamientos anteriores, ella creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y a vender productos básicos.- Su madre se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos de su hogar y a la venta de comida rápida en el parque de su municipio y ella estudio hasta octavo grado en la escuela de su comunidad.

Ana, desde pequeña se dedicaba a la venta de comida junto con su madre y fue ella quien le inculco buenas ideas y principios para poder salir adelante y poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia; desde entonces ha decidido continuar trabajando de esta manera ya que tiene el apoyo de su hermana menor.  

El dinero será utilizado para comprar mercadería, una estufa nueva y utensilios para la cocina, porque con los que cuenta están deteriorados y es urgente cambiar los utensilios, pero también comprará una mesa para los clientes, de esta manera dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejoraran sus ingresos económicos.

Los sueños de Ana, son mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y apoyar en la educación de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 25, looks after her household, and also sells fast food, a business she has been able to improve thanks to previous loans. She grew up with her parents, who worked in agriculture and sold basic goods. Her mother looked after the household and also sold fast food in the local park. She studied up to eighth grade in the community school.

Since she was young, Ana has sold food with her mother, who was the one to instill good ideas and principles in her to be able to get ahead and satisfy her family's needs. Since then she has continued to work in this way, and also has the support of her younger sister.

This loan will be used to buy goods, a new cooker and new cooking utensils, as the ones she is currently using are worn, and replacing the utensils is a matter of urgency. She also wishes to buy a table for her customers, which will allow her to give them a better service and so increase her economic income.

Ana's dreams are to improve the facilities of her business, and to support her siblings' education.

loans.use: to buy goods, a new oven and new kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 45 years old and married with two children.

She is in agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Alona is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alona has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy sea foods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Felina dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Trinidad works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Trinidad is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luz is 54 years old and has one child still in school.

Luz has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Luz has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeurn, 63, is a widowed mother of five children, two of whom are dependent. A child of hers is in school and needs her support. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and corn for 12 years. Lack of working capital and drought are main challenges to her farming business.
This former client has been with VisionFund for five cycle loans already and it has enabled her to get more income and upgrade her standard of living. Leading a group of three members to get loans, Chamroeurn will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crops yields. She hopes she will generate more income to expand her farming business and provide her school-aged child with enough school supplies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crops yields so that she can buy school supplies and expand her  farming business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 39 years old and has one child still in school.

Marivic has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials to her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

loans.name: Melindy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melindy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Melindy is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Melindy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina, 54 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Bendura, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and has eight children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a dedicated, determined and honest mother of two children. She is based in Nyamira, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest banana growing regions lending it the nickname of “Banana region.” For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, banana and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her earn a decent income.

Hellen passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising woman like her in her village and they joined Juhudi Kilimo.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lender to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Hellen will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Selpher

texts.en:
Selpher is a mother of ten from Suam, a rural village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She has been involved in farming for 10 years. Her primary income sources are maize and eggs. From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable but also enjoyable. The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital.

Selpher is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry is a big business if made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point. The income she will generate from her poultry farm alone is enough to facilitate timely loan repayments and savings. The loan will help Selpher’s family improve their quality of life. Support this woman who wants to offer her 10 children an excellent education and also build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Pescilisar

texts.en:
Pescilisar is a 59-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift valley area of Kenya. Pescilisar and her husband have eight children. For 20 years Pescilisar has been a mixed-farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm and also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden.

Pescilisar is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens are always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticultural farming.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.en:
Ramiro has a shoe workshop where he repairs and make shoes. He goes to the El Alto fair to sell his products.

Ramiro needs a loan to buy materials to make more shoes. He is also an employee of a seamstress workshop. He is single and lives with his parents, so he helps them a lot. He would like to have a bigger workshop in the future, so he hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy materials to make more shoes

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “PROSPERIDAD” conformada por 06 socias con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella es AUGURIA una de las socias de 63 años de edad casada. Ella se dedica a la venta de COMIDAS como arroz con pollo ají de gallina y muchas variedades más. Desde hace más de 8 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder  ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de más insumos como arroz papa pollo y menestras. El grupo “prosperidad” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito pues le permite seguir mejorando. Auguria es la segunda del lado izquierdo se encuentra sentada y viste chompa color azul.
texts.en:
This group, 'Prosperidad', is made up of six members who wish to improve their quality of life. Auguria, one of the members, is 63 and married.

She has a business selling food, such as rice with chicken, and ají de gallina [chicken in a spicy, creamy sauce], and many other varieties. She has had this business for eight years. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business.

She is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, potato, chicken and legumes.

The 'Prosperidad' group is greatful to Kiva for making this loan possible, as it allows them to continue growing. Auguria is in the middle in the photo, sitting down and wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as rice, potatoes, chicken and legumes.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Her name is Florinda, 40, a resident of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jeronimo, a fish vendor, and has three children. The couple help each other make a living and send their three children to school. They are in college, high school and elementary schools. They highly value education, for it is their hope and path to uplift their lives.

Florinda buys fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning and sells them at her town's public market. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. This has been their source of income for many years.

To help continue and expand her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 business loan. She will use it to buy more barrels of fish.

Her steady earnings in her fish stall is a great help in meeting their everyday needs and for the schooling of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for your great help.

Florinda aims to have a tricycle to transport barrels of fish from the port to the public market. She desires that all her children will get a college education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for several kilos of different kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: Artura

texts.en:
Artura is 61 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Artura is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Artura has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lucia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of households goods to sell for her general store business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of households goods to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 24 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from frozen food retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet, age 40, is a widowed woman who has seven children. There are five children relying on her, one of whom is in school. Residing in Kampong Cham province, this breadwinner has been growing rice on a hectare area of farmland for 22 years. Pests and diseases, which damage crops, are the obstacles to her business.

This is the first time for her with VisionFund and she, the group leader of four members, will use her loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to improve her farmland.

She dreams of increasing her income to upgrade the family’s living condition and support her child’s studying until graduating.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve farmland so as to upgrade family’s living condition and support the child’s studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh Group

texts.en:
Esi is 55 years old. She is a member and group representative of Jehovah Jireh Group. She is in the middle. Esi has an existing loan which is in its 3rd installment and she is paying well. She is a widow with 4 children. Their ages are 5, 18, 20, and 35.

Esi is a wood carver and has been in business for 20 years. She sells her crafts in the local market. She says the unavailability of other sources of fuel apart from firewood and charcoal has been her challenge when it comes to cooking.

The community education on climate change and the introduction of Elsa stove to her community by Field officers will help her save cost in buying charcoal as fuel for cooking and also save her family from inhaling the smoke associated with other sources of fuel. Esi and her group members need a loan to buy Elsa clean cook stove to be able to improve the health of their family and save their forest. Esi and her group members thank all their micro lenders for their generosity and help to improve their health and save the forest within their community.

loans.use: to buy an Elsa clean cook stove to use in the house.

loans.name: Felisidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Felisidad works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Felisidad is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy- and-sell vegetable business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Freddy Rafael

texts.es: Don Freddy es un hombre trabajador de 55 años de edad soltero y padre de tres hijos quien se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 21 años, en el negocio le ayudan cuatro trabajadores que le ayudan en la producción de los tamales y solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de maíz, leña, hoja, cal, elote y pagar el molino. Una de sus metas es mantener el negocio y hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Freddy is a hard-working man aged 55. He is single, and father to three children.

For the last 21 years he has worked selling tamales. He has four workers in the business, who help him with the production of tamales.
