He is in his first loan cycle, requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, leaves, and lime, and to pay the mill.

One of his goals is to maintain his business and allow it to grow.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, leaves, and lime, and to pay the mill.

loans.name: Atelita

texts.en:
Atelita is 54 years old and married with six children. 

Atelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Atelita requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Atelita has been in pig fattening for 13 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Atelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Margie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Yien

texts.en:
Yien is widowed and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 30 years.

Yien requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, 53, is a separated entrepreneur of Liposong, Ozamiz City. She has 8 children and is earning an income from her transport service business. She has been operatering this business for almost 15 years and earns about 8,000 PHP a month.

To improve her business, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which Julieta joined in 2009, to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Julieta is hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 50 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 6 y 28 años de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel es amable, generoso y muy perseverante tiene  2 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de abarrotes, gracias a este negocio a su familia ha sacado adelante.
Manuel con el afán de contar con un lugar donde poder producir otros ingresos ahora está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cinco cuerdas de terreno que lo utilizara para el cultivo de café. Pues es muy necesario que sus ingresos incrementen para el fortalecimiento económico de su familia. Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio, brindarles educación a sus hijos e incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 32 year old man. He is married with a beautiful family of six children aged between 6 and 28, who live in a community in Sololá.

Manuel is friendly, generous and very perseverent. For two years he has been buying and selling groceries. Thanks to this business he has been able to provide for his family.

Eager to have somewhere from which he can produce more income, he is now requesting a loan to buy five plots of land which he will use to grow coffee. It is very important that he is able to increase his income in order to strengthen his family's economic situation.

His greatest wish is to strengthen his business, provide his children with education and increase his crops.

loans.use: to buy five plots of land to grow coffee.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 42, is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Susana has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 54, is a married woman with ten children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a sewing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 25 years. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her sewing business.

loans.name: Merideth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merideth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Merideth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merideth has been sustaining her business activities through her loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Gina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Canesia

texts.en:
Canesia works hard to support her family. Canesia is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Canesia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Canesia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Canesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 43-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children, and her husband has been doing his own business of cattle farming for past 40 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Noreen's husband wants to purchase animals for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, Noreen has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's cattle business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a buying and selling of empty sacks business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more empty sacks to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years now.

Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more empty sacks to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a making of hollow blocks business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Arlene is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like sand, cement, etc., for her business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like sand, cement, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a retired person, 62 years old. He is married and lives comfortably with his wife. His sons are adults already.

Jesus has recently installed gas at his home but there are some problems with the connection that need work in the kitchen

He wants to thank the help you gave him last time, so he hopes you can help him again

loans.use: to fix his kitchen.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for the family.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Suna's Group

texts.en:
Suna is a 27-year-old, divorced woman living with her sister, brother-in-law and her 3-year-old son. After her divorce from her husband, she came back to her sister's house and started living with her sister's family, but she felt like a burden on her sister's family, as her sister was already responsible for her one son and two daughters.

So she planned to help her sister financially and started a small tailoring shop with her one sewing machine. She took orders from her customers for stitching plastic bags, and whenever she had time, she got involved in a cane craft. She makes mirror stands, tools, chairs, etc., from cane. She says that the cane craft is more profitable than tailoring.

Because of her limited financial condition, she is not able to develop her cane craft business. She earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for her family. She has a plan to purchase the raw materials (cane, coloring, nails, etc.) and appoint two workers for her business.

She, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount for purchasing raw materials (cane, coloring, nails, etc.) and appointing two workers for her business to help her to produce more.

The lady standing to the right-hand side in the photograph is Suna.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (cane, coloring, nails, etc.) for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Judith is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Combine Labour Group

texts.en:
Aminata is a thirty years old business woman. She is a member of “Combine Labour“ solidarity group. “Combine Labour” solidarity group belongs to a solidarity group of 4, two women and two men. (see group picture, Aminata is in the middle).
Aminata has been in palm oil business for the past 8 years. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm.
Aminata established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provide food from the profit she gets from the business.

Aminata and her group members needs a total of 6,000,000 SLL of which Aminata is entitled to Le 1,500,000 SLL which she will use to buy additional 50 gallons of palm oil. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Aminata is married and has two children ages ten and five years and they are all school going children.

In the feature, Aminata plans to generate more money to provide for her children university education. She believes educating her children to university will better the lives of her family.
Aminata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional 50 gallons of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old and married with nine children, one child still in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Thelma has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr:
Emilie a 58 ans, elle est mariée et son mari fait des petits boulots par ci et par là à part l'élevage et l'agriculture que le couple exerce ensemble. Et il l'aide dans l'exercice de son commerce de temps en temps. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous déjà mariés mais quatre de ses petits enfants vivent avec eux et sont à leur charge parce qu'ils sont orphelins (mère décédée). 
Pour augmenter le revenu, Emilie a ouvert un  petit magasin général en 2012. Le commerce n'a cessé de développer petit à petit depuis. Son problème est la hausse des prix des marchandises dernièrement donc, elle n'a pas pu s'approvisionner comme elle le voudrait. Son objectif est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Emilie is 58 years old. She is married and her husband does little jobs here and there in addition to raising livestock and farming which the couple does together. And, he helps her with her business from time to time. The couple has four children that are all married but four of her grandchildren live with them and they take care of them because they are orphans (deceased mother).

In order to increase their income, Emilie opened a little general store in 2012. The business has not stopped growing bit by bit since then. Her problem is the latest price increase in merchandise that prevents her from stocking as much as she would like. Her goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy dried beans, dried fish, table oil, bags of sugar, coffee, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Aiganysh

texts.en:
Aiganysh is a freshman in the software engineering program at AUCA. Getting a Kiva loan is very important for her and her family. She wants to get a good education, but her family is facing financial problems that are disturbing her. She believes that AUCA will provide her a modern and advanced education in her field that will help her to become a professional in the future.

Her family consists of four people: her father, mother, herself and her younger sister. Her younger sister goes to school. Some years ago, her father had a car accident that changed their lives. He lost his job, had debts and was depressed by the financial situation in his family. Nowadays, he doesn’t have a permanent job.

Her mother is a doctor, and she is the only person to provide for her family. She works day and night to make ends meet. In order to help her parents, Aiganysh has seasonal work in the summer, and it enables her to cover her expenses somehow.

Studying at a good university is the considerable part of her life. Aiganysh always loved to study, to learn more and new things at school. She was an active and a diligent schoolgirl; because of that, she had discounts to pay the school tuition. Now she is confident that she will get on with her studies at the university if her tuition fee is paid. She has already taken fall classes and is enjoying them every day.

Hoping for good days, she is applying for the AUCA’s financial aid and a Kiva loan, which is the only chance for her to make good and important changes in her life.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition costs in the software engineering program.

loans.name: Odo Kuw Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a 43 year old woman. She is from Apam in the Gomoa West District of the Central Region of Ghana. Sarah is the group representative of Odo Kuw. She is married with 3 children. All her 3 children are in school. Sarah is a food vendor who prepares variety of local dishes such as fufu with soup, banku (corn dough) with pepper and fried fish and emotuo (rice balls) with soup. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Sarah has been a client of the Field Partner since 2012 to grow her business to the current level through micro loan support. She has been committed to her repayment obligations with all her previous loans. Sarah has 3 employees who assist her in the smooth running of the bar. Many customers prefer to patronize her bar for food due to her good customer service, so there is a high demand for her services.

Sarah needs additional working capital support to buy meat, fish, and other ingredients in bulk to prepare more food to meet her customer’s demands. She will invest the current loan into her business which will boost her sales. This will inspire her to save more to secure a brighter future for the family. Sarah and her group members are grateful to all their Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy cassava, fish, meat, flour, and other ingredients to prepare local dishes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 34 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She operates dry goods, hog raising and corn farming business. She particularly sells foot wears such as slippers, umbrellas and blankets.

Rebecca would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP10,000 to keep her business profitable and progressive. She will use her requested loan amount in buying stocks of slippers, umbrellas and blankets.

loans.use: to be use in buying stocks of slipper, shoes, umbrellas and blanket to sell.

loans.name: Abelita

texts.en:
Abelita is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Abelita is 47 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Abelita has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Abelita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like woods, nails, varnish and other materials for her business.

Abelita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like woods, nails, varnish and other materials for her woodworking business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from selling banana.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Odette Léa

texts.fr:
47 ans, Odette Léa est mariée et son mari est professeur de mathématiques. Le couple a deux enfants dont l'ainé est déjà marié et le second qui a 18 ans en ce moment est en classe de terminale. 
Odette Léa  est une femme agriculteur très débrouillarde, elle exerce beaucoup d'activités génératrice de revenu: d'abord un petit commerce, ensuite,élevage de poulet de chair, agriculture  et enfin la production des briques qui est saisonnière et elle en a 25 années d'expérience dans ce métier. Récemment, elle a dû affronter à un problème de fonds de roulement à cause de l'hospitalisation de son enfant.
La famille a déjà sa propre maison actuellement et le prochain projet est d'acheter une camionnette pour transporter les produits et les briques.
texts.en:
47-year-old Odette Léa is married and her husband is a maths teacher. The couple have 2 children, the eldest of whom is already married and the youngest of whom is 18 and currently in his last year of school.

Odette Léa is a resourceful farmer who has many different businesses; she is a small retailer, she breeds broiler chickens, she farms and she also makes bricks, a seasonal activity which she has been doing for 25 years.

Recently, Odette Léa has been constrained by a lack of working capital because one of her children has been hospitalised. The family already has its own house and the next project involves buying a truck with which to transport her products, including her bricks.

loans.use: to buy a truck and pay workers' wages.

loans.name: Mwizero Ii Group

texts.fr:
Floribert  fait partie du groupe  Mwizero II et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 40 ans et est marié à Esperance, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 2 mois à 18 ans, dont  6 étudient. 

Il  vend de la viande dans sa boucherie  depuis  20 ans. 

Il est son à dix-septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de la viande  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Floribert is a member of the group Mwizero II and he lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to a merchant named Esperance. They have 7 children ages 2 months to 18 years old, six of whom go to school.

FIoribert has been selling meat out of his butcher shop for 20 years. This is his 17th loan cycle with Turame, and he will use the funds to increase his capital. He plans to buy meat to sell, which will bolster his revenue.

In the coming years, he would like to buy some land and support his children's education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase meat to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Bibihol

texts.ru: 56 летняя прекрасная женщина Бибихол. Она жительница района Н.Хусрав. Бибихол иеет троих детей. Детям 30, 28 и 20 лет. У Бибихол есть невестка и внуки. Она жизнелюбива, добрая, заботливая мать. Бибихол на районе как другие жители занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она выращивает скота у себя во дворе. Бибихол сейчас идет по стопам мужа. Ее муж занимался животноводством. Уже 3 года Бибихол продвигает деятельность мужа. У нее есть только один бизнес и источник доход. Путем животноводство Бибихол зарабатывает на жизнь. Она решила расширить деятельность и имеет больше скота. Для купли скота у Бибихол не хватает денежных средств. Она верит на Вашу доброту.  Из-за нехватки денег Бибихол обратилась за кредитом. У нее мечта увеличить поголовье скота и иметь несколько скота. Вы можете поддержать ее!
texts.en:
This 56-year-old wonderful woman is Bibihol. She is a resident of the N. Khusrav region and has three children aged 30, 28 and 20, as well as a daughter-in-law and grandchildren. She is a cheerful, good and kind mother. Like other residents of the region, she works in farming, raising livestock on her own property. She is following in her husband's footsteps by working in animal husbandry. She has been managing her husband's business for three years. It is her only business and only source of income. She earns a living through animal husbandry.

Bibihol has decided to expand her business by having more livestock. But she doesn't have enough money to buy more animals. She trusts in your kindness and is looking for a loan to cover the costs. She has a dream of increasing her head count of livestock and having more animals. You can support her!

loans.use: to expand her business and buy livestock

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a single mother and lives with her young son, who is in school. Flor gives her best because she has to pay the rent and would like to give a better life to her son.

She wants to send him to a better school and needs a loan to pay for her college tuition. Flor is studying Business Administration and she is also working at a bank

loans.use: to pay her college tuition for a BA in Business Administration

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa y trigo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Patricia devotes herself to the business of agriculture. She has a piece of land where she grows potatoes and wheat. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her agricultural business.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
You can always see food vendors walking along streets, or running when there are policemen pursuing them to get some fine, or just staying at one populous spot. Rhea, 33 years old, has been chasing the crowd in order to get higher sales. She is vending snack items such as coffee, softdrinks, sandwiches, boiled eggs, and packed viands. She carries these items in her tricycle so she can easily follow the crowd.

Likewise, her husband Guillermo, is doing his part as a driver. Rain or shine, they patiently work hard for the sake of their young children. They live in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental.

This time, Rhea plans to add frozen foods and dry goods such as slippers and umbrellas. She appeals for PHP 10,000 loan to buy these new items and usual ingredients for her food vending business. Hopefully, she can earn greater profit to sustain their needs and set aside some amount for the future. 

Rhea is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business and add frozen foods, slippers and umbrellas

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell root crops.

Catalina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 55 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Marbelin

texts.en:
Marbelin is 34 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Marbelin is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Marbelin has been farming vegetables for 3 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marcelita is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marcelita has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Marcelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 39 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Virgie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virgie has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell chorizo business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of chorizo to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of chorizo to sell to her customers

loans.name: Trust In Allah Group

texts.en:
This is thirty-five years old Mohamed, married with two children. His children are school going children. Mohamed belongs to a solidarity group of three women and four men, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Trust In Allah” is the name of Mohamed’s solidarity group. “Trust In Allah” group needs a total loan of 10,000,000SLL.

Mohamed will receive 1, 000,000SLL which he needs in order to purchase 3 cartoons of torch lights for his business. (see group picture, Mohamed is in the far left).

Mohamed established his torch light business 10 years ago, for the business to ensure his family gets enough money for their basic needs. Mohamed uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for his family and support his children’s education. He opens his business Monday through Saturday every week. Mohamed is a hardworking man, he opens his business from 9 am to 6 pm.

In the future, Mohamed plans to support his children to acquire university education. He hopes that one day he will become an international business woman. He thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase 3 cartoons of torch lights for his business.

loans.name: Genny Magaly

texts.es: Magaly tiene 31 años, de estado civil casada  tiene una hija de 10 años Evelyn  ella estudia en una escuela estatal, su esposo trabaja barriendo los mercados,  viven en el campo carecen de algunos servicios básicos. Magaly  cría pollos hace más de cinco años .Ella necesita el dinero para construir galpones donde puedan desarrollarse mejor las aves, generando mayores ventas para obtener dinero  cubrir la alimentación y educación de su pequeña niña, piensa a futuro tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Magaly, age 31, is married and has a ten year old daughter, Evelyn. Her daughter goes to a state school. Her husband works sweeping the markets. They live in the country and lack some of the basic services. Magaly has been raising chickens for five years.

She needs the money to build chicken coops where the birds are able to develop better. This will generate greater sales in order to have money to cover her little daughter's food and education.

In the future she plans to have her own house.

loans.use: to build chicken coops.

loans.name: Chenie

texts.en:
Chenie is 49 years old and married with three children.

Chenie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Chenie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Chenie has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Chenie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband operates a hair salon, which he has been doing for 10 years. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members and manage the household.

Rehana's husband needs to buy chairs, seats, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for his beauty salon but due to financial constraints he cannot do so. Rehana requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to buy the relevant items for his business so he can provide better services to his customers, The loan will help him to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, seats, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories  for her husband's hair salon.

loans.name: Lalao Juliette

texts.fr:
Lalao est une paysanne née. Actuellement, elle a 45 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants à la campagne. Elle pratique toute sorte de culture et d’élevage pour gagner sa vie. 
Cela fait maintenant 3 ans qu’elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Les prêts précédents lui ont permis de développer son activité d’élevage en achetant de la volaille et des porcs. Les bénéfices lui ont permis d’assurer la vie quotidienne et la scolarisation des enfants. Ce prêt va lui permettre de cultiver de la pomme de terre en achetant des semences et des engrais. Elle va aussi acheter une vache laitière ainsi que de l'alimentation.
Son objectif est d’être autonome dans son activité de culture et d’élevage et de laisser suffisamment de terre à cultiver comme héritage aux enfants .
texts.en:
Lalao is a born farmer. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in the countryside. She earns her living by farming all types of produce and breeding livestock.

She has been a Vahatra borrower for 3 years. The previous loans have helped her to develop her livestock farming by enabling her to buy chickens and pigs. The profits she has made have allowed her to cover her daily expenses and her children's education costs.

This loan will allow her to buy seeds and fertiliser and to grow potatoes. She will also buy a dairy cow and some feed. Her goal is to be a self-sufficient farmer and to be able to leave enough arable land to her children.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertiliser, a dairy cow, and some feed.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 43-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for past two years; he is only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Naheed's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purposes.

Therefore Naheed has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also be helpful for him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Naheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more commodities for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Eoeun's Group

texts.en:
A 29-year-old farmer from Kratie province, Eoeun is married and blessed with two dependent children in school. She, together with her husband, is growing cassava for her main source of income. They have been in this business for years. In order to earn more income, Eoeun sometimes works for her neighbors for fees.

Pests are the main challenge to her farming business. She decided to form a four-member group to apply for loans from VisionFund, and this will be her first loan cycle. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy organic pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield and sell it for a good price to support children’s studies and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to support her farmland to improve her living conditions and support her children’s studies.

loans.name: Eau Vive Group

texts.fr: Noelie, est une femme âgée de 34 ans mariée mère de trois enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 6 ans dans la vente des habits d'enfants. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme, son courage et sa stratégie c'est qu'elle vend des marchandises de bonne qualité et aussi elle respect sa clientèle. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des habits d'enfants à 100 000 f, de lotions pour bébé à 25 000 et de silips bébé à 25 000. Le prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner afin de renforcer son activités. elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à ACFIME aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Noelie is a 34-year-old, married mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She has been selling children's clothing for six years. Her business is successful as a result of her energy, courage, and her strategy is to sell high quality merchandise. She also respects her customers.

She would like this loan to buy 100,000 francs worth of children's clothing, 25,000 [francs] worth of baby lotion, and 25,000 [francs] of children's undergarments. The loan will allow her to purchase supplies in order to strengthen her business. She has already received one loan and has reimbursed ACFIME on time.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing (100,000 francs), baby lotion (25,000 francs), and children's undergarments (25,000 francs)

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
Edilyn is 35 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Edilyn has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing for 13 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Anastacia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anastacia has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anastacia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita is 57 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Elecita works very hard to provide for the family.

Elecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Elecita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, detergent soap, beer, shampoo, etc.

Elecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 46 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 30 years.

Shamim's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles and a sewing machine. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items. Therefore Shamim has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.

On this financial assistance Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband, for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Tuza Group

texts.fr:
Dionise fait partie du groupe Tuza et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 47 ans et est marié à Rose, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 11 enfants âgés de 3 à 25 ans, dont  8 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce des œufs   depuis  1 an. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu'il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  d’œufs à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dionise is part of the Tuza group and lives in Gitega. He is 47 years old and married to Rose, a farmer. The couple have eleven children aged between 3 and 25, eight of whom attend school.

Dionise has been selling eggs for a year. This is his second loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his working capital and enable him to buy a large quantity of eggs for resale, in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Jose Nehemias

texts.es:
José, de 30 años de edad, es muy dedicado a los trabajos de la agricultura y la albañilería y todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su padre y desde entonces lo ha desempeñado a lo largo de su vida y se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, que le ha servido para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia que está formada por su esposa y su hijo de 4 años que actualmente está estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura y la albañilería desde muy pequeño, durante muchos años ha realizado actividades productivas en las cuales ha desarrollado mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre y su abuelo. En la actualidad se dedica a la construcción la cual le ha generado los suficientes ingresos para satisfacer sus compromisos crediticios y necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El dinero del préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y foliares para una mejor producción de maíz y frijoles y para comprar algunas herramientas que necesita para la construcción, su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas  y de esta manera le da un aporte económico a su familia.

Los sueños de José, son tener muchas herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 30 years old, is very dedicated to agriculture and construction work. Everything he knows he learned from his father, and since then he has carried it out throughout his life, and it has become his main source of income, which has allowed him to meet the needs of his family. His family is made up of his wife and his 4-year-old son who is currently studying at the school in the community.
Jose has worked in agriculture and construction since he was very young. For many years he has done productive work, in which he has developed a lot of knowledge and experience thanks to the teachings of his father and grandfather. Currently, he works in construction, which has generated sufficient income to meet his credit commitments and the basic needs of his home.
The loan money will be used to buy plant fertilizers to have a better production of maize and beans, and to buy some tools that he needs for construction. His wife works in the sale of tortillas, and in this way gives some economic support to the family.
Jose's dreams are to have a lot of work tools.

loans.use: to buy plant fertilizers to have a better production of maize and beans, and to buy some tools that he needs for construction.

loans.name: Susama's Group

texts.en:
Susama, aged 26 years, is a differently abled lady from a small village of Narsinghpur district and is the leader of this group. She lives with her husband, in-laws and one daughter who is in primary school.

Susama’s husband owns a betel shop and meets the household expenses of the family but it is not sufficient to fulfill all the essentials of the family. Susama started her tailoring business and has an experience of two years in this business.

She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Susama will use her portion of loan amount to purchase raw materials like oil for her sewing machine, thread, needles, blades and scissors for her business so that she can acquire a larger number of customers by taking a higher amount of orders.

She aspires to purchase a new, fully automated sewing machine, which will boost the speed of her work and increase her savings, which she will invest further in her daughter’s education.

Susama is standing to the right-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like oil for her sewing machine, thread, needles, blades and scissors for her business.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Femme mariée de 55 ans, Afiwa vit à Agoè et est mère de cinq enfants. Afiwa se bat énormément en fument les poissons dans un four pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Afiwa demande ce crédit pour commander des cartons de poissons en vue de mieux revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en: Afiwa is a 55-year-old, married woman who lives in Agoè and has five children. Afiwa works a great deal smoking fish in an oven to meet her own needs and those of her children. Afiwa is asking for this loan to order containers of fish with the goal of selling more and having a large supply. She wants to maximize her profits in order to help her children with their education and their growth.

loans.use: to buy five containers of fish.

loans.name: Samat

texts.en:
Samat is 19 years old and a freshman in the Economics Program at AUCA. He finished one of the local schools with good grades and always was an active school-boy. He participated in all class activities and volunteered with friends. Since seventh grade he began to work in summer as his family was short of money. In 11th grade he wrote a project about carrying out the city championship in the high-speed Assembly of the Rubik’s cube. Unfortunately, this project existed only one year due to the lack of money.

This project gave a belief in himself and he tried to enter AUCA’s 1-year Prep Program on a full Scholarship. He improved his English, learned how to write an essay and passed the entrance exams. He was selected as a finalist, so in summer 2015 he successfully finished the Prep Program.

During his Prep Program Samat got acquainted with AUCA’s life and its spirit. He says that now AUCA is more than a university for him. It is his chance to implement his dreams and aims, where he can expand himself and construct his future path.

The thing what bothers him is a university tuition fee, what is not affordable for his family. He has two younger sisters and younger brother. His father is a builder and mother sews clothes. According to his words, his parents’ jobs are seasonal and they have a good opportunity to work in summer and fall, but not in winter and spring. His mother usually sews at home as she has 2-month baby.

Samat’s family has good expectations from him as he is the eldest child in the family and trying to do everything to give their son a good education in the one of the best universities in Central Asia.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education in the Economics Program.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia lives with her 3 little children and all of them are going to school. She makes cheese to sell at many fairs and markets. She learned how to make cheese when she was a child and now she is helped by her children. The family lives at an adobe house, where they have water and electricity.

She needs a loan to buy a cow to provide milk for making cheese. She has to take care of her children by herself. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a cow to provide milk for her cheese making business

loans.name: Goldie

texts.en:
Goldie finds pleasure in doing his farming activities and both he and his wife help with their farm to earn to make a living. He is 25 and married with two children, He keeps herself busy to sufficiently provide for the family. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2010 and He gains access to micro finance services of the coop.

Recently, He applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Goldie wishes to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his banana farm.

loans.name: Elvy

texts.en:
Elvy is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvy is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Elvy has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Elvy requested a PHP 24000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Elvy has been in this business for 15 years. Elvy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anjum

texts.en:
Anjum is a 33-year-old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall. Her husband sells different types of eatable items, e.g., burgers, samosas, vegetable rolls, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Anjum's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Anjum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's food stall business.

loans.name: Datsugbe  Jeanne

texts.fr: Datsugbe est âgée de 50 ans et est une femme divorcée. Datsugbe vit avec ses cinq enfants à charge à Agoè. Datsugbe est une restauratrice de bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Datsugbe s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et prendre en charge les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Datsugbe is 50-year-old, divorced woman. Datsugbe lives in Agoè with her five children, whom she supports. Datsugbe is a restaurant owner and sells corn-based porridge to her customers who like her business. Datsugbe purchases ingredients three times a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order bags of corn. Her goal is to have good sales and then make a nice profit and be able to help her children with their schooling and take care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy six bags of corn.

loans.name: May Anne

texts.en:
May Anne is a 27-year old college undergraduate who lives in Pulupandan. She belongs to a family of 3. May Anne is living with her grand mother. Her parents are separated; her father works as a personal driver in Iloilo with his other family and her mother works as an overseas foreign worker in New York. May Anne is financially supported by her mother every month, but her total monthly allotment of Php 8,000 ($173) is not enough even for her basic needs.

May Anne would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at Bagosphere will allow her to realize this goal. May Anne aims to have a stable job with high salary and to stand on her own. Your support in funding her loan will help May Anne have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Minda works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Minda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sajda Asghar

texts.en:
Sajida is 40 and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop. He has been working 16 years ago to meet the family’s expenses. He deals with scrap goods, for example scrap iron, aluminium, plastic bottles and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the hawker and sells it to the recycling factories.


Nowadays Sajida’s husband wants to invest in a scrap shop for proper income but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase scrap material. Therefore Sajida has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Sajida’s husband can purchase more scrap material to earn an income.

Sajida and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: Invest in her husband's scrap shop

loans.name: Suhudoo Ashibiti Yapala Fong Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Salamatu is a hardworking business woman who lives in Karaga in the Northern region of Ghana. Salamatu is a mother of 3 children aged between 1 and 12, 2 of whom attend school. She is the person seated first from right with a basin of dried fish in front of her in the group photo.
Salamatu is a member of a group called ‘Suhudoo Ashibiti Yapala Fong’ located in Karaga. ‘Suhudoo’ literally means Peace. Salamatu sells fish, spices and cooking oil in the local markets around Karaga. She has been in this business for 5 years now, but challenged with inadequate capital.

Salamatu and her group have therefore applied for a loan of GHC 14000.00, out of which Salamatu wants GHC 1000.00 to buy fish, spices and cooking oil for retail. The loan would help Salamatu increase her capital to be able to earn more income to pay off her loan and support her children.
Salamatu thanks Kiva for the opportunity to be a supportive mother to her children.

loans.use: to buy fish, spices and cooking oil for retail.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with one child. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelita is 30 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Amelita has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood like crabs, shrimp, oysters, etc.

Amelita has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood like crabs, shrimp, oysters, etc.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 31 years old, married with four children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Virgie has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming vegetable.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 46 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Lourdes has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, etc

loans.name: Anamoore

texts.en:
Anamoore is 48 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anamoore has a business, selling beauty products in the Philippines. Anamoore requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of beauty products to offer for sale.

Anamoore has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anamoore would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Halado

texts.fr: Halado est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 24 ans, Halado vend des bijoux pour gagner son revenu quotidien. Pour s’approvisionner, Halado se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Halado demande ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de bijoux en vue de mieux revendre puis se faire une marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à supporter les charges quotidiennes de la famille et de bien prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en: Halado is married woman who lives in Agoè with one child whom she supports. Twenty-four years old, Halado sells jewelry to make an income. Halado goes to the market two times a month to purchase supplies. Halado is asking for this loan to order dozens of pieces of jewelry. Her goal is to sell more and then make a good profit in order to be able to help her husband meet the family's daily needs and to take good care of her child.

loans.use: to buy four dozen pieces of jewelry.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet, who is 33 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps dairy animals and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Linet makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Linet can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce.

She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Linet’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. The work this mother does to survive with her loved ones is commendably dignified, and it is worthwhile to provide her the benefit of the support she needs.

The farm work this woman does to survive deserves applause and it is a good idea to help her with the support she is asking for. Be inspired and make a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Faiza Mai

texts.en:
Faiza is 58 and a mother of eight children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Faiza buys materials such as a hand-embroidery kit, ribbon, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business.

So, Faiza request a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Faiza and her family will be thankful to KIVA, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.
.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw material for herself

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en: Roselie is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells frozen foods in the Philippines. Roselie has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from selling clothes. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell. Roselie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Twaranyuzwe Group

texts.fr:
Stany  fait partie du groupe  Twaranyuzwe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 44 ans et est marié à Séraphine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7mois à 15ans, dont  4étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  riz, de haricot, des habits,… depuis  20 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de riz et  de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une vache, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Stany is a member of the Twaranyuzwe Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 44 years old and married to Séraphine, a farmer. Together they have 5 children between 7 months and 15 years old, 4 of whom are in school.

He has been selling rice, beans, clothing... for 20 years.

This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy a large supply of rice and beans to resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a cow and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of rice and beans to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AGUILAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de La Convencion, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Donata ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura y tambien la socia cria animales como patos y gallinas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the LAS AGUILAS community bank in Cusco.

Sra. Donata, 47, is married and has 4 children.  She has a farming and poultry business.  She owns land where she grows coffee, platanos and cacao.  On a typical day, she starts work at 8:00am and works until 6:00pm.  She has operated the business for 5 years and says that it is successful.  She hopes to expand the business in future and is applying for a loan that she will use to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Other members of the group operate various businesses: snack sales, clothing sales, a corner grocery and a restaurant.  

Sra. Donata is grateful for this means of raising funds for her business and is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés de 34 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañera de vida, su hija de 14 años y demás miembros de la familia. Moisés es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios como mecánico de estructuras metálicas. Esta labor tiene 3 años de venir desempeñándola, por lo que en el transcurso de ese tiempo ha adquirido experiencia y muchos clientes los cuales prefieren de sus servicios. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle todo lo necesario a su esposa y a su hija, Moisés solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro, discos de pulidora, láminas, electrodos, guantes, careta de seguridad, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo de mecánico.
texts.en:
Moises, who is 34 years old, lives next to his life partner, his 14-year-old daughter, and other members of his family. Moises is a responsible man and very hard-working who works offering his services as a mechanic with metallic structures. He has done this work for 3 years, which is why in the course of this time he has acquired experience and many clients who prefer his services.
Looking to improve his quality of life and offer everything necessary to his wife and his daughter, Moises is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: iron, polishing machine disks, metal sheets, electrodes, gloves, safety mask, etc., to continue doing his work as a mechanic.

loans.use: to invest in: iron, polishing machine disks, metal sheets, electrodes, gloves, safety mask, etc., to continue doing his work as a mechanic.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 30 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Donald Javier

texts.es:
Donald, es un hombre muy audaz de treinta y cinco años de edad que poco a poco ha ido sacando adelante su carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, actualmente ya egreso, solo le hace falta su título. Trabaja como docente de formación profesional de sistema. Gracias al apoyo de su familia el logro cumplir su principal sueño que fue estudiar en la universidad. 
Él ha tocado las puertas de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un financiamiento que le dé la oportunidad de comprar una laptop, este equipo le es fundamental para preparar su tesis que presentara como forma de culminación de la carrera. En un futuro desea seguir estudiando, especializarse en informática y obtener mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Donald is an audacious man, he is 35 years old and slowly he has been working in getting his career in Systems Engineering. He graduated and only needs his degree. He works as a professional training teacher. Thanks to the support of his family he has reached his dream, which was to study in the university.

He has knock the Kiva doors along with MiCredito to request a loan that will give him the opportunity to buy a laptop. This equipment is necessary to prepare his thesis which he will present to complete his career. In the future he would like to continue studying, specializing in information systems to obtain better job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad, vive al lado de su hija de 18 años, su hijo de 15 años de edad y su compañero de vida, quien la ayuda con la economía del hogar. María es una mujer emprendedora que para cubrir los gastos de su familia ha instalado un pequeño negocio de venta de pollo por libra, además también se dedica a la venta de medicinas. Estos negocios los administra con el fin de poder cubrir los gastos de su vivienda. María en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: libras de pechuga y pierna de pollo, y medicina para la alergia, fiebre, gripe, dolor, etc. de esta manera aumentar sus productos y así también sus ventas.
texts.en: María, 41, lives with her husband and two children, an 18-year old daughter and a 15-year old son.  She and her husband share household expenses.  María is an enterprising woman and operates two businesses.  She sells chicken parts by the pound and medicines for treating simple ailments such as colds, fevers, allergies, etc.  Her earnings from the business help to support her family and she is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to buy chicken parts and medicines that she will resell to her customers.

loans.use: to stock her two retail businesses.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia works hard to support her family. Celia is single and has a pharmacy business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of medicine to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Ramiriza Group

texts.fr:
Dénise  fait partie du groupe  Ramiriza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 50 ans et est mariée  à Isidore, un agent de regideso. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 17 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce d'habits  depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est son  à son seizième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Dénise is a member of the group Ramiriza and she lives in Bujumbura. She is 50 years old and married to a Regideso agent named Isidore. They have 2 children ages 17 and 18 years old who both go to school.

Dénise has been selling clothing for 15 years. This is her 16th loan cycle with Turame, and she will use the funds to increase her capital. She plans to buy a large supply of clothing to sell which will bolster her revenue.

In the coming years, she would like to buy some land and continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large supply of clothing to sell and bolster her revenue.

loans.name: Patricia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña patricia es una microempresaria emprendedora de 52 años de edad, casada y madre de un joven de 18 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace ocho años y solicita por sexto ciclo el financiamiento de la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de camisas, pantalones, vestidos, zapatos y sandalias. Su meta es que su negocio siga creciendo. Con el crédito anterior logro la compra de un juego de sillas.
texts.en: Doña Patricia, 52, is married and has an 18-year old son.  She has operated a small business selling clothing and footwear for 8 years.  She is applying for a sixth round of funding from the bank because she wants to stock her business with the merchandise she sells: shirts, trousers, dresses, shoes and sandals.  She tells us that she used her last loan to buy a set of chairs and that her goal now is to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 51 years old and married with three children.

Valentina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Valentina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and raising pigs.

Valentina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jolie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jolie works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jolie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy -and-sell rice business.

Jolie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable, who is 39 years old, is a charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. 

Mable is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Mable makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. 

Given that Mable can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Mable’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Mable a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Dora Vilma

texts.es: Dora de 53 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia, en la cual ha vivido prácticamente toda su vida. Vive acompañada de su madre de 89 años de edad. Dora en busca de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a la venta de pollos. En este negocio los compra vivos para luego venderlos por libra. El cual ha administrado desde hace varios años y esto le ha permitido obtener un número bastante grande de clientes, y gracias a ello han aumentado las ventas. De esta manera puede ofrecerle todo lo necesario a su madre de avanzada edad. Dora en busca de mejorar su condición de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y bolsas plásticas para aumentar la mercadería de su negocio y aumentar las ventas, ya que la demanda ha subido para sus productos.
texts.en: Dora, 53, and her 89-year old mother live in the house where Dora has lived almost all of her life.  She operates a poultry business, raising chickens and ultimately selling the parts by the pound.  Dora has operated the business for years and has many customers now.  Her sales have grown over the years and her earnings now support her and her elderly mother.  Dora is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to grow her business.  She plans to buy more chickens along with animal feed and plastic bags that she will resell.  Demand for the merchandise she sells has increased, she says, and she wants to make the most of the demand.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and plastic bags for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a sound system for her home.

loans.name: Marbely Mendoza

texts.es: Marbely es una microempresaria exitosa de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de 12 y 17 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de celulares desde hace 10 años y solicita por sexto ciclo el financiamiento en la institución porque desea aumentar la variedad de productos con la compra de celulares de distintas marcas, accesorios como cargadores, auriculares y baterías, uno de los logros que obtuvo con el crédito anterior fue la compra de un televisor y una cocina. Su nueva meta es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Marbely is a successful small businesswoman. She is 34 years old, married, and is the mother of two children, ages 12 and 17.

She has been selling cellphones for ten years. For her sixth loan cycle with the institution, she is requesting financing because she wants to increase the variety of products by buying cellphones of different brands, and accessories like chargers, earphones and batteries.

With her previous loan, she was able to purchase a television and a kitchen. Her new goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, chargers, earphones and batteries.

loans.name: Eva Mae

texts.en:
Eva Mae is 32 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Eva Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Eva Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like coffee, cereals, juice, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sugar, etc. to sell.

Eva Mae has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, juice, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sugar, etc. 

Eva Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like coffee, cereals, juice, shampoo, fabric conditioners, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
