Ellen is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Ellen has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, detergent soap, coffee, sanitary pads, diapers, etc.

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, coffee, milk and other household goods to sell.

Lenny has been in this business for 33 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, coffee, milk and other household goods to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marivic has a general store business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marivic has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
Norelyn is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Norelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Norelyn has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell peanut business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melba is 40 years old and has eight children who are in school.

Melba has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from a personal collection to sell.

Melba has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from a personal collection to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Group

texts.en:
Haja is a member of Oscar solidarity group (see group picture, Haja stands on the left). She sells palm oil. Haja has been selling palm oil for the past 9 years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Haja and other group members of Oscar solidarity group are requesting for their first loan. Haja and her group members are in need of a loan of 6,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Haja will personally receive 1,500,000SLL which she will use to purchase more 50 gallons of palm oil for her business.

Haja is thirty-nine years, married and has three children age eighteen, fifteen and ten years old. Haja hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well
Haja and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase 50 gallons of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is 50 and a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income, which she started 10 years ago with the aim to contribute to the family income. She has since then proved herself as a talented entrepreneur.

Naheed buys materials such as Hand- Embroidery kit, ribbon, needles and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers, so she has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market. That she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business.

Naheed requested a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Naheed and her family will be thankful to the Kiva, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself.

loans.name: Then's Group

texts.en:
Then, who is 30 years old, is a local farmer living in Kratie province. She is married with two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the remaining one is too young for schooling. Cassava growing is the main business to this family while working for others is the secondary business earning additional income. 
Then is now leading a group of five members to apply for loans from VisionFund, which is the second cycle loan for her. Past loan has helped her timely meet family’s needs. For this cycle, she will use her loan portion to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes she will earn more income to uplift her lifestyle and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields and keep sending her children to school. .

loans.name: Peace - Women  Pwalugu Group

texts.en:
Gifty is a 39-year-old married woman with 5 children living in Pwalugu in the upper east region of Ghana. Gifty is the individual standing first on the right holding a blue plastic container in one hand, and the other hand stretched out in the photo.

Gifty is a member of a group of businesswomen called ‘Peace Women - Pwalugu’. Gifty is a petty trader selling assorted items of soap and other detergents at the local market. Her business has a great potential for growth due to the level of demand in the locality.

Gifty and her group have asked for a loan of GHC 12,400 Her share of the loan is GHC 1,000 which would be used to buy assorted soaps and detergents to sell. She aspires to earn more income to pay off her loan and grow her business.

Gifty is able to cater for her children’s needs because of her business, which thrives through the loan support, thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy assorted soaps and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas was born in 1978. She is a very smart and hardworking woman. Mukaddas is a married parent of three children. Her children are not yet adults. Mukaddas’s husband is a welder. They always wanted to see their children become higher educated people. Mukaddas’s eldest son, who was born in 1998, is a student of the first course now. He is smart and studies well.

Mukaddas must pay for the education of her son, but she has no money, as her income from sewing is small. She sews a variety of national dresses, and she has been busy with this activity more than 12 years. Mukaddas is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to pay tuition for her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her son.

loans.name: Jesus Edilberto

texts.es: Jesús de 52 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijos de 10 y 19 años de edad, su compañera de vida y demás miembros de la familia. Jesús es un hombre trabajador y responsable quien se gana la vida gracias a que presta sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su vivienda. Además con mucho esfuerzo ha instalado una pequeña tienda en su hogar, la cual administra su esposa, ya que tiene 6 años de manejar este negocio cuenta con bastantes clientes, gracias esto logra llevar el sustento diario a su familia, y con ello puede sacar adelante a sus hijos. Es por lo que Jesús solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas, lácteos, golosinas, pan dulce, sopas, etc. para aumentar la mercadería y de esta manera aumentar las ventas.
texts.en: Jesús, 52, lives with his children, 10 and 19 years old, his life partner and other family members. Jesus is a hardworking and responsible man who makes a living working at a company close to his home. In addition, with much effort, he has set up a small shop in his home, which his wife runs. Since he has had this business for six years he has many customers, thanks to which he manages to provide daily sustenance for his family, and thus can bring up his children. It is for this that Jesús is asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in: beverages, dairy products, sweets, pastries, soups, etc. to increase his inventory and thus increase sales.

loans.use: invest in: beverages, dairy products, sweets, pastries, soups, etc. to increase his inventory and thus increase sales.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail dried fish business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish for her business to sell.

Consolacion has been in this business for three years. Consolacion earns additional income from food vending.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 50 years old, widowed, and has six children, two of whom attend school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Herminia requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
María le gusta mucho el servicio que la institución le brinda, por ese motivo y por la necesidad de salir adelante solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar concentrado para cerdos y aves de corral, otra parte lo utilizara para hacer una cerca para sus animales.
Con la oportunidad de mejorar que le dio el crédito anterior sus circunstancias familiares han cambiado, cuenta con estabilidad económica ya que ha vendido mayor cantidad de animales, enfrento algunos problemas con el negocio pero los ha superado.
texts.en: María likes the means of funding her business that our bank provides and is applying for a new loan, part of which she will use to buy feed for the poultry and pigs that she raises.  She will use the rest of the loan to build a pen for keeping animals.  Past loans have been hugely important for her and her family, she says, helping her to overcome problems with the business and creating economic stability that they didn't have before.

loans.use: to pay for animal feed and a new pen for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 49 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosana operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 24 years.

Rosana requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items such as canned goods, diapers, soy sauce, seasonings, juice, beers, cereals, etc. to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, diapers, soy sauce, seasonings, juice, beers, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.en:
Nurzhamal is 19 years old freshman in the Business Administration Program. She has a strong desire to get a qualitative education at the American University in Central Asia. However unfortunately, despite her willingness, her family doesn’t have enough money to cover the tuition fee. And they were forced to apply for financial aid.

There are 4 members of her family: her father, her mother and younger brother. Her father is a worker at non-commercial, social organization. Unfortunately, due to the economic crisis in Kyrgyzstan, this year his salary has been reduced. Her mother is unemployed since January 2014. Her younger brother is in 11th grade and will finish the school in summer 2016.

Nurzhamal’s family understands that next year they will have two students in their family that will complicate their financial situation. At present as Nurzhamal’s father is the only provider in her family, Kiva loan will be a great help for them to pay for Nurzhamal’s tuition fee.

Kiva lenders have supported more than 290 students of AUCA, who were able to continue their studies at the prestigious university. AUCA’s alumni are competitive in the world and easily find good job-places. Nurzhamal is confident that she is in a right place to achieve her goals and is waiting for the Kiva lenders’ assistance.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees in the Business Administration Program at AUCA.

loans.name: Yinesongti - Pwalugu Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 47-year-old widow and a mother of four children. Amina lives with her children in Pwalugu, a community in the Upper East Region of Ghana. In the photo, Amina is the woman standing on the left holding a purse in the hand.

Amina belongs to an economically active group called Yinesongti - Pwalugu. Amina sells clothing at the local market and has a good customer base. She has been in the business for one and half decades. Amina has one employee who helps her to reach out to their many customers.

Amina and her group have applied for a business loan of GHC 13,100. Amina’s share of the loan is GHC 1,200 which would be used to buy more clothing for sale. Amina wants to maximize profit to pay off this loan and also provide her children with food.

Amina salutes her lenders for helping her to be a good mother to her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Doña Ana es una microempresaria laboriosa de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de quince y siete años, ella es  propietaria de una pulpería desde hace diez y la administra con ayuda de su mama quien la ayuda a atender a los clientes, solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de aceite, arroz, sardina, gaseosas, ropa y desodorantes, una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is a hardworking small businesswoman. She is 44 years old, married, and is the mother of two children ages 15 and seven.

For ten years, she has been the proprietor of a local convenience store. She runs it with her mother, who helps her attend to clients.

She is requesting a first-cycle loan to buy oil, rice, sardines, soda, clothes and deodorant. One of her goals is to develop the business.

loans.use: buy oil, rice, sardines, soda, clothes and deodorant.

loans.name: Heidi Mercedes

texts.es:
Heidi es una mujer de cincuenta y dos años de edad, muy comprometida con la enseñanza, desde hace treinta y cinco años ella se dedica ser profesora de escuela secundaria. Madre de dos hijos y esposa abnegada, ha logrado salir adelante y ser una profesional de éxito. Descubrió que ser docente es su pasión y se siente dichosa de haber enseñado a muchas generaciones de estudiantes. 
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para poder tomar la oportunidad de estudiar un doctorado en educación, lo que sería el titulo más alto en su carrera profesional y le abriría las puertas a puestos laborales más importante. Ella está decidida en seguir creciendo, su familia es su principal apoyo. En un futuro quiere ser consultora en educación.
texts.en:
Heidi is 52 years old and very committed to teaching. For 35 years she has earned her living as a secondary school teacher. She is the mother of two children and a considerate wife. She has managed to get ahead and have a successful professional career once she had discovered her passion for teaching. She considers herself blessed for having taught many generations of students.

Heidi has asked for a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito so she can take the opportunity to study for a doctorate in education. This would be the highest professional qualification she could obtain and would open the doors to very important work positions. She has decided to continue her personal growth; her family is her greatest support. In the future Heidi wants to be an education consultant.

loans.use: study for a doctorate in education

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба счастливая мать троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Она проживает в районе Шахритус. На районе Шахритус кроме сельскохозяйственной деятельности еще жители занимается другим видом бизнесом. Матлюба у себя дома предоставляет услуги портнихи на заказ. Она любить кроить и шить, и у нее хорошо получается. Матлюба 8 лет своей жизни занимается шитьем. Ей в работе помогает ее дочки. И она учить дочерей освоить шитье. Благодаря швейной деятельности она обеспечить семью. Матлюба хочет отремонтировать свой дом, и улучшить жилищные условия семью. Ей понадобилось денег для купли стройматериалы. За счет кредита она хочет отремонтировать дом. Потому что доходы от швейной деятельности ей не позволяет отремонтировать, по причине у нее есть еще расходы на продукт питания и другие. Матлюба будет очень рада на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Matlyuba is a happy mother of three children, one son and two daughters. She lives in the Shahrituz region, where residents work not just in farming, but in many other businesses. Matlyuba herself works from home as a seamstress, fulfilling sewing orders. She loves to cut and sew and is skilled at her profession, which she has been working in for eight years. Her daughters help her with her work, and she is teaching them how to sew. She is able to provide for her family thanks to her sewing work.

Matlyuba wants to renovate her home and improve her family's living conditions. She needs money to purchase building materials and wants to use the loan amount to renovate her home, because income from her sewing doesn't allow her to do so since she needs to use that money to purchase groceries and other household necessities. She will be very happy for your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovations

loans.name: Bertha Rosa

texts.es: Doña Bertha es una microempresaria laboriosa de 35 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos, ella se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa y repostería desde hace  cuatro años, solicita por octavo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones y camisas tanto para damas como caballeros, una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio, con el credito anterior logro realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Bertha is a hardworking microentrepreneur who is 35 years old, married, and a mother to two children.  She has made a living selling clothes and pastries for four years.  She is applying for her eighth loan from this institution to purchase men’s and women’s undergarments, pants and shirts.  One of her goals is to grow her business.  With the previous loan, she was able to make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is an ambitious, 31-year-old young lady from the Gaatia location which is a luxuriant banana producing region in Central province of Kenya. Faith is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village.

She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Faith is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named them, which makes Faith very proud, and she feels fulfilled. Faith is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for her child. She believes that the knowledge and skills her child will get from school will help her child in the future because her child will have a brighter future. Donate $25 towards this loan and empower a child’s life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris and his family live in a rural home in Central Kenya. He and his wife both enjoy farming for a living.

Moris started farming many years ago, and now he has dairy goats, cows, and a garden full of tomatoes and onions, both of which have high demand in the local market where he sells them.

Moris is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cows. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials to get the project done.

He projects the animals’ health and welfare will be improved as a result of the loan investment. This will further lead to improved milk production and income.

Your loan investment will help Moris and his family to elevate their livelihoods.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, 41 years old and a mother of six, is very clear about what she wants in life and is determined to get ahead and have a good life. She is a smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Rosemary owns a 0.1-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. She keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming.

Rosemary is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little and irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations other than Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Rosemary.

Through a group of 12 members called Line Membor, Rosemary has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi Kilimo, which uses the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled.

Rosemary is kindly seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farming.

In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Rosemary because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

For Rosemary, her six children are everything, and she wants them to be successful professionals. That’s why she dreams of paying for the best education for them. You can help Rosemary to accomplish that. A little trust and a loan will make a big difference in her life and in her family’s.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farming.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 38 años de edad, es una persona con buena educación y disposición de servicio a los demás, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, estas actividades las aprendió de sus abuelos con quienes creció y le formaron y le inculcaron valores y principios que lo han llevado a ser una persona muy reconocida y respetada en su comunidad, su familia está formada por su esposa y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Manuel, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde que era pequeño, él acompañaba a sus abuelos en las jornadas de trabajo y motivado por las ganancias que le genera la venta de granos básicos ha decidido continuar ejerciendo estas actividades, ya que se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y en el sustento diario de su familia, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia, pues ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para la compra de insumos agrícolas, porque sus cultivos se encuentran en la época de fertilización y para comprar fertilizantes y foliares para tener una mejor producción y darle una mejor alimentación a su familia.

Los sueños de Manuel, son tener una tienda y también para comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladarse y trasladar mercadería hasta su casa para ser distribuida en su tienda.
texts.en:
38-year old Manuel has a good education and is always ready to help others. He earns his living through farming and raising animals, jobs he learned from his grandparents with whom he grew up. They raised him and instilled in him their values and principles. As a result Manuel is a well-known and respected member of the community.

He has a wife and three children, all students in local schools. Manuel has worked in agriculture and animal raising since he was a small boy when he accompanied his grandparents as they worked.

Motivated by the money he made selling basic grains, he decided to continue with this line of work which became his main source of income and the means of supporting his family. His wife also helps support the family financially through her work selling dairy products.

Manuel needs the loan money to buy farming supplies as his fields currently need fertiliser and leaf food so greater production is obtained, He can then provide better food for his family. Manuel's dream is to have his own store and also buy a vehicle to transport himself and merchandise to his house so that it can be sold in his store.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NIÑO DIVINO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Helen Jenifer ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank NIÑO DIVINO, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The partner is Helen Jenifer; she is single, 64 years OLD, and has two sons. She works in her business of grain sales; she sells corn, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who through this business supports her family. She has already been working 5 years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a venue where she can sell her grains. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other partners work, respectively, in the businesses of candy sales, clothing sales, grocery store, and bookstore.

Helen Jenifer is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform, and she agrees to make her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 31-year-old man from Rafah City.  He is married and a father to two sons and four daughters. Ahmad was living with his family in a small, humble house, but during the latest war in Gaza, his house destroyed completely.  He then had to rent a small apartment in the same area.Recently, ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Ahmad to finalize the needed construction in a short time, and return his family to their normal life.Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago Mohammad started his own business. He manages an Internet cafe in his city providing many services like Internet, printing and games in addition to providing some drinks and sandwiches.This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to expand the cafe and buy new furniture for his business. This will increase the capacity of the cafe, sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to expand the Internet cafe and buy new furniture for his business.

loans.name: Shadea

texts.en: Greetings from Palestine.  Shadea is 25 years old, married woman with six kids, and lives in Hebron City. Shadea has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Shadea needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade. For the future, Shadea hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock. Shadea thanks you for your support. Shadea's husband shown in the image for social reasons.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino con 56 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en casa propia de material rústico,en el distrito de Bagua, provincia de Bagua, departamento Amazonas, país Perú. celestino cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo de frutales, café y maíz.

celestino se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su cuarto año de producción tiene 5 años de edad, cultiva café en Sector Bombón del distrito de La Peca, dicha actividad la realiza hace 40 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Celestino es socio nuevo con Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Celestino is 56 years old and lives with his partner and youngest son. The family lives in a house that they own built with rustic materials. The house is in Bagua district and province, in the Amazonas department of Peru. Celestino has very good professional and personal references. The locals in Bagua mostly work growing fruits, coffee and corn.

Celestino makes a living growing coffee. He currently has one hectare of Catimor coffee, which is disease-resistant. The plantation has been producing a yield for four years but the crops are five years old.

Celestino grows coffee in the Bombón area of La Peca district. He has been doing this work for 40 years and has experience growing coffee. In addition he raises small animals (hens, guinea pigs and more) and grows other products in order to take him his daily bread.

This loan will be used to look after and grow one hectare of coffee. It will guarantee a good harvest in 2016. This will be reflected in higher sales and Celestino will therefore earn a higher income in order to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Celestino is a new member Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing up to the organisation with his partner.

loans.use: to look after and grow one hectare of coffee.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leah is 40 years old and has four children are currently in school.

Leah has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Leah has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 43 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Analyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, meat, spices, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

Analyn has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, meat, spices, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 53 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vicenta has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vicenta has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melba works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Melba is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Vahik

texts.en:
Vahik lives in Artabuynk village of Vayots Dzor region with his parents and brother. Following his father's work, Vahik is a farmer. Vahik's farm currently includes a livestock of 3 pigs, 5 piglets, 3 cows and 2 calves.

Besides farming Vahik also works as a distributor in candy producing company to help with family's costs.

Vahik asks this loan to invest on his farm and sustain it during the coming winter season. He plans to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock.
The loan is very important for Vahik to continue receiving income for his family's increasing expenses and provide his retired parent with appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

location.town: Artabuynk village of  Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Tabitha, a farming woman and a fighter, pushing ahead at age 35. She is a very hard-working and self-driven farmer who is based in Kinamba, a remote village in Ndaragwa. This region has harsh weather patterns, and goat farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives.

Tabitha is happily married and blessed with six lovely, good-looking children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been selling cow and goat milk and crop farming. Tabitha passionately loves goat farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling goat milk.” Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her goat farming business.

Tabitha is seeking a loan to buy additional goats.

Tabitha is a member of Guikuria self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell milk to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying the loan and increasing her business. Help out this heroine!

loans.use: to pay for additional dairy goats

loans.name: Iem's Group

texts.en:
A resident in a remote area of Kampong Cham province, Iem is a 19-year-old married woman. She is blessed with a dependent daughter who is under the age of school. Main business of this family is rice growing. She and her husband have been in this farming business for a year. Her husband works as construction worker to add more income too. Rice crop is damaged by pests; this is the challenge to her.

In a group of four members, Iem is the leader and this is the first time for her with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion of loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade the standard of living and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity in order to upgrade the standard of living and send her daughter to school. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Venas

texts.en:
Venas is 52 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is running his own medical clinic.
Venas's husband wants to purchase furniture for his clinic, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is not in position to buy furniture. Therefore Venas has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to purchase furniture and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn profitable income. Her husband also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet the uncertain events in future.
Venas is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy furniture her husband's medical clinic.

loans.name: Dúo Adonaí Group

texts.es: Dúo Adonaí Este dúo se  conforma en esta ocasión por las señoras Juana María  ella es originaria del municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Juana  se dedica a la venta de consumo diario,  y recientemente abrió un local nuevo donde ofrece  variedad de helados, gelatinas,  golosinas, pasteles, choco frutas etc.  También en su tiempo libre se dedica a la elaboración de blusas para damas que están de moda en estas fechas, solicita de capital para lograr comprar tela y productos comestibles para la venta.
texts.en: Dúo Adonaí is composed on this occasion of Juana Maria who is originally from the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez and makes her living selling groceries every day. Recently she opened a new store where she sells a variety of ice creams, jellies, candies, pastries, fruit dipped in chocolate, etc. In her free time she also works making fashionable women's blouses. She is asking for the loan to be able to purchase fabrics and grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and grocery products to sell

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Sanga Catholic Savings&credit Group

texts.en:
Joseph a member of Sanga catholic savings&credit group is a hardworking and married man with no children yet living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is a 29 year old health worker dealing in human drugs selling and treatment. He started this business to help people of his area who were covering long distances to get treatment. He has been in this business for four years from where he has been able to sustain himself and the family at large. He dreams of having well educated children and a business goal of transforming into a pharmacy.

His challenge is none other than low capital base and competition from government hospitals that offer free services. Despite these challenges, he is determined to serve his community basing on the fact that government hospitals lack enough drugs and they send you to clinics and pharmacies for drugs. Joseph is requesting for the loan to buy more human medicine for sale.

loans.use: to buy more human medicine for sale.

loans.name: Maria Veneranda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de cincuenta y tres años, que posee una pulpería en un pequeño espacio de su casa desde hace tres años, a la cual le invierte todo su tiempo y dinero debido a que es su único ingreso. 
María anteriormente solicitó un préstamo, el cual utilizó para reparar el área donde tiene su negocio y para comprar mercadería como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón y gaseosas. Este nuevo préstamo que María solicita le servirá para comprar un freezer, el cual le permitirá vender carnes y embutidos, los cuales aumentarán sus ganancias y le permitirá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a 50 year old woman who has owned a convenience store in a small space in her house for the last 3 years. She invests all her time and money in the store since it is her only form of income. 

Previously María asked for a loan which she used to repair the area where she has her business and to purchase products like: rice, sugar, oil, soap, and sodas. This new loan that she is requesting will help her to purchase a freezer, which will allow her to sell meats and sausages which will augment her earnings and will allow her to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
Susima is 63 years old and married with  children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Susima is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Susima has been raising ducks for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Filadelfo Luis

texts.es:
Él es Fidalelpo es un hombre de 25 años de edad, que vive en el municipio de Tuchin, se dedica a elaborar manillas, collares, aretes artesanales, los cuales realiza con cuero, tiras, y paja.
Para FIladelpo es bastante difícil mantener dicha profesión, pues la gente busca cada vez menos estos artículos y les parece costoso el precio de las artesanías, peor a pesar de estas dificultades él sigue luchando por sobrevivir y obtener una estabilidad económica, también para generar los ingresos necesarios para mantener su familia y alimentar un sueño que es, comprar una vivienda.
FIladelpo quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cuero en grandes cantidades que es el activo principal para elaborar sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Fidalelpo is a man of 25 years old who lives in the municipality of Tuchin. He is engaged in making bracelets, necklaces, and handmade earrings, which he makes using leather, straps, and straw.

It is quite difficult for FIladelpo to maintain the profession, as people are looking less for these items since the price seems expensive for handmade crafts. Even more difficult, he is struggling to survive and obtain economic stability and make the income necessary to support his family and nurture his dream to purchase a home.

FIladelpo wants to ask for a loan to purchase leather in large quantities, which is the main asset he uses for his handmade crafts.

loans.use: to purchase leather in large quantities, which is the main asset in making his crafts.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a first time borrower at Ugafode. He deals in transport using his motorcycle aquirred with Kiva funds. This has enabled him to sustain and earn a living for his family.
His business dream in transport is to purchase another bodaboda to increase his earning tremendously.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es un hombre de 53 años de edad, con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 20 y 28 años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad del caserío el Rosario.
Mariano para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, con estas dos actividades a su familia ha mantenido. Mariano por la falta de capital, su cultivo no ha podido realizar, pero con el afán de hacerlo, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa, con el préstamo el espera realizar su cultivo lo más pronto posible.
Su esperanza de vida es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y mejorar sus vivienda.
texts.en: Mariano is a 53-year-old man with a lovely family consisting of five children, ranging from 20 to 28 years old.  This family lives in a community in the small town of El Rosario.  In order to have an income and to move his children forward in life, Mariano has made a living in agriculture for 15 years.  In order to increase his income, he also makes a living buying and selling food items.  With these two activities, he has been able to support his family.  Because Mariano needs capital, he has been unable to cultivate his crops.  Eager to do so, he is requesting a loan to purchase potato seeds.  With this loan, he hopes to cultivate his crops as soon as possible.  His life goal is to improve his family’s quality of life and to improve his house.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco con 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera mejorar los rendimientos de las campañas anteriores.

Francisco es socio nuevo en Edpyme Alternativa. No se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
29-year old Francisco lives with his wife and their two children in the district of Colassy, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca in Peru. For the most part the local people earn their living from agriculture, business, and animal raising.

Francisco grows coffee and has ten years in this line of work. He is seeking a loan to buy manure and make further investments in his farm. Then he will improve production over previous seasons.

Francisco is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is not part of a formal banking system.

loans.use: buy manure and make further investments in his farm

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is 31 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Giselle requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

Giselle has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 35 year old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a a farmer growing coffee, maize and beans in addition, that contributes a lot to his final income figure. He started these businesses with a hope of earning an income for his family. He is faced with hardships of inadequate capital that make him lose out on so many opportunities given the fact that he sells his products to agents that offer unfair prices.

Even if he is facing those hardships, he is looking forward to buying a plot of land where he can expand his farming business and become a leading coffee producer in his area. Fred needs a loan to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for planting

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José, es un hombre muy carismático y trabajador, a sus cuarenta y cuatro años de edad tiene inagotables energías por trabajar, él se dedica a vender granos básicos a los comerciantes de pulperías y puestos en el mercado. Contando con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio; él ya ha trabajado con MiCrédito y Kiva, por lo cual está muy agradecido, dado que esto le ha abriendo un mundo de oportunidades. 
Confiando fielmente en ambas organizaciones, José ha decido volver a solicitar un préstamo que le permita comprar una gran cantidad de frijoles postreros, azúcar y maíz. Dado que en esta temporada el valor de estos productos aumenta. Su principal meta es poder comprar una camioneta para poder movilizarse de forma más eficiente, en el futuro desea explorar otros mercados con nuevos clientes además de los de su pueblo.
texts.en:
José is a very charismatic and hardworking man; at forty-four years of age he has inexhaustible energy for working. He sells staple foods to the owners of grocery stores and market stalls. With the support of his family he has managed to grow his business. He has worked with MiCrédito and Kiva, for which he is very grateful, because this has opened a world of opportunities.

Trusting faithfully in both organizations, José has decided to again apply for a loan that would allow him to buy a large quantity of second harvest beans, sugar and corn, since this season the value of these products increases. His main goal is to be able to buy a truck in order to be able to move more efficiently. In the future he wishes to explore other markets with new customers in addition to those of his town.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of second harvest beans, sugar and corn.

loans.name: Argemiro

texts.es:
En la foto padre e hijo, dos personas que trabajan diariamente para mantener su familia, se complementan el uno al otro. el titular el señor Argemiro le ha enseñado todo lo que sabe acerca del campo a su hijo pues sueña que este siga con sus cultivos de plátano y café.
La larga temporada de sequía es un factor global que ha afectado a prácticamente todos los agricultores del país.
Ramiro se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que necesita para la compra de una máquina podadora, para realizar el mismo el mantenimiento de sus terrenos y usarla para trabajar independientemente, será un ingreso extra, también comprar abonos para acelerar el crecimiento del café por la sequía, ya que no hay agua y puede perder la cosecha.
texts.en:
In the photo are father and son, two people who work daily to support their family, they complement each other. The father, Argemiro has shown everything he knows about the fields to his son since he dreams of him continuing with his crops of plantains and coffee.

The long drought season is a global issue which has affected practically all the farmers in the country

Ramiro is asking for a loan that he needs to purchase a lawnmower to do the maintenance on his land himself and use it to work independently. It will be extra income and also he will purchase manure to accelerate the growth of the coffee due to the drought, since there isn't water and he could lose the crop.

loans.use: to purchase a lawnmower to do his own maintenance of his land and use it to work independently.

loans.name: Rekha And Group

texts.en:
Rekha is a 32-year-old ambitious entrepreneur who hails from the Jhabua district of Madhya Pradesh. She lives there with her husband and children. Rekha runs a grocery business in her locality. With her business, she is able to bring home a monthly income of 3,000 RS. But she believes that if she stocks up on more items in her shop, she will be able to earn an additional 1000 RS every month. She thus seeks a loan to purchase items such as wafers, chocolates, soap, shampoo, etc., so she can expand her grocery business.

Rekha leads a group of five women. They all live in the same area and have come together to apply for a group loan to expand their respective businesses. They will use the loan amount to purchase raw materials and necessary items for the expansion of their businesses. This group of women hopes to contribute more to their household income and have thus decided to expand their businesses. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To expand her existing grocery business to sell wafers, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Sam An's Group

texts.en:
Sam An is 45 years old and married with four children, two of whom (daughters) are dependent and still in school. To support family’s living, she sells cooked rice and grocery items in her community while her husband buys banana to resell. Lack of working capital is the challenge to grocery selling business.

Thus, Sam An forms a group of three to request loans from VisionFund to support business. Previous loan that she obtained has enabled her to send her children to school and renovate her house. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy variety of grocery items to replenish the store and to attract customers. She hopes to expand her grocery selling business bigger and keep her daughters in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy variety of grocery items to replenish the store and to attract customers so that she can keep her daughters in school until they graduate.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don José es un hombre trabajador de 40 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, él es propietario de una pulpería, desde hace cuatro años, solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles y una vitrinas. Una de sus metas es hacer crecer en negocio.
texts.en: José is a hardworking 40 year old man. He is married and has two children who are the biggest motivating force in his life. He has owned a grocery store for four years. He is requesting his first loan from this institution because he would like to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, beans and some display cases. One of his goals is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and some display cases.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
His name is Felipe, aged 57, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Divina, an elementary principal and they have three children of which one is in college, the other two are already working. Despite the challenges and struggles in raising a family in a developing economy the couple feels a sense of fulfillment that they are able to send their children to school.

Felipe took advantage of the fertile soil and cool climate where he lives so he thought of tilling his inherited land from his parents to grow pineapples to augment their income and help in their everyday needs. To further improve his pineapple harvest he would like to borrow funds in the amount of Php 19000 to pay for seedlings, fertilizers, labor and other supplies needed for his farm. He hopes you would consider his request and is thanking God and you in advance for your help.

He prays for a more productive harvest this year and dreams to see his child graduate from College. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings, fertilizers, labor and other supplies for his pineapple farm.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 47 years old, married with three children.

Cresenciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Cresenciana has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cresenciana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Race Course Ladies Group

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mary, married with four children. Her children are all school going children. Mary belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each to other to achieve their individual dreams. “Race Course Ladies” is the name of Mary’s solidarity group. “Race Course Ladies” group needs a total loan of 6,000,000 SLL. Mary will receive 1,200,000 SLL which she needs in order to buy two cartons of butter, four bags of flour, etc. for her business. (Mary is in the middle of the group photo).

Mary established her bread business 11 years ago; she established the business to ensure that her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Mary uses the profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Mary is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 9 am to 6 pm.

In the future, Mary plans to help her children to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of butter, four bags of flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Gina has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, sardines, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane and motorcycle transport.

Ana dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, sardines, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sezin

texts.en:
Sezin is 61 years old and a mother or two. After retirement she saw that her retirement salary was not enough for the house so she started selling underwear. First she made her sales from home but she thought that she only sell to her neighbours but she had to increase the number of potential customers so she started selling in local bazaars. With the help of her third loan from Maya she bought seasonal underwear in bulk..


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sezin Hanım 61 yaşında evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Emekli olduktan sonra emekli maaşının ev giderlerine yetişmediğini görünce evde çamaşır satmaya başlamış. Evde sadece belli bir çevreye satış yaptığını düşünen Sezin Hanım hem daha çok satış yapmak hem de müşteri potansiyelini artırmak için semt pazarlarına çıkmaya başlamış ve buradan satışlarına devam ediyor. Mayadan 3. kredisini kullanan Sezin hanım kredileri ile mevsime uygun toptan çamaşır aldı.

loans.use: to buy seasonally appropriate underwear

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, de 40 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también se dedica a la agricultura, ya las ventas de comercio de productos básicos, creció con su abuela quien se dedicaba a la agricultura y a los oficios domésticos, poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. 

Santos, tiene una experiencia de toda su vida en realizar trabajos de la agricultura, esta actividad la aprendió de su abuela quien se dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad y fue quien le inculco buenas ideas y principios para poder salir adelante y gracias a ello ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. 

Santos, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de frijol y maíz, porque gracias a la aplicación de estos productos ella puede tener mejores cosechas y de esta manera puede asegurar una mejor seguridad alimentaria para su familia. 

Los sueños de Santos, son mejorar su casa, hacer un baño y mejorar las condiciones del pozo de donde extraen agua para los diferentes usos.
texts.en:
Santos, 40 years old, is a homemaker and also makes a living in agriculture by selling basic products. She grew up with her grandmother, who was also a homemaker and made a living in agriculture. By putting the knowledge she acquired into practice, she has been able to move forward in life with her family.

Santos has a life's worth of experience in agriculture. She learned this from her grandmother, who made a living her whole life in this profession and instilled her with good ideas and principles in order to move forward. Thanks to this, she has been able to move forward in life with her family.

Santos needs the money to purchase agricultural inputs for her bean and corn crops. By implementing these products, she can have better crops and therefore be able to ensure that her family has food to eat. Santos’ dreams are to improve her house, to make a bathroom and to improve the well from which they draw water for various uses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn is 34 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She is from Tbaung Khmum province where she has been growing cassava and rice for 16 years. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

Om is the leader of a four-member group which requested a loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy organic fertilizer to increase crop outputs. She hopes that this purchase will help her earn more income to improve her living conditions and to send her son to school.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to increase crop outputs.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum Province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar comes from Multan, is 40 and a mother of six children living with her spouse and children. Her son is a responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family and is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw 1 year to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Gulzar’s son wants to buy new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to buy the auto rickshaw. Therefore Gulzar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Gulzar’s son can purchase the auto rickshaw and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income.
Gulzar and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira ia 24 and a mother of three children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 7 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Sumaira’s husband wants to buy new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy the auto rickshaw. Therefore Sumaira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Sumaira’s husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Sumaira and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is 30 years old, married, and has children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a poultry farm and works as a mechanic, which he has been doing for three years. He is faced with challenges of competition and the high cost of poultry feeds that reduces the number of customers and profits.

Sulait requested a loan, which he will use to buy poultry feeds for his chickens. He hopes to expand his farm and educate all his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds

loans.name: Comnab

texts.en:
Comnab is 22 years old, single, lives with his family at Muk Kompul district Kandal province. Cambodia. His mother has been a weaver for 20 years.

Presently, Comnab is a student and works in customer service for a private company, He is studying at RUPP ( Royal University of Phnom Penh) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in the field of History, year 3, semester 1.

Now he needs money to pay for his school fees, so he applied to Maxima.
He wants to be a history teacher after graduating from university.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for a BA in History

loans.name: Phanha

texts.en:
Panha is 19 years old, single, lives with his family at Keansvay district , Phnom Penh.

Currently, Panha is a student and works as a videos & Photos Editor for a private photo shop He is studying at CICI Cambodia International Cooperation Institute in Phnom Penh, Cambodia., in the field of Information Technology, year 2, semester 1.

He said that he will get a good salary in the future. He would likes to apply for a loan for pay his school fee.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for a BSc. in I T.

loans.name: Borin

texts.en:
Borin is 21 years old, single, lives with his family at Keansvay district, Kandal province, Cambodia.

Borin is a student and is studying at Royal University Law and Economic in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in the field of Banking and Finance, year 2, semester 1. He doesn’t work yet.
While his father has been a farmer for 20 years.

He would like to apply for a loan for pay his school fees. He will graduate in 2018.
Borin wants to be a good staff member for a bank in Cambodia

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for a BSc. in Banking and Finance

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 38 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in South Tajikistan. He is a builder, which he has been doing for more than four years. Rustam works hard and little by little improves his abilities. He tries to build good quality houses and in this way to offer good living condition for his customers.

Rustam now needs financial support because his mother is ill. He requested a loan for 5,000 TJS, which he will use to buy medicines for treatment of his mother.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for treatment of his mother.

loans.name: Navruz

texts.en:
Navruz was born in 1997. He is single and he lives with his parents in the capital of Tajikistan. Navruz’s family is large, with 6 children.

Navruz always wanted to get a higher education and this year after graduating school, thanks to his parents, has applied to the university. Now he is a student of the first course Technology University. Navruz learns Economics. He is one of the most successful students of his group. Navruz is asking for a loan of 4800 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition to receive a BA in Economics

loans.name: Benengo

texts.en:
Benengo is married and has children. He operates a retail business and farms to support his family.

Benengo requested a loan, which he will use to purchase more plastics and cosmetics since the demand for them is high. His available stock cannot meet his customers' needs and his income is not enough to meet this budget. Benengo's greatest desire is to educate his children and expand his business. He is working very hard to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase stock of plastics and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Marivic requested her tenth loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is a musician. He makes his living playing at weddings and restaurants. Stepan combines in his personality both creativity and responsibility.

Thanks to his previous Kiva loan, Stepan finished the facade renovation at his house. This time he is asking for a loan of 20 000 UAH to install a kitchen in his house. The loan will help Stepan to improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Веселый мужчина Каромат. Он из района Шахритус. Ему 31 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Дети учатся в средней школе. Жена домохозяйка и занимается растениеводством. Каромат заботливый и щедрый отец. Он простой дехканин. У Каромат имеется земельный участок, где он выращивает растение. Каромат больше времени проводит на земле, он ухаживает о растение. Он планирует расширить земельный участок и деятельность. Каромат просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и для семян урожай. Он хочет, чтобы у него каждый сезон  было плодородность.
texts.en: This happy man is Karomat. He is from the Shahrituz District. He is 31 years old, married and a father to three children. His children attend secondary school. His wife is a homemaker who practices crop farming. Karomat is an attentive and big-hearted father. He is a simple farmer. Karomat has a plot of land on which he grows crops. He spends most of his time working the land and cultivating his crops. He plans to expand his plot of land and his business. Karomat is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for planting. He would like for every season to be bountiful.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina con 65 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 04 nietos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Orfelina se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, de variedad Catimor de 06 y 07 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicados a unos metros de su domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales de corral y cultivo de pan llevar,cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio de abono, manteniendo de esta manera su cultivo de café y así poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Orfelina es socia recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa, este es su cuarto crédito.
texts.en:
Orfelina is 65 years old, in a common-law relationship and does not have dependent children. She lives with her spouse and her four grandchildren in the Pomahuaca district, located in the Jaén province and the Cajamarca department of Peru. The inhabitants of this area make a living primarily in agriculture, commerce and livestock raising.

Orfelina makes a living in agriculture and has coffee crops that are of the Catimor variety and between six and seven years old. She has agricultural property that yields quality coffee. These crops are located a few meters from her house. She also makes a living raising farmyard animals and basic food crops. She has more than 15 years of experience in this area. The purpose of this loan is to invest in a compost business in order to maintain her coffee crops and therefore, earn a decent profit so that she can improve her quality of life. Orfelina is recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa; this is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to invest in a compost business.

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en:
Shirin, 26, lives in the capital of Tajikistan. She is a young and hardworking woman. She is married and has a child. Her husband is an engineer and he has a small salary. So, Shirin is the main fund raiser of her family. She has been busy with her sewing service for more than 9 years. She has a ‘golden hands’ and she makes wonderful dresses.

Shirin has repeated clients because she tries to sew beautiful dresses for her clients. Shirin is going to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Aracely de 36  años de edad,  es casada y vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace  05  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general, vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta familiar y todos los productos  básicos de una pulpería.
Doña Aracely es una mujer con deseos de superarse y de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como maíz, frijoles, huevos, pollo, carnes, arroz, azúcar, manteca y otros,  con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nueva  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Septiembre   2015.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aracely is 36, married and lives with her husband and children in her own home. She has made her living for the last 5 years selling groceries. She sells groceries and general merchandise to meet all the basic needs of a family.

Mrs. Aracely is a woman who wants to better herself, get ahead and improve her quality of life. She is requesting this loan to buy basic goods such as corn, beans, eggs, chicken, meat, rice, sugar, lard and other supplies. With the help of this loan she plans to improve her income as well as her quality of life. She is a new client who wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele while at the same time providing a better future for herself and her family.


San Lorenzo, Honduras- Septiembre 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, eggs, chicken, meat, rice, sugar, lard, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Kalija

texts.en: Hassan hardworking married man with 8 children lives in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a mixed farmer growing food crops like onions plus rearing cattle for milk production and at the same time has a retail shop selling farm input products. He is facing hardships of inadequate labor force which is expensive and capital which all together lowers output produced per season. Hassan has asked for a loan to help him pay labor for weeding and planting onions.

loans.use: to pay laour for weeding and planting onions

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence used the previous loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation. He is a farmer growing banana and at the same time rears cows for milk production. He is faced with challenges of inadequate to maintain all his projects. apart from that, he also complains of the banana bacterial wilt that has affected many banana farmers in the region. In spite the challenges, he is looking forward to completing his residential house and educate his children up to the university. Lawrence needs a loan to pay for labor to prune his banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labor to prune his banana plantation.

loans.name: Noeub

texts.en:
Noeub, at her age of 38 years, is a local farmer from Siem Reap province and married with two dependent children. She makes a living by growing rice and cassava and riasing a pig. Noeub has been in farming business for 20 years. Flood and pig diseases are the obstacles to earn good income.

She decided to apply for a loan support from VisionFund to support her business. This will be her fourth cycle loan and past loans have helped her improve living condition. This time, Noeub will spend her loan on purchasing organic fertilizer to increase cassava outputs. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve the standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to increase cassava output to improve the standard of living. .

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Muharrama

texts.en:
Muharrama was born in 1997 year. She is smart and hardworking young woman. Muharrama is a student of the first course Medical College, where she is learning Pharmacy. She is an active student.

Muharrama dreams to be a good medical specialist in future and with this aim she studies hard. Muharama is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition because her parents have no money. She is awaits your mercy and really needs to your financial support.

loans.use: To pay her Medical University tuition fees in Pharmacy.

loans.name: Tito Roberth

texts.es:
Tito con 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Tito cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Tito se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, variedad Catimor, con experiencia en el rubro más de 08 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz, yuca,etc y se desempeña como peón agrícola en la zona realizando trabajos de cultivos de café y otros. El destino del crédito es para invertir en la compra de abono, manteniendo su cultivo de café. De este modo adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida de él y su familia.

Tito es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Tito is 30-years old. He is single and lives in his own home in Pomahuaca District, which is in Jaén Province, Cajamarca Department, Perú.
