Tito has been given very good work and personal references on behalf of the residents of the area. The people of the area makes their livings primarily in agriculture, trade and raising livestock.

Tito makes his living in agriculture. His has a coffee crop; the variety is Catimor. Tito has more than eight years of experience in this line of work. He also plants corn, yucca etc. In addition, he works as a farm hand in the area helping with coffee and other crops. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of compost so Tito can maintain his coffee crop. In this way, he will be able to earn an acceptable profit so he can improve his own quality of life and his family's as well.

Tito is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa; this is his second loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of compost.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Avelina has been in this business for 9 years. Avelina earns more income from food vending.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Adriana Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 34 años, de estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos Nayely de 9 años está estudiando en una escuela cerca del lugar donde viven y Abdiel tiene 3 años permanece junto a su madre, su esposo es albañil, ella plasma su tranquilidad y optimismo en cada cerámica que pinta este pequeño negocio empezó hace tres años atrás transformándose en fuente de ingresos que  ayuda alimentar a sus hijos sin descuidarlos. Ella necesita el dinero para comprar pinturas, figuras, pinceles así podría obtener más ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y  educación  de sus hijos.
texts.en: Isabel is 34 years old, married and has two children: Nayley, 9 years old, is studying at a school near the place where they live, and Abdiel, 3 years old, stays with her mother.  Her husband is a mason.  Her tranquility and optimism is embodied in each ceramic figure that she paints.  She started this small business three years ago, which became a source of income that helps to feed her children, yet still allows her time to care for them.  She needs the money to purchase paint, figurines and paintbrushes.  In this way, she could earn a better income to continue helping to cover her children’s food and education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic figurines, paintbrushes and paint.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 41 years old and she lives with her smaller son (he is a student) and mother-in-law in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Hasmik’s elder son now is in the army and passes his military service. Hasmik has higher pedagogical education and since 1996 till today she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature.

Hasmik simultaneously is engaged in farming and agricultural works which provides fresh and healthy food both for her family and for sale as well. Hasmik also manages to give paid private courses of her subject at her house and helps a group of pupils to get prepared for their entrance exams. Hasmik mentions that she greatly likes her work and does her best to pass her knowledge to the pupils, who attend her lessons both at the school and at her house usually with great interest and pleasure.

Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Hasmik asks as she likes to buy a computer, accessories for the computer and also professional literature for her private courses at home to make it more informative, and also for her self-development activities, which she considers very important for any pedagogue.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for the computer and also professional literature for her private courses at home

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Lanjar village of Ararat region, where she lives with her parents and brother.
Together with her whole family, Anahit has been involved in farming. The farm includes livestock of calves, cows, pigs, piglets, hens and 11 colonies of bees. Anahit's family also cultivate wheat, barley and emmer wheat. Because the family's only source of income is agribusiness, they work hard to sustain and and gather stable income during the month.

Anahit requests this loan to purchase a calf, fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation costs to develop farm and gather income for family's living. She will be grateful to lenders who support her family farming business.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation costs to develop farm and gather income for family's living

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: 30 year old Amin has owned a school for three and a half years and began it in order to facilitate schooling in his local area. Currently there are 351 students enrolled, half of them being female. With his PKR 100,000 loan, Amin will maintain and improve the construction of the school building and using his keen business mind, he wants to keep his facility competitive, and eventually outrank the other schools in the local and wider community.

loans.use: to maintain and improve the construction of the school building

loans.name: Koubanao Yentine Group

texts.fr: le Banc Villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en février 2001. Il est composé de femmes qui exercent le commerce, prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps et sont très solidaires entre elles. Madame Amy qui est à la droite photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de quarante six ans et mère de six enfants dont cinq filles. Elle s'active depuis deux ans dans la vante de friandises"fataya". Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité 360kg de farine et 60 litres d'huile et des produits divers pour préparer la friandise"fataya". Elle n'est pas la seule qui mène cette activité dans sa localité mais elle a une clientèle potentielle.  Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois to which this group belongs has been launched in February 2001. It is composed of women who work as vendors, reimbursing their loans on time and showing solidarity among themselves. Ms. Ama, the one on the right raising her hand in the photo, is the group’s representative. She is married, 46 years old and the mother of six children, of whom five are daughters. 

Amy has been selling traditional “fataya” snacks  [a type of beignets] for two years. She will use this loan to buy 360 kg  [794 lbs] of flour and 60 liters [16 gallons] of oil as well as various ingredients for preparing “fataya.” There are other vendors in the same line of business in her neighborhood but she has a good customer base. Her revenues will allow her to help provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Pargev

texts.en:
Pargev in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region where lives with his wife, daughter, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Pargev has always been greatly busy and involved with farming and agricultural works despite of all the time being employed at different workshops.

Now Pargev works at the Sevan city’s national park as an inspector and at the same time he is taking care of his farm and plot of land. In his farm he has cows, calves, a bull, piglets and sheep. On his plot of land he cultivates potato and together with his farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd and meat. Pargev with his wife sells it at the city’s wholesale market.

He mentions nowadays farming is very hard unlike over 20 years ago, when the climate was different, the government was a great supporter for farmers and also to earn a better living was easier than now.

Anyway Pargev hopes that thanks to his great efforts he will develop his farm and maybe his son will also continue to develop it. Now this Kiva loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Pargev needs as he wants to buy two more calves and also fodder for all his farm cattle, getting prepared for winter period which brings great difficulties for farmers.

loans.use: to buy two more calves and also fodder for all his farm cattle getting prepared for winter period which brings great difficulties for farmers

loans.name: Isfandiyor

texts.en:
Isfandiyor lives with his parents. He is a clever and hardworking 19 year old. He is a student of the 1 course Technology University. He always tries to study well and to get good quality knowledge.

Isfandiyor must pay for the university tuition but he has no money for it. His parents are workers and they cannot help him.

Isfandiyor is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition in Technology

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur already feeling lucky and skilled in his farming and he is really sure that his second Kiva deal will again be very profitable. Now is 21 years old and it is not enough that he is already very skillfully runs his farming activities, he also lives alone. He lives in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Artur’s parents and brother temporally live and work in Russian Federation while Artur does his best to take care of his farm and cattle properly. Artur in his farm has cows and calves and as previously he sells his farm’s milk and meat to his regular customers from the village.

Artur also has chance to leave and to move to Russian Federation and work there with his parents, but he is sure that in his native village he can do more and earn more with his day and night work in the farm that he cares for so much.

Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Artur asks as he must buy fodder for all his farm cattle since now to have enough fodder for his cattle is the main problem for him to solve as quickly as it is possible.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all his farm cattle since now to have enough fodder for his cattle is the main problem for him to solve as quickly as it is possible

loans.name: Pamoja 2 Silk Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Hannah, a member of Pamoja 2 Silk women group. She is twenty three years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in October 2014.

Hannah does maize, beans and potato farming. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she is now able to manage her farming business. She is taking a Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers in readiness for the upcoming planting season.

Hannah hopes to obtain a good harvest hence higher income which will enable support her children’s education, medical care and other family needs.
She is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers in readiness for the upcoming planting season and have enough income to support her children's education

loans.name: James

texts.es:
James con 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos de 11,9,7,2 años de edad,en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.James cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

James se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña ubicado en el caserío cabra chica - Pucará, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

James es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
James is 34-years old. He is married and lives in his own home, which is built with rustic materials, with his wife and their four young children, who are 11-,9-,7- and 2-years old respectively. They live in Pucará District, which is in Jaén Province, Cajamarca Department, Perú. James has been given very good personal and work references by the residents of the area.

James makes his living in agriculture, specifically growing pineapples plants in the Cabra Chica village of Pucará. James has ten years of experience in this line of work. The loan he has been granted will be used in agricultural work- applying and incorporating pesticides and fertilizers and paying for labor for his harvest. This will help him to improve his crop physiologically, morphologically and productively. It will also help James to have an opportune harvest, greater production and better quality produce that he won't have any trouble selling.

James is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work- applying and incorporating pesticides and fertilizers and paying for labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ritchel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Ritchel is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ritchel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Delisa

texts.en:
Delisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delisa is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Delisa has a rug making business in the Philippines. Delisa requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Delisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Delisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her rug making business.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is farmer living in Eghegnadzor town with her husband and two children who currently attend school. 
Liana works at the local municipality as an administrative worker. Bеsides her work, she is also engaged in livestock keeping. With the help of her husband, Liana keeps 2 cows, three calves and some hens in the barn near the house. Liana asks this funds to purchase two calves and forage for feeding the livestock, so her farm will continue providing stable income for the family. As her chidlren are growing and expenses increasing, Liana works hard to find a way to contribute to her family's economy.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
This is Svetlana and she is 55 years old. She is a widow and she has two sons. Her smallest son now lives and works as an accountant in Yerevan city. So Svetlana with her elder son lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Svetlana graduated Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Pedagogy and Methodology. Started from 1981 till today Svetlana works at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. She also has a small group of pupils who have some hardships in their learning process at her house she helps them and patiently explains and makes clear of any misunderstandings that they have. Svetlana does her work greatly devoted and with pleasure.

This Kiva loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she asks as she would like to buy a computer, table for it and also some professional literature; all these she needs since as she mentions that with great stream of so much innovations in educational sphere she feels that she has a lack of professional information which is inadmissible for any pedagogue.

loans.use: to buy a computer, table for it and also some professional literature; all these she needs since as she mentions that with great stream of so much innovations in educational sphere

loans.name: Karambi School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Semei. He is the Head teacher of Karambi Secondary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 450 students. Karambi School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Karambi School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Semei ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is 47 years old and a mother of 9 children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his taxi. He has been driving a motor car 5 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.

Now a day Shenaz’s husband wants to repair his taxi for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to repair the taxi. Therefore Shenaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shenaz’s husband can repair the taxi and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income.
Shenaz and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's taxi

loans.name: Reza

texts.en:
Reza is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Reza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

Reza has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Reza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Edelyn is 24 years old and has one child still in school.

Edelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Edelyn has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials to her business

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad works hard to support her family. Natividad is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Natividad requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Natividad has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Joreta

texts.en:
Joreta is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joreta is 53 years old and has two children are presently in school.

Joreta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Joreta requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Joreta has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Flora Mae

texts.en:
Flora Mae is 28 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Flora Mae is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Flora Mae has been in pig fattening  for 1 year and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 63 years old and widow with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Salvacion has been farming rice for 14 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eliale

texts.en:
Eliale is 35 years old and has three children.  Eliale is married and all three children who are in school.

Eliale is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eliale requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Eliale has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eliale would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna sends her respects and greetings to all the Kiva lenders and she is hopeful that she will manage her second Kiva loan. Anna is 31 years old and she lives with her mother and brother in Kapan city of Syunik region. Anna several years worked as an accountant having economical education but she gave up her work when she and her mother establish a greenhouse and decided to have vegetable production.

In the greenhouse Anna with the help of her mother cultivates beans, cucumber, parsley, radishes, onions and greens and all these she sells it at the city wholesale market. She mentions that this greenhouse gives her chance to sell seasonal and not seasonal vegetables the whole year and it is rather profitable.

This time again Kiva loan will be great for renewing her greenhouse; she needs to buy new plastic sheeting, also fertilizer and vegetable seedlings, as she must be ready to have fresh vegetables for sale despite cold weather and the winter season.

loans.use: to buy new plastic sheeting, also fertilizer and vegetable seedlings, as she must be ready to have fresh vegetables for sale despite cold weather and the winter season.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David used the previous loan to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell. With the profits he was able to provide for his family, pay school fees and also repay the loan.

David, a married man with six children, is a resident of Kasese, Uganda. He is 45 years old and has a business of selling clothes and cosmetics. To supplement his income, David sells fish, farms and owns rentals.

Having been in business for this long, he has now decided to start fulfilling his dreams of building a dream house for his family and educating his children. David is therefore requesting a loan to top up his savings to buy cement, sand and bricks among other items, for construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks among other items, for construction.

loans.name: Hayastan

texts.en:
Hayastan is mother of 2 school age children, living with her mother-in-law, brother-in-law and children in Margara village of Armavir region. 
Hayastan's husband left the country as a migrant worker, with the hope of gathering income for family's living. As her children are getting older and expenses are increasing, Hayastan started develop farming business of the family. 
She cultivates different crops and keeps a livestock of cows, calves, pigs and hens. She gets milk and produces dairy products, that is sold at the local markets. 
Hayastan will be happy to receive this loan and purchase  fertilizer, seeds for land cultivation and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to sustain the farm during the cold season. She plans to grow greens in the greenhouse, and sell it in the winter with high price.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds for land cultivation and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to sustain the farm during the cold season

loans.name: Keto

texts.en:
Keto is 55 years old, a widow. She lives alone in Tsalenjikha district. Keto is unemployed and lives in poverty. She decided to start her own activity, but needs some money for starting up a business.
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 GEL. With the received credit she will start a trading business.

She will purchase a stock of products in order to resell at higher price and generate income. Keto is very motivated and thinks that the business will be profitable for her. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade products in order to generate some income and cover everyday costs

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Kyasioni S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Rose, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Kyeni Kya Kyasioni SHG. She is thirty-three years old, married and the mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her keep proper business records in her grocery store business, which she started after undergoing HiH EA Enterprise development training.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add stock to her grocery store by buying more vegetables and fruits. This will enable her to boost her income, hence supporting basic family needs like food, clothes and education for her children.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, hence adding stock to her grocery store for increased income to support family expenses such as food, clothing and school fees.

loans.name: Rekha's Group

texts.en:
Rekha is a 40-year-old lady standing to the right in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Narsinghpur district, Odisha, India. Rekha lives with her parents and two daughters.

She is a divorcee and she does not want to be a burden on her parents. That is why she has decided to engage in certain income-generating activities and become self-reliant.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Rekha will use her portion of the loan amount to start her candle-making business. She will purchase wax, thread and other materials that will enable her to make candles in a better way. She will be supplying candles to the nearby villages that do not have access to reliable sources of electricity.

Rekha aspires to purchase a new candle-making machine that will enable her to produce voluminous amount of candles so that she will be able to serve a larger base of customers. The profit that will be generated from the business will be used to provide quality education to her two daughters.

loans.use: to purchase wax, thread and other raw materials that will help her to make candles in a better way.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Leah. She is forty years old, married and the mother of six. She does maize and bean farming and also keeps dairy cows and runs a hair salon. Through HiH EA training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits from her business.

Leah is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. This will greatly boost her business, hence increasing her income, which will enable her to cater for her children’s clothing, food and other needs for the family.

Leah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer that will boost farming, thus obtaining more income to cater for family needs such as clothing and food.

loans.name: Jhulana's Group

texts.en:
Jhulana, a 34-year-old woman, is standing to the left in the photograph and hails from a small village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and is a blessed mother of two sons and one daughter. Jhulana lives with her husband who doesn’t do any kind of work due to his physical illness.

Jhulana is the one who takes care of all the household expenses through her income that she generates by selling milk. She owns a cow and sells milk that she gets from it.

Jhulana, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Jhulana will use her portion of the loan amount to repair the cow shed and purchase one more cow that will increase her income and she will be able to have a pretty amount of savings that she will use in buying medicines and bearing other medical expenses for her husband.

She aspires to renovate her house and see her children become successful in their respective fields in the future.

loans.use: to repair the cow shed and purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Soklin's Group

texts.en:
Soklin, 23, is a married woman living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with a daughter under the age of school. She and her husband are growing rice for main source of income. Sometimes, they work as construction workers to supplement income. Challenge to rice growing business is pests.

She decided to form a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund to save farming business. Soklin, the group leader, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her crop productivity. She hopes she will earn more income to expand her farming business and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity to expand her farming business and send her daughter to school. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 49 years old and married with seven children, three of whom in school, Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Amelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, softdrinks, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
With his previous loan, John managed to buy a pool table to boost his business and gain more profits. He is a hardworking man, as most of his customers describe him, and has been a motorcyclist since 2010, alongside owning a retail shop and pool table and making bricks, which have allowed him to boost his income. He has future goals like constructing a good house and educating all his children to higher levels of learning.

John needs a loan to add more stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap beans, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap, beans, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a resident of Bweyogerere-Kampala. He is a single man. He is a taxi driver and also boda boda cyclist man and his challenge is over depending on one business. He has requested for a loan of UGX1000000 million shillings to buy another motorcycle so that he can diversify his sources of income. 
He is hard working.
Pictured is Jimmy with the ugafode staff(right to right).

loans.use: to boost his taxi business.

loans.name: Barsegh

texts.en:
Barsegh lives with his wife and four children, who range in age from 13 to 18 years old. Barsegh is farmer. His farm is big and successful, so he is able to provide his children with normal living conditions. He keeps three cows, calves, ten sheep and hens, as well as cultivates wheat and potatoes. His children help him with the farming activities and Barsegh is proud of that.

The requested loan will help Barsegh to purchase forage for feeding the cattle during the winter season, so the cattle will bring income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding his livestock during the winter season, so the livestock will bring income for the family.

loans.name: Mamata's Group

texts.en:
Mamata, aged 27 years, is the lady standing to the left in the photograph with her 2-year-old son. She is a single mother and lives with her parents in her parental house. She is a lady with strong willpower and determination and does not want to leave any stone unturned in order to get success.

Mamata is a hardworking woman who for many years has made decorative pieces to beautify homes. She sells them to the people in her community and in the local market.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Mamata will use her portion of the loan amount to buy paint brushes, paint and good-quality clay. She has a plan to use her income in painting her house and save a certain amount of money to shape up her son's future.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, paint and good-quality clay.

loans.name: Golap's Group

texts.en:
Golap, aged 32 years, is standing in an orange saree on the right side of the photograph. She is a differently abled lady and hails from a village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. Her husband works as an auto driver in the village and has an inconsistent income. As a parent of two children, Golap works hard to support her family.

She has an incense stick business in the village. Aimed with a dream of having a decent living, Golap is working really hard to improve her business.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Golap will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for her business like sticks, scented powder, glue, etc. in a bulk amount, which will reduce her operation cost and enable her to make incense sticks in a relative high quantity. This will add to her savings and she will be able to lead a quality life.

In the future, Golap aspires to build a new house for her family with whom she can live happily ever after.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business like sticks, scented powder, glue, etc. in a bulk amount.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Mary. She is fifty-seven years old, married and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2014.

Mary does maize, bean and dairy farming. She is grateful to HiH EA for developing an entrepreneurship spirit through training and mentorship. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase wire mesh to enable her to rear poultry in her home compound. By doing this, Mary hopes to raise a productive flock of chickens and satisfy the demand for chicken meat and eggs in the local market, hence getting a higher income. She hopes to use the sales income to support her family needs such as food and education for her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase wire mesh to enable her to rear poultry in her home compound.

loans.name: Blessed Mothers Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Scolah, a member of Blessed Mothers Women Group in Nakuru. She is 29 years old, married and the mother of four.

She does maize, potato and tomato farming. Through HiH EA training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits out of her business. Scolah is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds. This will boost her business, hence increasing her income which will enable her to cater for her children’s food and other needs for the family.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds. This will boost her business, hence increasing her income which will enable her to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
With the previous loan, Joyce managed to buy cosmetics and weaves for use in her salon. She is still operating a beauty saloon and also offers training in hair dressing in a busy street of Fort Portal town.

She hopes to build rentals, which will add more income at the end of the month. She faces the challenge of unpredictable price changes, which lowers her overall income.

Joyce needs another loan to buy salon chemicals and weaves for beautifying her clients during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy salon chemicals and weaves for beautifying her clients during this festive season.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en: Farangis was born in 1992. She is not married and she lives with her parents. She is a student of the fifth course in the Medical University of Tajikistan. She learns general medicine. Farangis studies well and she dreams of being a good specialist in the future. She reads many books from the Internet and library. She must pay for the university tuition but she has not an opportunity for it. Farangis is asking for a loan of 8,700 somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the university tuition.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 47-year-old lady who deals in confectionery and ice cream making. She stays in Seguku, a city suburb. She has done the business for the last eight years. She also does poultry keeping as another source of income.

She says she started the business when she quit government work to employ herself from home and also take better care of her children.

Her clients are mainly school children and also the local people whom she serves. Her biggest challenges are the high power bills and also how her cash flows are affected when the school term ends.

She hopes to use the money to buy creams and fat and also a bigger freezer for her business.

loans.use: to buy cream and fat for making ice cream.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 62 years old and married. She is from the small village of Bostana,. She is a hard worker who supports her husband in making their family's living and covering their increasing needs. They have only a small income from agricultural activity. They own a small vineyard and nut trees and seasonally sell the harvested products.

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps residents to make a living. Julieta decided to start a trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements.

Julieta requested a loan from Credo's startup program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. She plans to purchase stocks of products and open a general store in her village. She will work as a salesperson and will get the opportunity to earn a stable source of income and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a general store.

loans.name: Santoshini

texts.en:
Santoshini is a 27-year-old differently abled unmarried lady. She is a resident of Redhakhol, Odisha, India. She lives with her parents and her brother.

Santoshini is a tailor by profession and has been engaged in this activity for the past six years. She is unable to do marketing due to her precarious health condition. Her brother helps her to run her business. He brings necessary items required for her business from the nearby market. She has a large customer base and caters to their needs very efficiently.

She is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use the loan amount in order to purchase one more fully automated sewing machine and materials like colorful threads, cloth and grease for the smooth running of her sewing machine. This will help her reduce the turnaround time and upgrade her quality of service.

She is eagerly awaiting your kind help and she extends her heartiest thanks to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase one more fully automated sewing machine and materials like colorful threads, cloth and grease.

loans.name: St. Mary's School Rushoroza

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Remigio. He is the head teacher of St. Mary's College Rushoroza, a mixed school in the rural area of Kabale with 1,363 students.

St. Mary's College has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the students. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Mary's College will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Remigio ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of students who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Florence. She is fifty years old, married and the mother of six. She does maize and bean farming and also keeps dairy cows. Through HiH EA training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits from her business.

Florence is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. This will greatly boost her business, hence increasing income which will enable her to cater for her children's clothing, food and other needs for the family.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer that will boost farming, hence increasing income to cater for children's food and clothing needs.

loans.name: Kwenet Tree Planting Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady on the right wearing a black skirt is Judith. She is a member of Kwenet Tree Planting Self Help Group. She is 53 years old and blessed with four children.

She practices maize, bean and poultry farming. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings and enterprise development, she has gained more skills in business management. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva, which she intends to use in purchasing additional chicks that will help improve productivity. She looks forward to more income that will help cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

She is very grateful to Kiva and HiH EA for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks that will help improve productivity, thus increasing income to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Soeradj

texts.en: Soeradj is 28 years old and lives with his parents. He is recently married. Soeradj works together with his father in their fields. He has taken several loans from Seva MFI for rice cultivation. With the profits he bought a truck to work for his own and for other farms. He repaid those loans on time and wants to continue with rice cultivation. For this he needs a new loan of SRD 6,500 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. In the future he wants to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El joven Juan Carlos de 27  años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y su hija en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 03  años a la venta de Agua purificada el vende en fardos grandes y pequeños, botellones, jugos chavis, jugos de naranja, y otros, su venta la realiza en su vehículo de trabajo, el visita a sus clientes dos o tres veces por semana. Vive en san Antonio de flores al sur de Honduras
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de 4 llantas nuevas para su carro y de esta manera el tendrá su vehículo en perfectas condiciones de trabajo,  con este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de  trabajar  con prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio y poder más adelante comprarse  un carro para poder seguir trabajando

San Lorenzo valle Honduras  -  Septiembre  2015.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 27 years. He is married and lives with his wife and their daughter in their own house. For three years he has worked selling purified water. He sells large and small packages, in big jars, tropical fruit juices, orange juices, and other things. He sells from his work vehicle. He visits his customers two or three times a week. He lives in San Antonio de Flores, south from Honduras. He is requesting a loan to buy four new tires for his car, and in this way his vehicle will be in perfect working conditions. With this loan he wants to improve his income and his quality of life. He is a new customer with wishes to work with Prisma. His dream is to make his business grow and be able to buy a new car in the future so he can keep on working.

loans.use: to buy new tires so he can work with his vehicle.

loans.name: Diriisa

texts.en:
Diriisa is 48 years old, married, and has six children. He lives in Nabbingo. He deals in car spare parts and also has rental business to earn additional income. His biggest challenge is high city taxes which eat away most of his profit.

Dirisa requested a loan, which he will use to purchase spare parts from Japan. He hopes to use the increased income to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts from Japan for his motor spare parts sales business.

loans.name: Budu

texts.en:
Budu is a 28-year-old, married man from Khelvachauri district. He lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter.

Budu works at a local car wash and gets a small daily income. He decided to open his own car wash and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan.

With the received credit, he will purchase a special apparatus that is used for car washing. He already owns a space where the car wash will be opened.

Budu hopes that the business will be profitable for him, as he is very experienced in this field. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a car wash.

loans.name: Syakerya

texts.en:
Syakerya is a 38-year-old married man with five children ranging in age from 6 to 14 years in Fort Portal, Uganda. Four of his children attend school. He has a retail business selling general merchandise, and he has been in this business since 2001, serving his clients in a busy street of Fort Portal town. He has goals of increasing his business and educating his children to higher levels of learning.

Syakerya experiences the hardship of competition, which reduces his overall number of clients and thus lowers his profits. He has asked for a loan to help him buy beer, sodas, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is married and has two children. He is a farmer living in Maralik town of Shirak region. He specializes in raising livestock. Currently, Vachagan's farm includes two cows, calves and 150 hens. Because the barn that he owns is in bad condition, he has to keep his cattle at his relative's barn.

Vachagan requested a loan, which he will use to renovate his barn and purchase two oxen. He will be happy to receive this support and improve his farm, so his family's status is improved.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and to renovate his barn to keep the cattle during the coming winter.

loans.name: Boechan

texts.en: Boechan is 56 years old and lives together with his wife. Rice cultivation is the only source of income for the family. Boechan owns a second hand tractor for cultivation. His wife is actively involved with the rice cultivation. In 2013 Boechan first became eligible for a loan from Seva MFI. The loans he received from Seva MFI he was able to repay on time. With the profits of recent seasons he has expanded his house and did major maintenance on his tractor. The goal of the family is to save enough for their future. Boechan needs another loan of SRD 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mahesh

texts.en:
Mahesh is 45 years old and is a rice grower. He cultivated rice from an early age and learned it from his parents. In his spare time, he works as an operator for third parties.

Mahesh was formerly financing his input for rice cultivation through his paddy buyer, who was charging high interest rates and offering low prices. Since 2012, his input is being financed by Seva MFI, and now he gets a better price for his rice.

With the extra profits, he has now bought a second-hand tractor. His goal is to generate more savings by expanding the cultivated area. He needs a new loan of SRD 6,500.

loans.use: to buy the inputs for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario es un hombre de 54 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 21 y 28 años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Palopó.
Nazario desde hace 25 años se dedica  a la compra y venta de abarrotes, este negocio se ubica en la comodidad de su hogar, pero Nazario para mejorar sus ingresos trabaja como operador e instalador de cable visión de su comunidad. Nazario gracias a su buen servicio hacia los clientes mucha gente lo busca muy frecuentemente por esa razón a considerado necesario solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías tales como: golosinas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar.
Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nazario is a 54 year old married man with beautiful family of four children aged between 21 and 28. The family live in a community in San Antonio Palopó.

For the last 25 years Nazario has made a living from buying and selling groceries from the comfort of his own home. To supplement his income he also works installing cable television in his neighbourhood.


People often come to Nazario because the service he provides to his customers is so good. As a result of this demand he has decided it necessary to ask for a loan to buy grocery stock such as snacks, sodas, rice and sugar.

Nazario's ambition in life is to build up his business and to be able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as; snacks, sodas, rice and sugar.

loans.name: New Abc Divine School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is David. He is the Head teacher of New ABC Divine School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mutundwe in Kampala with 350 students. New ABC Divine School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

New ABC Divine School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. David ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is married and has one child. She is a farmer in Lernapat village. Her child is a migrant worker in a neighboring country, where he works to sustain his parents' living.

Susanna and her husband, following their family tradition, have been involved in farming for many years. They are raising five cows, two piglets, and eight calves on the farm. Near the house, in their arable land, Susanna and her husband also cultivate potatoes and different types of fruit trees, including plum, walnut, apple, and pear.

Susanna requested a loan, which she will use to purchase three sows and forage for feeding the cattle. She hopes to further develop her farm.

loans.use: to purchase three sows and forage for feeding the cattle.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 45 and the mother of three grown-up children. Her husband works as a migrant worker in a neighboring country because of the high unemployment rate and low capital access in Anushavan village of the Shirak region.

To tackle her financial hardships, Lusine has been running a farming business. She keeps cattle of four calves, cows, and some hens. For the most part, her income comes from cultivation of potato, garlic and beets to sell at the local market.

Lusine requested this loan to ask lenders for the investment in her farming business. She plans to purchase two piglets, forage for feeding the cattle, and fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation to sustain the farm during the coming cold season.

Lusine would be grateful to receive this support and gather income for her family's basic needs. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's status and also increase her agribusiness level.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets, forage for feeding the cattle, and fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation to sustain the farm during the coming cold season.

loans.name: Waston  Britin

texts.en:
Waston Britin is a new client of UGAFODE who has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. He primarily deals in local foods, especially bananas, fresh beans, matooke ready for cooking. He is strategically located in the city suburb with a ready market, but his major challenge is the distances where he picks up these goods that are on demand daily.

He humbly requests the Kiva funders to increase his funding in order to help him generate more income to sustain his family. He will buy stock of yellow bananas using the loan funds.

In the photograph is Waston with the UGAFODE credit staffer (in a tie) in charge of his loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Grupo San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Elvia es una joven de 24 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá.
Elvia (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es  amable, disciplinada y perseverante por sus sueños,  ella trabaja como maestra de una academia de mecanografía  privada tiene dos años de realizar esta actividad que es de donde proviene sus ingresos. Elvia es la representante del grupo San Bartolo pues posee liderazgo. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un equipo de sonido para su hogar, pues desde hace mucho a deseado poder equipar su hogar y ofrecerle a su familia mejor estabilidad, pero esto no le había sido posible.
Elvia pagará su préstamo con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo y de su negocio de cosméticos. Su esperanza de vida es mejorar sus ingresos económicos y contar con su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elvia is a 24-year old young woman. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in a neighborhood of Sololá.

Elvia (who is on the right in the above photograph) is friendly, disciplined and determined to make her dreams come true. She works as a teacher at a private typing academy and has for the last two years. Her income comes from that job. Elvia is the manager of the San Bartolo community bank, as she possess leadership qualities. She is requesting a loan to purchase sound equipment for her home. For a long time she has wanted to outfit her home and offer her family improved stability, but it hasn't been possible.

Elvia will pay off her loan with the incomes she earns from her job and her cosmetics business. Her life's hope is to improve her income and have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sound equipment for her home.

loans.name: Nora Alexandra

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer muy esforzada y trabajadora de treinta y ocho años de edad, ella descubrió en el comercio su vocación, ella trabaja distribuyendo leche y productos derivados de esta. Todos los días inicia su día a las cuatro de la mañana para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Su negocio ha sido tan prospero que con sus ganancias ha logrado comprar cerdos, para criarlos y luego venderlos.  
Ella ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva junto MiCrédito, para comprar mayor cantidad de leche y hacer un contrato formal por seis meses con un proveedor de leche, dado que ya no le resulta estar pagándole todos los días por los galones que vende. En el futuro desea comprar más cerdos y abrir un criadero, equipado con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Nora is a very courageous, hard-working, thirty-eight year old woman .  

She found her vocation in commerce.  She works by distributing milk and products derived from this. Every day she starts her day at four o'clock in the morning to meet customer orders.

Her business has been so prosperous that with the profits she has managed to purchase pigs to raise and then re-sell.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva through MiCrédito to purchase more milk and make a formal six-month contract with a supplier of milk, since it is no longer paying for her to purchase milk by the gallon every day. 

In the future she would like to purchase more pigs and open a breeding place equipped with everything she might need.

loans.use: To purchase more milk.

loans.name: Global High Ntungamo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Aggrey. He is the head teacher of Global High School, a mixed school in the rural area of Ntungamo with 400 students.

Global High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Global High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Aggrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Standard College School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Boaz. He is the head teacher of Standard College School, a mixed school in the rural area of Ntungamo with 1,300 students.

Standard College School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Standard College School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Boaz ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa interior femenina (LA CUARTA DE LA IZQUIERDA POLERA BLANCA Y PANTALON CELESTE GEANS). El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando ropa interior femenina, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo rotar toda la mercadería. Actualmente su negocio se estabiliza y tiene la necesidad constante de reponer la mercadería para que sus clientes retornen, “vendemos la ropa y la debemos reponer antes de que los clientes vuelvan otra vez…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para reponer la mercadería vendida. Su sueño es tener su propio negocio en casa, ella desea comprar ropa interior femenina por mayor para reponer la que vendió. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa interior femenina por mayor para reponer la que vendió.
texts.en:
María (the fourth on the left, wearing a white polo shirt and light blue jeans) continues her business selling lingerie. She invested the loan she obtained in the purchase of women’s underwear. Her repayment was punctual because she was able to move all the merchandise.

Currently the business is stabilized and she has the constant need to replenish the merchandise so that her customers will return, “we sell the clothes and replenish the merchandise before the customers come back again …” she relates. Her business’s advantage is that it has regular customers; its disadvantage is the lack of money to replenish the merchandise sold.

Her dream is to have her own business at home; she wishes buy women’s underwear wholesale to replenish what she sold. This is her 2nd loan cylce with the institution in the six years she has spent in this occupation. It is for these reasons that María is requesting a loan to buy women’s underwear wholesale to replenish what she has sold.

loans.use: buy women’s underwear wholesale to replenish what she has sold.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Lorena de 32  años de edad, vive en su casa propia, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella , se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de ropa  usada y nueva, ella vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis,  y otros  más,  vive en    San Lorenzo Valle al sur de Honduras.
 La señora es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos  fardos  de Ropa Clasificada,  con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un clienta con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  para tener mejores ingresos 

San Lorenzo Honduras -  septiembre de 2015
texts.en:
Claudia is 32 years old. She lives in her own home. She doesn't have any children who are dependent upon her. For 5 years she has been in the business of selling used and new clothing. She sells, among other things, pants, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, bras, bikinis, dresses, shorts, men's underwear and tights. She lives in San Lorenzo Valle in southern Honduras..

Claudia is an entrepreneurial woman who wishes to move forward and is determined every day to improve her quality of life. She is requesting this loan to buy two bales of sorted clothing. With the support of this loan she hopes to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a client with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and to increase her customers in order to have a better income.

San Lorenzo Honduras - septiembre de 2015

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, and children's clothing for her business.
